results.description:
Join us for an open-format discussion of effective altruism topics! If anyone would like to make announcements or propose a discussion topic feel free to do so.

For newcomers, read on:

If you aren't already familiar with the wider EA movement, I'm glad to have reached your eyeballs! Effective altruism is about recognizing the importance of using our lives to do the most good we can and looking for ways to help others that are high-impact and well-supported by evidence. This approach may sound obvious, but careful consideration of the impact of different strategies for doing good can lead to some surprising, and even controversial, conclusions. Ethical philosophy, career strategies, economics, and persuasion methods play important roles in these considerations, so EA attracts smart people and provides intellectually invigorating topics of discussion.

A great way to start learning about our perspective is to watch Peter Singer's TED talk: 
http://www.ted.com/talks/peter_singer_the_why_and_how_of_effective_altruism?language=en

If it piques your interest, have a look through the introductory links on the Effective Altruism Forum, or read Will MacAskill's excellent book on the topic, Doing Good Better -- and let us know what you think!

Feel free to send me a message if you'd like to know more. Hope to see you there!

-Chris
results.name: Effective altruism meetup in Kips Bay

results.description:
D&D Encounters is an episodic-format event designed to allow new players to join in and learn D&D in a casual, pick-up game. Seasoned players with erratic schedules can easily hop in and out of Encounters; unlike a traditional campaign, DMs and players will rotate, resulting in a dynamic game experience. We are using the latest edition of D&D (5e) and each session lasts about 3-4 hours, easily fitting into your work or school schedule, and presents a new and exciting challenge each week. The $10 fee covers your use of the playspace, though committing to 10 weeks grants the player a discount.


We're always on the lookout for DM talent for this season-- volunteers keep programs like this one alive! However, more important than veteran DMs, Encounters is a place where even new players should feel comfortable testing out the DMing waters. Every Saturday we provide our DMs with that week's "adventure chunk", a set of 2-3 encounters in one simple, easy-to-read packet. This bite-sized DMing format is ideal for new DMs and veterans who don't have the time to create an entire campaign from scratch, and allow lots of room for alterations and improvisations as the DM sees fit. DMs who volunteer their time do not pay the $10 fee, and receive a steep discount on our D&D related products.


For our first session, we will be creating level 1 characters and running a brief "test run" of our new adventurers as they get their footing the world of the Forgotten Realms. It won't be long before we're on the road to great deeds, so you won't want to miss this great opportunity to get to know your fellow heroes!

Please private message Timm with any questions regarding DMing, the event, or anything else RPG related!
results.name: Brooklyn Strategist Presents: D&D Encounters, Rage of Demons

results.description:
• We’ve all made mistakes, and we’ve all had others hurt and wound us — sometimes in ways that scar us emotionally. Inevitably, these hurts hold us back from all God wants to do in and through our lives. In this class, we’ll have a fantastic time networking and having fun, but we'll also take the time to work through hurts, habits, and hang-ups by letting Jesus heal and transform the heart, mind, and emotions. We'll all learn biblical strategies for working with God to deal with and heal those emotional wounds that negatively affect us.

In a safe and supportive environment, we’ll address the following issues:

• emotional wounds from past relationships

• sexual trauma

• wounds from fatherlessness

• family wounds

• rejection wounds

• addictions (drugs, alcohol, gambling, etc.)

• pornography/sex addiction

• emotional ties to past boyfriends/girlfriends

• divorce

• depression

• suicidal thoughts

• anger problems

• anxiety issues

• spending problems

• general unhealthy thinking patterns

• people pleasing

• codependency

• control & manipulation

• and much more!

This will be an uplifting class, and no matter what you've gone through, God can and will help you work through it.

Who: Men & Women, Singles & Couples

Dates of Class: Every Wednesday from February 24 - March 30 (6 classes)

Day & Time: Wednesday Evenings 7:00-9:00pm

Location: 48 Wall Street (5th Floor), ManhattanCost: FREE

IMPORTANT: Due to Wall Street security, doors will lock 15 minutes after start time, so be sure to be on time. If you come late, please text[masked] or[masked] and we will send someone from the meeting to let you in the door.

http://www.hopehill.com

#HopeHillNYC

results.description:
Note the later time! 

We'll meet in front of MP Taverna for a loop run along Buckout St to Mercy College, through Dobbs Ferry and back. Afterward, everyone is welcome to stop in at MP Taverna for drinks and/or eats.

Details about the run

Route: We’ll leave promptly at 7 pm from the parking lot in front of MP Taverna. We'll head south on Buckout St and Half Moon Lane and then we'll use the little wooded short cut to the Ardsley Train Station. We'll run past the station, veer right onto the lit walking path into the Mercy College campus, and through the campus, exiting on to Broadway at Landing Dr. We'll head south on Broadway and then we'll weave through Ardsley Park, taking Langdon to Belmont to Field Terrace to Osceola, before exiting right onto Broadway for the run back to Irvington. A route map is available here. 

Modifications for a shorter/slower-paced run: At various points runners can divert east toward Broadway and head back to Irvington.

Water/Bag Storage: There are no water fountains along the route, so bring a water bottle if you need one while running. I’ll bring water and cups for after the run. There’s no bag storage, so leave belongings at home or in your car.


Location: MP Taverna parking lot (One Bridge St, Irvington, NY)

Join our Facebook group to post pictures or message other members.

General advice & guidelines for our regular meetup runs

• RSVP if you are going. If your plans change, simply change your RSVP.

• There is no bag storage, so please bring only what you plan to run with.

• All regular runs are rain or shine, unless the weather is actually dangerous.

• If you arrive late, can’t find the start location, miss us for any reason, run anyway!

• If you missed RSVP deadline, and know our starting point, feel free to join us on the day – just this one time :)

Feel free to contact me either via my meetup account or at [masked] if you have any questions.
results.name: Irvington to Dobbs Ferry Loop

Traits for Success | Biking in Brooklyn | Building Community | Ice Cream

"This is going to be big..."

Charlie O'Donnell, Founder of Brooklyn Bridge Ventures

Charlie O'Donnell is arguably the leading voice in the Brooklyn startup community, and that's why we're thrilled to climb with him on February 24th. He's been a long time advocate for the community, fostering genuine connections through his now-famous dinner parties. Charlie has been one of the driving forces behind the Brooklyn startup community. From the origins of Twitter, to running up the stairs of the empire state building, and even investing in ice cream company... we'll cover it all.


This one's not just for developers and startup junkies. You should attend if you have a crazy business idea, can ride a bike, are training for a marathon, or even just love Brooklyn.

Have questions for Charlie? Send them to us ahead of time at [masked]!

7:00pm - 8:30pm - Indoor rock climbing. All levels of climbing experience welcome, gear included!

8:45pm - 9:30pm - Charlie talks about how he got started, his mentors, and all things Brooklyn.

9:30pm - 11:00pm - Beers at Brooklyn Boulders.

Make sure to buy your tickets on our Eventbrite page!

results.description:
Do you ever feel your mind is like a fish tank buzzing with thoughts? We go from home to work to play, and all day our mind is buzzing with thoughts -

“what if my rent increases?”,


“What if the store’s closed?”,


“What if…”  


It’s an endless cycle that blocks the joy and beauty of connecting with the moment.  


What if you could let go of all these “what ifs” What if you could live lighter, clearer and calmer with just a few minutes of practice?   You can, and the secret is in your breath.

Join us for a free preview of The Happiness program.

The Happiness Program teaches several practical and powerful tools to help you discover your unlimited happiness and freedom - not as a concept, but as a direct experience. You will discover that you can be happy, whatever the situation, and live a deeply fulfilling life.


Start your new year on a positive note. Join us for meditation!


More @ Behappymc.org

results.description:
Take A Whisk! Reinvention At Any Age, with Chef Rachel Reuben, a Food Network Chopped Champion, food writer and teacher who changed her life by going to culinary school at age 52. Her inspirations may have a culinary twist, but you don't have to love to cook to get "stirred up" and inspired by her humorous and poignant tale of reinvention. During this workshop you’ll begin to write your own Recipe for Reinvention with Chef Reuben’s help. Whether you get a taste of what it could be like to live a long-forgotten dream, or gather the ingredients for a new one, you will come away with real-world ideas for making the rest of your life a delicious expression of who you are! There is no cost to attend but there is limited seating so reserve your spot today!


Reuben is a Food Network’s Chopped Champion, a freelance food writer and founder of a successful NY metro area recreational cooking school, Food Fix Kitchen. She has appeared on ABC’s Good Morning America several times and contributes to the abcnews.com Food Page. She has brought her culinary skills, living-well credo and message of “reinvention at any age” to schools, corporations, medical centers, destination spas, women’s groups and charity events. Chef Reuben also heads a new healthy dining initiative at Rutgers University. The project takes the form of a new “from-scratch” restaurant, Harvest, which reflects the mission of the NJ Institute of Food, Nutrition and Health on Rutgers’ Cook Campus in New Brunswick.

</a> Chef, Rachel Reuben

results.description:
Welcome to AI @ CUMC.

We are hosting this first Meetup at the WordUp bookstore. It is a hippie dippy community library within walking distance of the medical center. 

Like mentioned before, the goal is to create a laid back place where the spirit of the coffeehouse culture of the Enlightenment meets the modern day hackerspace. This is a place where people can freely and openly kick back and share ideas, write code, and contribute towards the learning and development of AI. All are welcomed. All that is required an open mind, a tolerance and respect for new ideas, and the daring to try something new. 

CUMC is one of the world's leading research centers in the world, attracting some of the world's best minds to engage in breath taking research. Yet, it seems like there isn't much cross fertilization of ideas over what could potential revolutionize how science, our economy or society will work; no talk of artificial intelligence. It is also strange that although New York is the second best place for technology companies in the country, not much attention has paid been to CUMC. This meetup presents a great opportunity to finally begin to address these issues in a meaningful way.


I am still working on the subject of this first meetup. Given the nature of AI, I am leaning towards asking two question: "What are the ethics of AI?" and "What are some current advancements in AI?", then see where it goes from there.

As always, if you have a suggestion leave it in the discussion section.

Thank you again for joining.

Edit 2/11/2016:
Shout out to Leila who suggested that the first question should be: "Why your interest in AI?".

And so it shall be.

results.name: 1st AI @ CUMC meeting

results.description:
“…to be successful in life you need values, you need integrity, you need a vision, you need energy, and you need dynamism. And spirituality is the one thing that gives it all to you. If you are healthy, you can see better, you can eat better, you can speak better, you can hear better and you can run better. All this depends on just one thing. Similarly that which enriches your spirit is so essential to enrich all other aspects of life.” -Sri Sri Ravi Shankar, Founder, Art of Living Foundation

Whatever we do in life, it is all directed towards being happy. Why do we even do some service to somebody? It is because it gives some happiness to us. So anything we do in our life is directed towards achieving happiness, greater happiness, and even greater happiness. That’s how the mind goes. Yet, are we happy? Yes, some times. But often not!

This free seminar examines what comes in the way of our happiness. There will be a discussion on tools that can lead us to happiness – tools that every human being is privileged to learn and use. Come, relax, refresh and smile.

Futsal Pick up games (intermediate to advanced level)

Fee: $10 dollars per player per game; pay through paypal.

Only 10 players per game, no subs (the roster shows 11 spots only because it includes the organizer who will play if needed). One game is 55-60 minutes. Please come a little early so that we all can start on time and play 1 solid hour. Goal keeper rotation every 5-6 minutes. We play without a break. Regulation size goals with nets. Futsal ball. Please make sure to bring a white and a red t-shirt (if you don't have red, a solid dark will do), indoor shoes. Games are competitive, but friendly. Please keep in mind that these games are definitely not for the beginners. Please no fouls, zero tolerance to this. “Futsal is not a physical but a technical game ”. Minimum physical contact means fewer injuries and no violence.

Jaime Arias

Come join us for our climbing Meetup!!

As usual, everyone is welcome to join in on the fun as long as you're at least 18 years old, whether you’re a complete beginner just looking to give the sport a try or a seasoned veteran that can show the best of us a few new tricks. Bring your friends too, even if they've never tried climbing before. We'll make sure everybody is set up and having a blast. Age and strength don't even matter, everybody has fun.

1st time climbers at The Rock Club get in for FREE! All you have to do is rent a harness and shoes for $10.25. Returning Meetupers get a discounted daypass rate of $15. And be sure to have a look out at the gym for other special Meetup discounts.

We also host a special Meetup 101 class from 7:30 - 9pm for Meetup members only. When multiple people sign-up for the class you pay only $45 ($15 discount!).

Reserve your spot with the booking button and enter the promo code "Meetup" on the booking page.

IMPORTANT!!  This offer has restrictions. It is only valid for the Weds night Meetup 101 class, you must already be a meetup member and RSVP for the meetup as well (no guests).

</a>

<a href="http://bookeo.com/climbrockclub?type=2126XUFJR1387C98D3A8">

If this is your first time climbing just come on in and join the group. There’s no need to take the class just yet. You’ll be able to join other Meetup members who already have their belay certification. This way you’ll be able to get up and on the wall right away! When you decide that you absolutely love climbing (which you will!), then you can sign up for the class the following week.

As a heads up, when you come into the gym, the front desk staff will get you set up with gear and get you in the system. There will also be name tags for everyone. Wear them with pride so everyone knows who’s a part of Meetup!

DETAILS - Please read carefully!

RSVPing and Questions:
If you're attending the belay course you MUST call TRC to reserve your space.
If you have any questions, please email TRC directly: [url][masked][/url]

Time:
The closer to 7pm you arrive, the better. The 101 class starts at 7:30 sharp.

Directions & Transportation:
Please save time and aggravation by getting directions from our website (BEFORE you call or email us for directions :-). If you're coming on Metro North as a group (2 or more people!) we'll pick you up from the train station. Use the message baord to connect with other riders.  Just give us a call to let us know when you'll arrive. Go to the taxi stand in front of the station building!

We're looking forward to seeing you soon!
results.name: Weekly Climbing Meetup - New members climb for free!!

results.description:
This month we have Jim Savage talking machine learning.

Please note the new location, Civic Hall, courtesy of Bloomberg and the later start time of 7:30.

We are just about ready to release tickets to the 2016 New York R Conference!  We are going to have a great lineup again this year so stay tuned.

About the talk:

Often, fairly simple parametric models are preferable to complex machine learning methods. Two common examples are in time-series work, where the data are not independent and dependencies need to be modeled explicitly, and in causal research, where consistent estimates of the parameters themselves are the primary object of interest. Jim will discuss the usefulness of the Random Forest's proximity matrix in this sort of work. He will present two new methods: 

- Proximity matching: A technique for building synthetic control groups for causal analysis on observational data. This method largely overcomes both the dimensionality issues and Smith-Todd critique of other matching methods.

- Analogy weighting: A method for constructing weights to use in time-series models. This weighting scheme allows researchers to give weight to relevant periods of history and ignore irrelevant periods. In doing so, it frees modelers from having to decide on a look-back window for estimation.


About Jim:

Jim Savage is Data Science Lead at Lendable, a frontier markets finance start-up. He recently moved to NY from Australia, where he worked at a leading think-tank on pensions policies, and in macroeconomic modeling at the Australian Treasury. In 2014, he was a fellow at the University of Chicago's Data Science for Social Good fellowship (hurry! 2016 applications close soon).

Pizza begins at 7:30, the talk shortly after and then we'll head to a local bar.
results.name: Augmenting Simple Parametric Models with Machine Learning

results.description:
No troupe is better at reinventing classic fairy tales than Company XIV. Its version of the Brothers Grimm's Snow White, now off-Broadway at the Minetta Lane Theater, is exquisitely imagined through dance. The Queen is forever asking her magic mirror: "Who is the fairest?"

When the answer names a rival even more beautiful, it's time to up the stakes. Extreme envy, vanity and pride translate into murderous intentions. The Queen dons a series of increasingly clever disguises, including a Spanish mantilla and Day of the Dead masks, to search her prey: Snow White.

The poisoned apple, glass coffin, the charming prince and the Seven Dwarfs make notable appearances -- but not always in conventional form. That's the genius of XIV; it combines cabaret, circus arts, ballet and both classical and pop music to produce a singular spectacle.
results.name: Off Broadway: Snow White by Company XIV $40 🎭

Street parking is free after 6pm, and there is a large municipal lot across Central Ave from City Limits (24hr meters in the lot).

The first rehearsal is free. Subsequent rehearsals are $10/rehearsal or a discounted annual rate.

results.description:
Let's play Crokinole on Wednesday nights!


Don't know Crokinole? It's like a table-top version of curling, shuffleboard, darts and billiards. If you like just one of these games, you'll probably dig Crokinole.

To learn more about this traditional Canadian game (circa 1860) and about our specific weekly sessions at Milk and Roses, then read the papers!


We've been in a few rags lately, and the best-written article is this one... from the Toronto Star: http://www.thestar.com/news/insight/2015/07/26/crokinole-gains-a-following-in-brooklyn-thanks-to-canadian-expat.html

Same place as usual: Milk and Roses (1110 Manhattan Ave in Greenpoint, between Dupont and Clay).

Same time as usual: 7:30pm 'till close.

Please RSVP if you'd like to join in! If I know how many people are coming, then I can be sure to have enough boards present and polished for plenty of playing time for all :)

results.description:
A weekly dynamic dance meditation, an exploration into ourselves, our bodies, connection to spirit, love, truth, play, heal, grow with the unique practice of the 5Rhythms. 

There are no right or wrong moves, no choreography or steps, the body naturally opens up and follows the wave of music and energy. Curiosity, willingness to move, layered comfortable clothing, water bottle, bare feet - is all that is required. The rest is up to the dance.

Through unscripted, free-form movement we unlock potential, get un-stuck and invite creativity to flow through us. Join our alive, heart-throbbing, truth seeking, transforming-sweat-to-gold, growing and mighty moving group!

Closest subway: A/C/E, D/F/V to West 4th St. Open to everyone. No pre-registration required. Cost: $15 per person. Cash only, please. Thank you!

results.description:
Having trouble fully absorbing A Course in Miracles (ACIM) or another non-dualistic spiritual tradition? Then A COURSE OF LOVE may be just for you! Channeled by the same voice that authored ACIM but in more easy to understand and feminine language, Mari Perron’s A Course of Love speaks to the heart rather than the mind. Let’s explore this important new text together and use it as a springboard to become peaceful miracle workers. Led by CRS co-founders and ACIM Teachers/Healers Yasuko Kasaki and Christopher Pelham, this class work its way through the text week by week. 

We're just starting (fall 2015) but you can join in later any time. Like yoga, it's really more experiential than progressive learning.

You can easily order the book online from Amazon or BN.com, and e-book versions are available.

It may be astonishing to hear that there is a “continuation” of A Course in Miracles, but it is true. Forty years ago Jesus dictated ACIM to the scribe Helen Schucman. More recently, over three years, he similarly dictated A Course of Love. Jesus himself referred to what he was dictating as a “continuation of A Course in Miracles.” Students of ACIM will recognize the Voice. Students of truth, whatever their background, will find that ACOL resonates with the heart.

A Course of Love builds upon the same non-dualistic thought system as ACIM, yet it is a course for the heart. ACOL and ACIM work hand-in-hand. Yet remarkably, ACOL bypasses the mind. It uses thought to go beyond thought. Those yearning to access the heart’s knowing will find help here. This is your invitation to live the purposeful, meaningful life of the new—the reality of heaven on earth.

Wednesday nights from 8 – 9:30 pm at CRS
Classes are $20 and class cards are available.
results.how_to_find_us: above Think Coffee shop (look for the brown door and ring the bottom buzzer)

results.description:
This is a weekly improv class appropriate for all levels (including beginners) taught every Wednesday from 8-10pm.  The focus will be on scenework, rather than games.

-- Are you a bit shy and looking to get more comfortable with your public speaking? 


-- Are you a working professional hoping to be a bit more spontaneous during your meetings and interactions with co-workers? 

-- Or are you an actor or improv comedian looking to take your craft to the next level or get more reps?

Then this is the class for you! In this class, you will learn the fundamentals of scene work (role playing). You'll be on your feet quite a bit as I'm believer that you learn (and have more fun) through doing rather than hearing an instructor talk. Brief individual notes will be given, if that's what you're looking for, and tailored to your level of experience. At the end of each class, I'm confident you'll feel a sense of accomplishment that will leave you more energized and excited to tackle the challenges of everyday life, whether at your work place or in your personal life. 

Each class is $10, and the fee is used to help cover the cost of the room rental, Meetup fees, and website.  The class will be capped at 14 students to make sure that you have sufficient time to be on your feet.  Guaranteed satisfaction or your money back.  

Hope to see you there,

Steve

www.improvnow.com

www.facebook.com/improvnow

Steve Ling is an alumnus of the improv programs of the Upright Citizens Brigade, Peoples Improv Theater, Magnet Theater, & Annoyance Theater.  He regularly produces and performs improv, musical improv, & hip hop improv across NYC.
results.name: Improv NOW! - Wednesday Improv Scenework Class 8-10pm ($10)

results.description:
Come and join us for an evening of fun and TurnOn. How often do we get an opportunity to be real with each other in NYC?


We play 3 communication game (you can play at whatever level feels comfortable to you). Imagine meeting new people in an environment where people felt comfortable to be themselves. That's what we have created.

It's a refreshing change from the typical networking or bar conversation.

You get the opportunity to examine yourself. Through other people putting quality attention on you, asking questions with genuine curiosity, and then listening - really listening – to your responses.

What comes up might surprise you!

At the end of the evening we will tell you all about how you can learn the practice of Orgasmic Meditation. What class you can take and what we have to offer so you can have the life that you want.

It's amazing how connected we can end up feeling - even in a room full of strangers - when we are willing to say what's real. In an hour and some you may even forget for a moment you are in New York City.

OneTaste NYC is an organization teaches Orgasmic Meditation, otherwise known as OM. The games we play at TurnON are designed to create the visceral sensation of Orgasm/OM in your body, without having to actually do the practice (or remove any clothing!).

It's a friendly invitation to play and push your edges in a way that feels good. This allows you to stretch yourself and inspires self-discovery!

Come early, doors close at 8:10p.  

COST TO ATTEND IS $10.

For info contact [masked]

Can't make this one?  visit us at www.turnonny.us

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=8OWkv9zms4E
results.name: TurnON New York City

results.description:
Want to get out of the house or studio and refresh your artistic skills or just enjoy figure drawing? Looking to meet new local people, network and exchange ideas and have fun? Come and join us at the Figure Drawing Wednesday!

Location? Eckford Street Studio on

70 Eckford Street, Brooklyn NY 11222

Time? Wednesday from 8pm-10pm

Come and explore your talents and enjoy an evening focused on figure drawing from a live model. No need to be a pro just bring the material you feel comfortable to work with and enjoy a creative evening!

Prices for the fall are:

$75 for 5 sessions

Drop-ins are welcome $17

On going sessions....

Bring your own drink too!

You can register on </a>http://goo.gl/forms/uMojjWgnCY

for more info please call (347)[masked] or email [masked]

About the Host

Hilda Abla - aka "Hildos" is a Lebanese-Armenian artist living in Brooklyn. She started her artistic ventures at age five at the children's program at Lebanese American University, the same institution where she earned her Bachelor of Fine Arts years later. Her painting studies continued at the School of Visual Arts, and she has exhibited her work in Beirut and New York, and been featured in magazines New York Art Magazine and Art Fuse. She believes that art comes with a responsibility, and her latest work is committed to changing the way women view their bodies and themselves. You can view her work at <a href="http://hildos.com">hildos.com , including her TEDx talk on "Seeing Beauty in Imperfection".

results.description:
At the last meeting we arranged for board members to see a potential new space.

At this meeting, I'm hoping we'll be hearing from our board members about how great this space is and how we should turn it into our very own 24-hour access MakerSpace.

Last time, Jesse build one of his clover leaf antennas, tuned it to a perfect 1.0 SWR and then added hot-glue to it.

Adding hot glue detuned the antenna significantly.

Next, we placed hot glue and plasti-dip in paper containers (along w/ a cup of water) in a microwave oven and ran it for 2 minutes. The hot glue and plasti-dip did not heat-up significantly. (after 2 minutes, the water was steaming)

We concluded that Hot Glue and Plasti-dip do not absorb significant amounts of microwave energy. Unfortunately, Hot Glue still de-tunes the antenna, probably by way of a capacitive effect. The solution to this is probably to make the antenna more inductive. But how, by how much and how to determine when the ideal value is reached is still in question.

Jesse also suggested (I assume jokingly) that we could all get into clover-leaf antenna building for fun and profit. Since he's got a 2-month backlog of antenna work, maybe that's a real possibility? He got several willing volunteers so maybe we'll find out how that worked out for him.

Also, there was a lot of discussion of Twilight-Zone plots. James discovered that one of the plots I brought up was an Outer Limits episode called "Nightmare".

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Wur16G_88VA

.and there was a question about our glowforge, which we expect to be delivered sometime in the July timeframe.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ysCaqh38JVQ

AFAIK: we're not going to push to get into the glowforge "beta" program and it's probably too late for that anyway.

Finally:

We've been having some technical difficulties getting this meetup account paid for. So... Just in case this meetup account gets suspended, our users should go to www.islandlabs.org, click on the Mailing List link and subscribe to our mailing list.
results.name: Get us a physical Maker Space and our members onto the virtual Mailing List

results.description:
Futsal Pick up games (intermediate to advanced level)

Fee: $10 dollars per player per game; pay through paypal.

Only 10 players per game, no subs (the roster shows 11 spots only because it includes the organizer who will play if needed). One game is 55-60 minutes. Please come a little early so that we all can start on time and play 1 solid hour. Goal keeper rotation every 5-6 minutes. We play without a break. Regulation size goals with nets. Futsal ball. Please make sure to bring a white and a red t-shirt (if you don't have red, a solid dark will do), indoor shoes. Games are competitive, but friendly. Please keep in mind that these games are definitely not for the beginners. Please no fouls, zero tolerance to this. “Futsal is not a physical but a technical game ”. Minimum physical contact means fewer injuries and no violence.

more info at [masked]

Thank you,

Jaime Arias

Aside from our League play we offer Open Play 6 days a week. 1 hour and 45 minute sessions only $11 midweek.

Format: 3 teams of 5 per court. Score by 1’s. Games to 7. Winner stays but must sit after 2 games. No refs. Call your own. Our moderator will help things along. All players must bring a white and a dark shirt (not grey). This is a friendly run. Anyone with the wrong attitude will not be allowed back. Age: 21+

Our open runs are designed for good fun and a run. The A / B breakdown is purely a self rating device to try and split things up in an enjoyable manner. Think of it as if you were going to the park to play. If you are average or above go to the A court. If you are average or below go to B.  It is not exact. There is always going to be some crossover.  

***Please note- RSVP'g on Meetup will not reserve your spot. Please go to our website to sign up.*** A credit card payment is required to reserve your space. Just click the session that interests you.

results.description:
Forch of Nature Music Group proudly presents: "The Shed".

The Shed is a monthly jam session catering to New York City's hottest Hip Hop, Soul and Jazz musicians. The showcase is a platform for progressive music as well as a place for artist to build their chops. While occasionally heating the stage themselves, The Shed's hosts Anu~Sun, Augi and Bria Monèt will introduce you to some of New York's finest underground talent and surprise guests.

To learn more about The Shed, visit them on Instagram: www.instagram.com/theshedopenjam

Below is a music vibe example of The Shed house band when they were at Tammany Hall in early 2014, led by HarlemGo Meetup member Anu The Giant, however all genre of music is welcome to come share their talent.

http://youtu.be/Rg3PmE6dAAQ

Past Performances at #TheShed Include:

Robert Glasper, James Poysner (of The Roots), Mark Kelley (of The Roots), Raymond Angry (of The Roots), RC and The Gritz (Erykah Badu’s backing band), Big Yuki, Marcus Strickland, Jaleel Shaw, Jerimiah Abiah

Our Meetup

Daniel will be downstairs in Silvana at 9:00pm to hold seats for group members attending. Showtime starts around 9:30pm and goes to midnight. If you are interested in performing this evening, be sure to arrive early (between 9:30-10:00pm) and sign-up on the performing list at the venue. As always, if there are any questions, you're running late, etc. feel free to reach him at 774.275.3646.

Directions of Silvana:

Silvana is located at 300 W 116th St., between Frederick Douglass Blvd. (8th Ave.) and Manhattan Ave. in Central Harlem. The closest subway stop is the B & C local train lines to the 116th Street station. Nearby bus lines include the M10, M7, & M3.

HIIT, as the name suggests, combines high-intensity, calorie-torching periods of activity with low-intensity recovery periods for an overall duration of as little as 10 minutes each session. Some studies have shown that HIIT burns up to nine times more fat than traditional cardiovascular exercise and keeps your metabolism elevated for more than 24 hours afterwards. This means you are going to keep burning calories long after you have finished exercising.

Boot Camp Workout. This intense circuit keeps your heart rate up, burns calories, and tones your whole body. With these circuits we will use body weight exercises alternating with calisthenics.

One catch – YOU bring your own coffee :-) (I will bring the bagels.)

Schedule for 2016

Bfast @AXA: 8-9:30AM

Happy Hour @Ainsworth Park 6-8PM

results.description:
LEADER:  Mario Medici ([masked] (pref.) or[masked]- 9391)

RATING: B 4 C+

 A leisurely 4-mile hike around picturesque Sterling Lake. Plan on stopping at the “beach” for a short break, so be sure to bring a snack and water. Park car in Visitor Parking lot and meet at Visitor’s Center (across the road) at 10:00AM. Call cell before 9:00 AM if weather is questionable. TC Sterling Forest map 100.  

*   *   *   *   *   *

Our full hike schedule can be viewed on our website at hudsonhikers.org, and some hikes are also posted on our Facebook page.

After attending two hikes/events, please consider joining the North Jersey Ramapo Chapter of the Adirondack Mountain Club to support our outdoor recreation and conservation activities.  Membership comes with a variety of benefits including a 10% discount at Ramsey Outdoor; our annual holiday party and social; special events such as our traditional day-outing to the Mohonk Mountain House; a subscription to ADK’s bi-monthly magazine, Adirondac; and the opportunity to contribute to the preservation and extension of hiking lands and viewsheds in our region.

New hikers are strongly encouraged to select hikes appropriate to their capabilities. North Jersey Ramapo Chapter hikes are rated for pace (A, B or C), mileage, and terrain (A, B or C), with "C" designating easier hikes and "A" more challenging ones. We recommend that new hikers should first try a "C" or short "B" hike before undertaking a more difficult one; otherwise, you may not fully enjoy the hiking experience. If you have any doubts, please contact the hike leader in advance. 

Pace Ratings: 
     A = Fast - 2.5 mph or faster 
     B = Moderate - about 2 mph 
     C = Easy - 1.5 mph or less 

Distance: Noted in miles 

Terrain Ratings:
     A = Strenuous, long/steep climbs and descents, 
             possible rock scrambling
     B = Moderate climbs and descents
     C = Generally flat with little elevation change 

For example, a hike rated “B 7 A” is a moderately paced hike of approximately 7 miles with steep climbs and/or descents and possible rock scrambling. 

If you join us for a hike, please understand that you are responsible for your own preparedness, including ensuring that the hike is appropriate for your level of fitness, that you wear the proper clothing, and bring the proper gear, food and water (see the ADK's recommended Hiking Essentials and guidelines, below).

Leaders have the right, responsibility and sole discretion to refuse any hiker he/she deems to be not properly attired, prepared, or otherwise fit to safely complete the hike. 

HIKERS' GUIDELINES:

  Risks:  As with all physical activities, hiking involves hazards. Persons participate at their own risk and will be asked to sign a statement acknowledging that fact before starting the hike. Prior to the hike please advise the leader of any medical condition or physical impairment that could affect you during the hike.

  Footwear and Clothing:  Wear clothing suited to the weather and carry extra garments for unexpected weather conditions. Dress in thin layers so that you can adjust the number of layers as required to maintain comfort. In winter carry a wool cap and wool or polypropylene gloves or mitts and a windproof shell. Be prepared for rain. Bring a rain jacket and rain pants, preferably of the type that permits venting body moisture. Wear comfortable, sturdy boots/shoes.  Do not wear cotton garments in winter.

  Drink and Food:  Adequate hydration is important year round. Drink frequently during the hike. Carry food to enjoy during the midday lunch stop.

  Other responsibilities:  Hikers with children under 16 and new hikers are required to contact the hike leader in advance to determine if the hike is suitable for them.  Minors under 16 are welcome on day hikes when accompanied by a parent or guardian.  No person under 18 shall participate in overnight outings unless accompanied by a parent or adult sponsor over 21.  The hike leader may refuse to allow a person to hike who is judged to be poorly equipped or unable to do the published hike.  Participants should get to the hike at least 10 minutes prior to the starting time.

  Maps:  The TC number indicates a NY-NJ Trail Conference map for the area of the hike. For example: TC-118 refers to the Southern Harriman Park map.

  Abbreviations:  NCA-No Calls After . . . , Pref.- Leader’s contact preference.

  Expense Sharing:  When car-pooling, passengers are expected to offer the driver funds sufficient to cover the cost of fuel, tolls and parking fees. A $3.00 minimum per person is recommended. Most hike trailhead meeting locations can be found on NY-NJ Trail Conference maps.

  Dog-Friendly Hikes:  Pets are not permitted on hikes unless the hike description clearly states that it is "dog friendly."  If it is, all hikers with dogs must abide by park leash regulations.
results.name: Sterling Lake Loop

results.description:
For coworking space, it's first come first served. You'll want to get there early to find a desk before it fills up. The space is available from 10am to 6pm. If you are planning on attending, you'll need to do the following things:

• Register at the AWS Pop-up Loft Space - https://aws.amazon.com/start-ups/loft/ny-loft/

• Once you are registered you can pick up a badge and attend any of the co-working meetups.

• Let us know you are going by signing up for the event on meetup. This also lets other people in the group know who is going to be there too.

• Remember to check the Pop-up Loft website to make sure it is open. We'll do out best to cancel meetups on holidays and days the space won't be available but you should also double check before coming out.

• While there are snacks and drinks at the space, lunch is not provided. There are a number of restaurants, delis and other places to get food in the area so plan accordingly

• These daily coworking events are self run. A co-organizer will not always be at the event. These events are designed to give game developers a free space to work so you'll basically be left alone at the space to do you own thing. We suggest reaching out to other attending through the comments to sit together or meet up at a specific time in the space.

Last thing, two times a month we'll have a dedicated space for you to come out and work as well as listen to talks and get help from myself and others in the community. Those will be different events you'll need to register for which are separate from the daily co-working space.
results.name: Indie Coworking Space

results.description:
You need to REGISTER with the Englewood Parks & Recreation Department at the following link:  

http://registercommunitypass.net/Englewood

There, you will be able to pay the $40 fee online.  Please DO NOT PAY BELOW.

This fee covers all 10 classes.  I hope you will attend ALL remaining 9!!  (There is no refund for missed classes.)

Course:  Fun Fingers

Age Suggestion:  2 1/2 through 5

Class 2:  Transfer Activities

Review & New:  Each week we will review the essentials of working in a classroom, such as how to sit with others for circle time, how to complete a "work cycle" from choosing an activity to returning it to its correct place, and how to work at a table or on the floor.  

New this week will be traditional Montessori transfer activities. For our younger students, this will mean grasping larger items to move them from one container to another.  For the older ones, we'll start pouring smaller items.

Activities:  In addition to materials already out, many of which involve transfer, grasping and pouring will be available.

Adult Learning:  Adults will learn about how controls of error are built right into Montessori exercises and why, what a "point of interest" is in an activity, and various spontaneous information.

A Peek Ahead:  After your child's first class, lessons are based upon observation, so specifics are unknown.  The goal of the course, however, is to develop fine motor control and hand strength, prerequisites to handwriting.  Materials will be demonstrated to that end.  Many exercises promote these skills.  The following are some exercises that most likely will be presented and then available for the children to choose.

     Self Care:  lacing cards, folding scarves, opening and closing containers

     Transferring Materials:  using a spoon, tongs, a mellon baller, pouring

     Extra Care Needed:  cutting, tracing, gluing with a paintbrush, pin pushing 

     Squeezing:  using a sponge, an eye dropper, clothes pins
results.name: Class 2 - Transfer Activities

results.description:
Professor James H. Cone, known as the founder of black liberation theology, is the Charles A. Briggs Distinguished Professor of Systematic Theology at Union Theological Seminary. He attended Shorter College [masked]) and holds a B.A. degree from Philander Smith College (1958). In 1961, he received a Master of Divinity degree from Garrett Theological Seminary and later earned an M.A. (1963) and Ph.D. (1965) from Northwestern University. Dr. Cone has been conferred thirteen (13) honorary degrees, including an honoris causa from the Institut Protestant de Théologie in Paris, France.
Dr. Cone is best known for his ground-breaking works, Black Theology & Black Power (1969) and A Black Theology of Liberation (1970); he is also the author of the highly acclaimed God of the Oppressed (1975), and of Martin & Malcolm & America: A Dream or a Nightmare? (1991); all of which works have been translated into nine languages. The 30th Anniversary of the publication of Black Theology & Black Power was celebrated at the University of Chicago Divinity School (April 1998), and a similar event was held for A Black Theology of Liberation at Garrett-Evangelical Theological Seminary (April 2000) and at the Catholic Theological Society of America (June 2001). His research and teaching are in Christian theology, with special attention to black liberation theology and the liberation theologies of Africa, Asia, and Latin America. He also teaches 19th & 20th century European-American theologies. His latest book is entitled The Cross and the Lynching Tree and received the 2012 Nautilus Silver Award in Religion/Spirituality-Western Traditions. It was an Amazon.com #1 best seller in religion in February 2012. Naming it one of the top religion books of 2011, Huffington Post editors said: “One of the great theologians of the late 20th century, Cone forces us to look hard at suffering, oppression and, ultimately, redemption.”

Cost: Free

Please, register here

 Free Register

results.name: History and Evolution of Black Theology: Professor James Cone

results.description:
Click here, or type in the following link in your browser http://www.brighttalk.com/webcast/13685/190407


Apache Hadoop has become the de-facto big data platform. It represents tremendous promise of using big data to transform business operations. Hadoop was developed as a solution for efficient and scalable search indexing need. The first version had MapReduce programming model. Mastering MapReduce required steep learning curve, and migrating applications to MapReduce needed a complete re-write. This along with the requirement of moving compute closer to data made MapReduce an impediment that did little to bolster productization of big data. There are faster in-memory substitutes to MapReduce, but they too carry the same baggage. In hindsight, Hadoop should have modeled itself as a distributed operating system, and enabled various programming models to run. Hadoop 2.0 (Yarn) was the answer. Not only does Yarn allow organizations to perform advanced analytics with data at unprecedented volume, but it’s also broadened the use cases for Big Data across the industry segments.What is now needed is bleeding edge Yarn-based platform capable of radically realizing Hadoop’s potential.These new age big data platforms must deliver real business value of the Big Data. This means easy deployment, ease of  integration with existing IT infrastructure, ease of migration and development of applications to Hadoop, and faster time to insight for business.The key requirements of this new platforms should reside in: 


• Simplicity and Production-ready

• Code Reuse

• Operability

• Ease of integration

• Leveraging the power of Hadoop 


In this webinar we will discuss Apache Apex (incubating), the next generation native Hadoop big data platform. We will go into details on how Apex meets these requirements.

Presenters


Amol Kekre: CTO and PPMC member of Apache Apex

Thomas Weise: Architect and PPMC member of Apache Apex
results.name: Webinar: Introducing Apache Apex, Next-gen native Hadoop Big Data platform

results.description:
Love companies like GoDaddy, LinkedIn, Netflix and PayPal? Guess what they have in common: they all use Node.js!

If you're looking to get an introductory lesson on this amazing platform than look no further than our workshop. Topics discussed include...

* Essential JavaScript (mostly about anonymous functions, callbacks, async to set us up for Express)
* Node (npm, requiring modules, package.json, etc.)
* Express (routes, templating, session handling)
* MongoDB (simple CRUD queries)
* Mongoose (or some other Mongo library)
* Conventional Web App (pages generated from db, no XMLHttpRequest)
* API / Serving up JSON
* AJAX or frontent framework / Consuming JSON

As a heads up, please install node >5.0 and mongoDb before you come to the event. Google Chrome and some text editing software like Sublime would also be very useful.
results.name: Backend Development with Node.js

Glen is the president and co-founder of Medidata, and the original architect of the Medidata Rave platform. With his deep expertise in medical research and understanding of technology’s role in streamlining complex processes, Glen has been driving Medidata's vision since the company’s inception: Delivering cloud-based solutions to transform the life science industry's approach to bringing new treatments to market.

Glen received his BS in molecular biology and genetics from Carnegie Mellon University, worked as a research scientist at the Columbia Presbyterian Medical Center and studied computer science at New York University's Courant Institute of Mathematics. He is the holder of numerous patents for clinical trial innovations, and is a member of the board of the Young Scientist Foundation and chairman of the board of Dancing Classrooms.

results.description:
Le toca a Peru!
Authentic Peruvian Cuisine

Peruvian cuisine is considered one of the most varied and richest in the world. Thanks to inheritance pre Inca, Inca, Spanish immigrants, African, Chinese, Japanese and Italian, together, creating a peruvian "criolla" cuisine, full of exquisite flavors of four continents, providing a unique and impressive variety of dishes. Typical Peruvian cuisine is constantly changing, impossible to enumerate in full.

Panka's is a family-owned and operated restaurant, born as a way to introduce Peruvian options to Port Chester City, made by Peruvian chefs. All of our dishes are based on family recipes that have been passed from generation to generation and perfected with time. Our mission is to offer the highest quality dishes and most flavorful meals in our area.

results.description:
Please join activists in protesting Ringling Bros. and Barnum & Bailey Circus. www.ringlingbeatsanimals.com  This is the first day of Ringling’s week at the Barclays Center arena- LET’S SHOW THEM THAT ANIMAL ABUSE IS NOT WELCOME IN NEW YORK!

Please attend the huge opening day protest!



WHEN: Thursday February 25, 5:30 pm

WHERE: In front of Barclays Center, 620 Atlantic Ave., Brooklyn, NY 11217 accessible by the 2,3,4,5 trains (See this map.) http://goo.gl/maps/IVX0G

Ringling Bros. and Barnum & Bailey Circus is known for its long history of abusing animals. In 1929, John Ringling ordered the execution of a majestic bull elephant named Black Diamond after the elephant killed a woman who had been in the crowd as he was paraded through a Texas city. Twenty men took aim and pumped some 170 bullets into Black Diamond's body and then chopped off his bullet-ridden head and mounted it for display in Houston. Ringling Bros.' cruel treatment of animals continues today.

Elephants in Ringling's possession are chained inside filthy, poorly ventilated boxcars for an average of more than 26 hours straight—and up to 100 hours at a time—when the circus travels. Even former Ringling employees have reported that elephants are routinely abused and violently beaten with bullhooks (weapons that resemble a fireplace poker) in order to force them to perform tricks.

To learn more about Ringling's lengthy history of abusing animals, check out PETA's factsheet. http://circuses.com/pdfs/RinglingHiddenTruthFSetc.pdf

There will also be protests every day Ringling's will be at the Barclay Center.
results.name: Ringling Brothers Circus Protest @ Barclays

Our speaker for the evening will be Karen Pence, a longtime Humanist member, and an ardent activist.  Karen, is particularly worried about what we DON'T KNOW! What's even more worrisome though, is what we don't even KNOW we don't know!  How can we have a real democracy with secrets and financial-political shenanigans?

For example, we learned from Amy Goodman this morning that electronic voting machines have secret "proprietary coding" that are not overseen by governmental regulation. Is this a recipe for election manipulation? Whom can we trust?

Karen Pence is a prolific dispenser of political and environmental information that begs for input from Americans. She warns of dangers from our distraction and inaction.

Please bring your own concerns with information to share. Hoping to see you at the Moonstruck on 3rd Avenue at 31st Street, any time from 6 to 9 PM.

results.description:
Real clients with Real budgets. No imaginary startups here.

It’s rare that entrepreneurs have access to Fortune 1000 CIOs with access to trillions in capital. vLab’s Reverse Pitch Challenge that lets you do just that: propose a solution to a CIO’s technological challenge, work with them in a virtual hackathon to build the solution, and win the chance at cold hard cash to scale the idea.

The event, sponsored by Microsoft, hosted by vLab, is powered by Enterprise Technology Research (ETR).

The event is happening on February 25, 6-9pm at WeWork Chelsea so you need to act fast to secure your seats by registering to attend or submitting a solution to the challenges outlined below. You can also attend via livestream. At the event, CIO panelists will hash out their pain points across infrastructure, analytics, and information security.

Solutions are now being accepted to the following challenges:

Niel Nikolaisen – CTO of OC Tanner – Legacy App Modernization
Breaking legacy apps into Lego Blocks in order to improve business speed and agility.

Raffaele Piemonte – VP of Applications and Infrastructure, Center Light Health System – Sunset of Legacy Applications/Products
Keeping the legacy data but not the legacy cost. 

Christopher Wilson – Principle Cloud Architect, Verizon Enterprise Solutions – Event Classification across the IT Infrastructure
Provide a service, collection of services, 3rd party software or plugin which can classify events occurring across the IT infrastructure into incident management levels.

Dr. Kaijun Zhan – Director of Global Infrastructure & Engineering Computing, Atmel Corp – Back-up, Tape is Fraught with Problems
Back-up – Cloud is not always the easy answer.

Robert Stevenson – Chief Strategist, Hitachi – Open Stack Integration and Orchestration with Chef and Puppet
Need for an Open Stack light for IOT use cases.

Vince Tripodi – VP of Engineering, Associated Press – Content Processing
A new look at Metadata for Media Companies’ use cases.

Additional panelists include Thomas DelVecchio, Founder & Director of Research – Enterprise Technology Research (ETR), and Patrick Lewis, Cofounder – vLAB, Chief Strategist – ETR&D.

Full details on the challenges can be found in the vLab CIO Reverse Pitch Challenge Summary.

Submissions for solutions must include the solution description, technical stack, delivery model, indicative pricing, development time, milestones, and questions.

Winners will receive complimentary memberships in vLab and prequalify for potential funding.

Still on the fence? If you are successful, you will continue to work with these high-powered CIOs after the event and support them in building out your solution with access to their ample budgets to build your solution into reality. Your solution, should it be selected, may be implemented at a Fortune 1000 company.

To recap: you propose a solution to a Fortune 1000 CIO’s technological challenge, and gain the opportunity to work closely with them to make it happen with real budget.

This is the hackathon for those who want to make real progress on real, live challenges, with mentorship from those who have the need for your solution.

Not interested in proposing a solution? You can still get a front seat to watch it all go down, either in person in NYC or via livestream from the comfort of your couch. Doesn’t get easier or more convenient than that. Space is limited though, so register today to make sure you get the opportunity to see it all go down. Think it can’t get any sweeter? Oh it can, because it’s free.

The event, sponsored by Microsoft, hosted by vLab, is powered by Enterprise Technology Research (ETR).

vLAB is the first-of-its kind startup collaboration platform that brings the best and brightest entrepreneurs together to solve enterprise technology challenges based on what global CIOs/CTOs have brought to their lab.

It’s time for you to take your ideas and put them towards real challenges and gain access to large amount of capital.

Register or submit your solution today.
results.name: CIO Reverse Pitch & Virtual Hackathon

Dear Fellow Entrepreneur,

Taxes are the greatest liability as well as the biggest source of stress for small business owners. Not understanding your taxes could cost you tens of thousands of dollars in over-taxation, penalties, and lost time in case of IRS audits.

Please join us for this workshop with small business tax expert Rachel Michaelov, EA, NTPI Fellow, and understand your tax obligations. This free seminar will benefit established businesses, those getting started and individuals anticipating going into business. 

Some of the topics that will be covered in the workshop are:  

1. Types of Entities and why some are better than others (C Corps, S corps, LLC’s)

2. Best Practices for Small business owners and how you should keep your books and records.

3. Payroll tax 101: who needs to file, what documents you need to keep as an employer and important tips for hiring employees.

4. Sales tax 101: who needs to collect sales tax returns, when they are due and penalties for not filing sales tax returns.

5. Corporate tax deadlines and Penalties for not filing on time.

6. Most important: Top Tax deductions that you can write off.  Details of business expenses that you can write off and what you need to deduct specific expenses.

We will follow a structured format:

6:00-6:15pm - open networking/registration 
6:15-6:45pm - Workshop  
6:45-7:15pm - Q&A  

Keep Learning, Keep Growing, 

Aditi

Robert M. Herzog - Ecaring

Robert is a pioneer in applying new media and technologies to develop companies and solutions for critical problems in healthcare, media, Iternet utilization, energy and the environment. He is the Founder and Chief Executive Officer of eCaring LLC, a Web-based home health care management and monitoring system that brings the benefits of digital record keeping and communications to the millions of Americans receiving home health care. results.description:
***REGISTRATION OPEN***

On Thursday February 25th @ 6 PM, you will have the opportunity to discover 7(!) innovative start ups at Atelier, the co-working space launched and housed by Belcham, the Belgian-American Chamber of Commerce in NYC. This first edition of the year will feature the following companies: Doctors of the World; HotelsByDay; Glassful; Bainisha, TankTwo, Dealflow; Impraise. Reserve your seats now.

| Please note these changes! |

1) Each company will have 6 minutes to present followed by 4 minutes Q&A

2) A nominal charge of $10.00 will be requested when you register. (As we're typically at capacity, this will enable us to scale-up in terms of attendee quality, as well as cover part of our costs for staging and organizing the event - reminding you that we are a non-profit)

I'm happy to announce the new names of our participating startups:

- Doctors of the World

Doctors of the World, a start-up in NYC, is an international humanitarian organization that provides emergency and long-term medical care to vulnerable populations while fighting for equal access to healthcare worldwide. 

DotW is the newest member of the Médecins du Monde (MdM) global network. Founded in 1980, MdM provides life-saving, life-changing medical care to the world’s most vulnerable people and advocates for healthcare for everyone;



- Bainisha

Bainisha is a B2B Wearable Technology Platform Developer/Integrator. 
With our patented technology platform we can radically push the current accuracy level of on-body movement detection to an unprecedented level. 
Our platform largely outperforms all currently available motion caption capabilities.
The direct measurements have an other major advantage: displacement is measured with hyper accuracy and resolution, hence all derivatives (speed, acceleration and jerk) are equally of supreme accuracy. 



- HotelsByDay


HotelsByDay is a startup based in New York and is made up of a team of hospitality industry veterans, technology experts and entrepreneurs who decided that there should be a better way for hotels to leverage their unused inventory during the day to increase their revenues and for the traveler who needs the use of a hotel room outside the conventional hours.


- Glassful

Change the way millennials  consume wine today—and anything else tomorrow.No one wants to feel unsure at the point of checkout, but some products require a level of knowledge that only comes with experience and expertise. That’s where we come in. We remove the burden of choosing by giving you what you want.


- Dealflow


We're solving the largest problem in the business of raising capital with software that creates targeted outreach to investors based on preferences data that we use to match investors with opportunities.


- Tanktwo

Tanktwo Electric Car batteries give drivers a full charge in under three minutes, yet cost less than standard battery packs. Our out-of-the-box distributed design breaks the last battery technology barrier using technologies from mobile networks and the internet.



- Impraise


The fitness-tracker for your professional life.The same way you can track your morning runs and your progress in the last few weeks, you can use Impraise at work to track your professional development.We are all surrounded by talented people who would love to help and learn from each other. We came up with a solution that allows you to ask for feedback right when it's needed and that lets your colleagues and managers support you along the way.

=========================================================


I look forward to see you all again in big numbers for what is going to be another one of this memorable moments ! 

As always, beer for our MeetUps is sponsored by Duvel.

Be there or be square - and share the word.

Yvan De Munck

results.description:
We would like to welcome guests to attend the Manhattan Toastmasters' General Meeting. You will get to experience awesome speeches by our Manhattan Toastmasters Club members as well gain some experience speaking in front of a group. 

Our meetings are divided into three sections. The first section consists of project speeches, delivered by our Club Members. The second section features Table Topics, where Club Members and Guests get a chance to practice impromptu speaking. The third section includes Evaluations when the project speakers receive constructive feedback from the evaluators. 

Come and join us for our General meeting and take the first step in improving your public speaking skills, gain confidence and make new friends who will support and encourage you.

AFTER-PARTY immediately after the meeting. After-party location will be announced at the meeting.

results.description:
Join the ladies of the Executive Women's Golf Association (EWGA) NYC Chapter for an evening of golf practice, education & networking! 

Come learn about our chapter and all of the events we have planned for the 2016 Golf Season in NYC!  Mingle with EWGA members and make new friends, while practicing your swing at the indoor golf simulator and putting range. 

Ann Northrop, Handicap Chair, will lead us in an educational discussion about how the handicap system works.

In honor of the Chinese New Year of the Fire Monkey, catered food and refreshments will be available to enjoy as part of the event.

Pricing: $25 EWGA Members | $30 Guests of EWGA Members | $35 Non-Members | $40 At the Door

Experienced, Beginner or Brand New golfers all highly encouraged to attend! 

Note: You must first register at this link to gain entry to this event:  Click Here to Register

Looking forward to seeing everyone on the 25th!

results.description:
*Shooting animals to death when the intense, unnatural confinement causes them to engage in aggressive or self destructive, stereotypical behaviors

*Continuously/routinely inflicting painful punishments on animals who do not perform under a diabolical mixture of stress, fear and deprivation of all that is natural, as "necessary" to keep the animals obedient, the crowds entertained and the million$$$ rolling in.

*Cynically scoffing in the face of USDA *minimal* requirements of animal welfare, including adequate veterinary care, reasonable opportunities to engage in natural behavior, sufficient space, exercise and drinking water.

The atrocities go on and on and on.

What you should know about Ringling Bros:
http://www.mediapeta.com/peta/PDF/RinglingFactsheet.pdf

STEP RIGHT UP, Ladies and Gentlemen, to the Cruelest Show on Earth! Ringling Bros 3 ring circus of hellish perversion has rolled into the tri-state area once again, and FAUN group fully intends to deliver the message of animal lovers/protectors in our home turf loud and clear to these vile, shameless animal abusers: "WE DON'T WANT YOU HERE, NOT TODAY, NOT TOMORROW AND NOT EVER! VILE ANIMAL ABUSERS - BEGONE!"

http://www.circusprotest.com/

http://www.circuses.com

</a><a href="http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=mRZt6SdNs7g">http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=mRZt6SdNs7g

http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=6Y6WKI8eKI4

Here are the details of Thursday's Ringling demo:

WHAT: OPENING NIGHT Ringling’s 3 Ring Circus of Horror and Atrocity @ Barclays Center

WHERE: In front of Barclays Center, 620 Atlantic Ave., Brooklyn, NY 11217

WHEN: Thursday, February 25, 2016

TIME: 6:00-7:30 pm

PUBLIC TRANSPORTATION:

Take the D, N, R to Atlantic Av-Pacific St; or 2,3,4,5, B, Q to Atlantic Av.

There will also be protests at Ringling's following performances:

Friday, February 26, 6-7:30 pm

Saturday February 27, 2-3:30 pm & 6-7:30 pm

Sunday, February 28, 2-3:30 pm & 6-7:30 pm

Tuesday, March 1, 6-7:30 pm

Wednesday, March 2, 6-7:30 pm

Thursday, March 3, 6-7:30 pm
 

Again, WE will have signs and leaflets. If you have something you want to bring, that's fine, but all you NEED to bring is YOURSELF, a heart full of empathy/compassion and a voice to demonstrate your love for pachyderms, primates, bears, big cats, and all creatures great and small.

www.faunnj.org

results.description:
Hi All


THIS PAGE HAS IMAGES,  if you do not see them and you are viewing this page with

1)  the Meetup App - click the "DESCRIPTION TAB"

2) Android - open your browser's settings menu and click ''REQUEST DESKTOP SITE". 

3) Apple IOS - click the "DESKTOP SITE" button at the bottom of the page.

4) Microsoft Windows - buy a new computer :)

For those new to the Hop you might be wondering how you will find the group. Well below is a lovely pictures of myself. Study my face carefully and commit it to memory. Now that I am burned into your hippocampus simply look for me hovering near the entrance to the first gallery.

I never take myself this seriously 

Just a little more business...

Every week I receive emails from new members asking if there is a fee to join or attend the Thursday Night Gallery Hop. So rather than answer each email individually I'll kill a whole flock of birds with one stone. 

THE HOP IS, ALWAYS HAS BEEN, AND WILL REMAIN COMPLETELY FREE 

That said if you would like to help offset my organizer fees or buy me a post-hop bourbon you are more than welcome to click the 'chip in' button on the left side of this page. But let me reiterate contributions while appreciated are NOT required. 

And now the openings...

Anna Ostoya - Slaying


Bortolami Gallery - 520 West 20th Street

Eberhard Havekost -  Expulsion from Paradise Freeze


Anton Kern Gallery -532 West 20th Street

Mel Ramos - Paintings and Drawings 1964 to the Present


Kravets Wehby Gallery - 521 West 21st Street, Ground Floor

Mark Dion - Library for the Birds of New York and Other Marvels


Tanya Bonakdar Gallery - 521 West 21st Street

Nice Weather


Skarstedt Gallery - 550 West 21st street

Tête-à-Tête: Portraits in Dialogue

Allan Stone Projects - 535 W 22nd Street, 3rd Floor

Ellsworth Kelly - Photographs


Luigi Ghirri The Impossible Landscape


Matthew Marks Gallery - 523 West 24th Street

Rosalind Fox Solomon - Got to Go


Bruce Silverstein Gallery - 535 West 24th Street

Tim Hawkinson Counterclockwise


Pace Gallery - 537 West 24th Street

After the openings (around 8 pm) everyone who would like to continue with the group are welcome to join us at a nearby restaurant (location TBD) for refreshments and general merriment. 

See you at the Hop

Todd
results.how_to_find_us: We'll meet inside the Bortolami Gallery, stay till around 6:30, then visit the galleries in the order listed below, so PLEASE PRINT OR SAVE THIS PAGE. Running late? I'll TRY to update our location during the Hop in the comments of this page.

You are able to just come to our meetings as a guest and even join as member if you wish!
The name of the City Hall Toastmasters Club is only because of the location. This club has an open membership -- open to all in the community.
Anyone & everyone is welcome to come to any meeting and also join as a member.
Dress code is business casual.
We meet the 2nd and 4th Thursday of each Month so the next few meetings are

-- 
City Hall Toastmasters Club #735 - (Open to All ! & Feel free to bring a friend !)
Meets 2nd and 4th Thursday of the Month @ <a>6:00 - 7:15 PM</a>

@St Andrews Church  20 Cardinal Hayes Place(Centre & Reade St's)
http://735.toastmastersclubs.org
[masked]
Directions:  http://www.hopstop.com - Trains / Buses or http://www.mapquest.com
Hope you can make it to out next meeting & feel free to bring a friend! St Andrews Church
20 Cardinal Hayes Place (Centre & Reade St's) Lower Manhattan District, NY, NY, 10007, United States

Doors Open at 5:50 pm. Meeting begins at 6pm.

Meetings are held every 2nd and 4th Thursday of the month.

Walking East on Reade St., you will see St. Andrews R.C. church at the end of the street. That is our building. When you come up to the church, walk around the church until you see a black iron gated walkway. Enter the walkway and enter the door on the left. The door will be open and you can come right in. Please do not bother the church staff by ringing any door bells.

Thanks!

Whine and Dine HR Group is hosting an event in partnership with the networking organization called "HR Girlfriends" on Thursday, 2/25 and we are also invited! 

Ladies Night with HR Girlfriends and Whine and Dine! 

Because the best social networks are not created online, we invite you to Ladies Night at Side Bar! 

Event Location: Side Bar
Event Address: 118 East 15th Street, New York, NY 10003
Event Time: 6pm – Close


Event Specials: Half off drinks for ladies all night long. (Sponsored Liquors Only) Whine and Dine - The Whine & Dine Human Resources Networking Group was founded in 2003 with a simple concept - to advance professional and social networking for Human Resources professionals without the burden of excessive rules or requirements and to support the HR community everywhere. Since inception, the group has grown from 5 to over 10,000 practitioners and partners. Many share in what we do, both locally in the northeast and around the United States, as well as internationally. 

COME JOIN US! No membership fee and no fee to attend our events - we're always in a restaurant, so you pay your own tab for food and drink. The value of the relationships you create and build and the contributions to the professional community you can make are PRICELESS!


We hope to see you there!

Networking * Cocktails * Promoting the HR Tech Conference take place in VA later this year*

For more information:
Contact: HR Girlfriend Events Team

results.description:
Click here to buy tickets: https://divawards.splashthat.com/

On behalf of Code/Interactive (C/I), we are thrilled to announce our inaugural Diversity in Tech Awards to celebrate the individuals & organizations championing the nationwide movement to increase diversity in STEM education. The awards ceremony and cocktail party will take place on February 25, 2016 at the Bowery Hotel in New York, NY starting at 6pm for VIP admission and 6:45 for general admission. You’re invited!

The evening will be a gathering of leaders in the New York tech community, with featured speakers including the CTO of The City of New York, Minerva Tantoco, as well as leaders from companies such as Pubmatic, Crowdcentric, Salesforce and Meetup. Join us for a fun night as we honor our award recipients and for a full evening of networking, all night open bar, passed hors d'oeuvres and live music. Click here to purchase tickets or support the event.
results.name: Diversity in Tech Awards

results.description: This is a social group for walkers, run/walkers, runners and triathletes. We run in the Fleet Feet neighborhood for 3 or 6 miles (approximately 30-60 minutes). We help match you to others of a similar pace. All paces and smiley faces welcome.

results.description:
Announcing Monthly Training Meetings And More!

AIP (in collaboration with Unique Photo) is pleased to announce it's newest program; monthly meetings around the themes of training, socializing and equipment swaps and cleaning. Meetings will be held on the last Thursday of each month. (No meeting in December and November's meeting will be Dec. 2)

Note: Unique Photo will give every registered attendee a token worth $10.00 off the purchase of any merchandise bought at Unique that night or in the future.

LIMITED SPACE, SO REGISTER TODAY!

PROGRAM:

o  6:00 – 7:00 PM:  Equipment Swap & Sale (Canon Room)

     ·  Swap:  Tag the items that you wish to sell with your name,
         contact info and price.  Tables will be provided allowing
         you to display the items that you want to sell to other
         members.  (We will have people to help with the 
         process but are not responsible for theft, albeit unlikely.)

     ·  Sale:  Unique will have a table set up to purchase your
        equipment if you want to sell it to them, even at the end of
        the night, if no one has purchased it in the swap session.

o  6:00 – 7:00 PM:  ½ Price Camera Cleaning

     ·  Unique is offering half price camera cleaning to attendees:
        $25.00 for “C” size sensors;  $37.50 for "Full Frame" sensors 
        (Drop-off by 7:00 PM; pick-up at end of meeting)

o 6:30 – 7:00 PM:  Pizza and Networking  (Back of Store)      ·  Meet your fellow members in a relaxing environment.
     ·  There will be plenty of pizza & soft drinks, so come directly from work.

o  7:00 – 9:00 PM:  Learning Program (Conference Room)      ·  Meeting announcements

     ·  Short Sponsor Presentation. Our sponsor this month is Hahnemuhle Fine Art Paper

Our presenter tonight is Tony Morella  

Tony is the owner of Digital Editions Atelier, a high-end digital printing company for photographers and photo-artist’s. He has 30+ years of digital printing experience with industry giants, including Epson, Kodak and Ricoh, and understands the nuance’s award-winning printmaking. 

Presentation:  Shooting, Editing and Retouching for Print Production

“You don’t take a photograph, you make it.” – Ansel Adams

Tony’s presentation will provide best practices, from taking the photo to post processing, when printing is your final goal. This seminar is for all levels of photographer, from beginners to professionals.  His presentation includes:

Ø  How Dynamic Range impacts the print process, and how to optimize your exposure and settings for better prints 

Ø  Understanding and optimizing camera, computer and printer color space

Ø  Tips on workflow for print optimization

Ø  The purpose of calibration, ICC profiles and how to make your print and monitor look the same

Ø  Tips on proper printer settings and how to optimize your prints

Ø  Proper selection of papers

Ø  Post printing handling and display

Check out Tony’s company and services at:  http://digitaleditionsatelier.com/


o  9:00 – 9:30 PM:  Settle up sales and pick up cleaned
    cameras.

o  9:15 PM:  Post Meeting Party… for those interested      ·  Hampton Inn, directly across Rt. 46 from Unique Photo
results.name: Monthly Meetings - Photo Training and Much More:KEEP THIS DATE OPEN

results.description:
We're on the Second Floor

Henry Owainaiti is the presenter for this very important topic.

A Brief Bio:

Henry is Cofounder and Chief Investment Officer at ConsulCapital, a private investment firm focused on direct real estate strategies. He has over 20 years experience investing and managing alternative assets with expertise in private equity and direct real estate. Henry is the former Managing Director and Co-Head of Global Private Equity at Vienna based Bank Gutmann with $19 billion in assets; and former Senior Banker with Bank Austria-UniCredit Group. He holds a B.A. from the University of Rochester, a Masters degree from Boston University, and is a CFA Charterholder.

The Event will begin at 6 pm at Billy's Sports Bar at 856 River Avenue by the 4, B and D subway (next to Yankee stadium).

The cost is $15.00 at the door and $10.00 if you RSVP on Meetup. All the proceeds will be applied to light appetizers served after the presentation.
results.how_to_find_us: Right by Yankee's Stadium (try both entrances- 161st Street and River Street)
results.name: An Introduction to Private Equity and Mezzanine Financing

results.description:
Question #1
Did Arnold Schwarzenegger make his millions through movies?


Question #2
