results.description:
Come and meet our community of local real estate investors, build your network, and learn why real estate is IDEAL and why you should be involved with our community of real estate investors. We constantly learn & earn together and have fun together. Within our real estate investing community, we train people with no experience to people who have been working in the real estate field for many years. So it's not important what experience you have! Working with our community, you will learn in depth knowledge of how real estate investing strategies work and you will also develop yourself to be a successful real estate entrepreneur.

At this meeting we talk about the biggest money making opportunities (Wholesaling, Fix and Flips, Buy & Holds, Seller Financed Notes + Tax Liens/Deeds, Multi-Family/Commercial and Money Lending) for a Real Estate Investor in today’s market. You will get to learn about new investors that are investing in real estate and making $10,000-$100,000+ per real estate transaction, we will also talk about how you can make $1,000-$10,000 commissions helping our community grow and you will learn working strategies from professional and practicing Real Estate Investors on how to create wealth through real estate investing.. This way you can learn & earn, get educated so you can invest in real estate, enjoy your life and pass your wealth on to future generations. Because we will cover a LOT of things in a short amount of time such as saving money on taxes, investment opportunities and other ways to make money working with our team, only those who attend the orientation will get invited to private follow up meetings to cover more in depth advanced strategies and working with our community.

results.description:
FEBRUARY 25, 2016 (THURSDAY) 6:30PM

NYC ATHEISTS SPECIAL EVENT

LECTURE: LIFE OF CHARLES DARWIN, EVOLUTION AND THE GALAPAGOS

NYC ATHEISTS MONTHLY MEETING

LOCATION: SLC Conference Center, 15 West 39th St. (3rd Floor)

COST: $10 Donation covers room rental.


-----------------------------------------------

LECTURE: LIFE OF CHARLES DARWIN, EVOLUTION AND THE GALAPAGOS

NYC ATHEISTS CELEBRATES CHARLES DARWIN'S 209TH BIRTHDAY - ACTUAL DATE: FEBRUARY 12TH

WE ARE PRIVILEGED IN HAVING PROFESSOR BENNINGTON, OF HOFSTRA UNIVERSITY AS OUR SPEAKER.

-----------------------------------

SPEAKER: J. Bret Bennington Ph.D

CHAIR : Professor of Geology, Environment, and Sustainability, Hofstra University

J. Bret Bennington, Ph.D., is a paleontologist with a strong interest in evolution  and geology. Dr. Bennington is a frequent public lecturer on geology and  evolution and is actively involved in the IDEAS Institute (Institute for the  Development of Education in the Advanced Sciences). A multi-year veteran of  the Galápagos Islands and Ecuador January trip, Professor Bennington calls  the program “the experience of a lifetime for students.”

His research in paleontology involves the quantitative analysis of the fossil record to learn about the evolution of ecological communities over long intervals of time. Other paleontology projects involve studies of marine ecosystems in the Devonian, Carboniferous, and Cretaceous periods, as well as the statistical analysis of fossil footprints.

Teaching activities include courses in physical geology, historical geology, dinosaurs, hydrology, geomorphology, paleontology, and Charles Darwin and evolution. Dr. Bennington also co-directs a study abroad program in the Galápagos Islands and Ecuador. He is a member of the Geological Society of America, the Paleontological Society, the Society for Economic Paleontology and Mineralogy, and he is currently serving on the board of the New York State Council of Professional Geologists.

-----------------------

LOCATION: SLC Conference Center, 15 West 39th St. (3rd Floor)

COST: $10 Donation covers room rental.

=====================================

The Forbidden City Chamber Orchestra is a widely influential chamber orchestra featuring Chinese Traditional music, as well as contemporary music, with a commitment to innovation within folk and traditional music. The orchestra is composed of well-known musicians from the Chinese Conservatory of Music. Experience an evening of entrancing chamber music with some of China's finest musicians.

results.description:
Club Dance Class

guys & girls are welcome!

Would you like to feel confident on the dance floor?

These classes will prepare you for dancing in public!

How it works:

I, unlike other teachers, don't spend entire class on teaching you choreography - you don't need it unless you want to be a professional dancer. My focus is on teaching you how to move comfortably in a club, at a party, wedding, etc. (Unless of course you request choreography).

I teach basics: finding and keeping rhythm, easy steps you can use anytime making sure you know how to transition smoothly between them.

During the first class I assess what it is we need to work on; whether it's musicality, rhythm, coordination, attenuation, groove etc. From that point on, I adjust the class to students' needs.

Right now we're in a once in a lifetime Real Estate buyers market which is helping to fuel our expansion. The combination of record low mortgage rates and underpriced housing values is why our group is making a killing in this market. Even the "world's greatest Investor" Warren Buffet is advising people to buy real estate.

Being that seating is limited please answer the RSVP questions and provide your full name, phone number and email address.

results.description:
It’s our first Meetup of 2016 and we couldn’t be more excited to bring together our favorite people (psst...you!) for a look at one of our recently completed DataCorps projects with iCouldBe, an online mentoring program.

iCouldBe’s story began two years after Google opened their first office and five years before YouTube launched. In the middle of the Internet revolution, iCouldBe developed one of the earliest e-mentoring platforms designed to bring the power of mentoring to at-risk youth across the US. With 1.2 million youth dropping out of school each year, 16 million students in need of a mentor and high school students only receiving 10 minutes per year of guidance counseling, the US continues to face an educational crisis.

Since 2000, iCouldBe’s e-mentoring program has served over 21,000 at-risk middle and high school students, empowering teens to stay in school, plan for future careers, and achieve in life. Students from public high schools across the U.S., Canada, and Mexico, select their own mentors and work on e-mentoring activities that focus on academic success strategies, career exploration, and post-secondary educational and career planning.

After attending a DataDive, iCouldBe began working with a team of DataCorps volunteers (Thomas Vincent, Peter Fleischman, Pooja Madan, and Matt Yin) to analyze their 15 years worth of data, including 130,000 anonymous mentor-mentee conversations, to understand how to define successful mentorship interactions.

Hear from Wendy Siegelman, iCouldBe’s Chief Operating Officer, on how this work will help the organization better serve students in need of mentoring and to keep more students in school. Then, ask your own questions during a facilitated Q&A.

AT&T and AT&T Aspire, the company’s signature philanthropic initiative, support both DataKind and iCouldBe, so we are especially thankful that they are sponsoring this Meetup and providing the perfect space for a DataKind family reunion. There will be drinks, snacks and ample time for catching up. Can’t wait to see you all soon!

Don’t forget to bring a photo ID to get into the building and follow along on Twitter at #ATTimpact.


Program

• 6:30-7:10: Networking

• 7:10-7:20: DataKind + AT&T opening remarks

• 7:20-7:35: iCouldBe

• 7:35-8:00: Q&A

• 8:00-8:30: Networking
results.name: Project Showcase: Understanding Successful Mentoring Relationships

This is an opportunity to practice Japanese conversation, and discuss and study the grammar, particles, Kanji, and culture. The topic varies among all these, according to what people are interested in talking about and the natural flow of conversation.

Members of all levels are welcome, from absolute beginners on up, and there is never a prerequisite. Native speakers are also encouraged to attend, both to lend their expertise and to receive the benefit of a look at the structure of Japanese from an outside linguistic perspective.

Here's a photo of the area where we meet, for reference:

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

The meeting is free, with no membership dues, hourly costs, or other expenses.

Bun is Rice noodles served in a bowl topped with scallion, roasted peanuts, cucumber, fresh mint and sauce on the side then you pick:

- Spring roll

Pho-Rice noodle entrée

-Beef rib eye
-Beef brisket
-Beef balls
-Chicken
-Vegetarian

**Drinks are separate and cash only**

This is a special event geared for startups, makers, designers, and inventors to showcase  tech products. While also being able to have it broadcasted and streamed via Periscope. Everyone is encouraged to BYOP (Bring Your Own Product). Everyone is encouraged to bring their own product that that has a tangible, hardware, style component.

results.description:
Agenda

6:30 pm - Registration, pizza and soda 

7:00 pm – James Neill, will discuss his paper

An Introduction to Neural Networks with kdb+ 

that talks about how kdb+ could be used in machine learning techniques.

In his paper James demonstrates the implementation of feedforward networks using kdb+ and how they can be trained using back-propagation.

7:25 pm - Kevin Holsgrove will discuss his paper Query Routing: A kdb+ Framework for a Scalable, Load Balanced System which discusses how traditional load balancing techniques such as a straightforward round-robin approach to resource allocation is an acceptable approach for many systems, however it can result in several queries becoming queued up behind a long-running query whilst other service resources are idle. 

In this paper, Kevin shows a method that aims to be more efficient by tagging user queries that enter a gateway, identifying free services, and allocating queries on this basis.

7:50 pm - Drawing for "Q Tips, Fast Scalable and Maintainable Kdb+"

By attending this event, you consent to the disclosure of your personal information (including first name, last name, title, email and company) to FD plc and its affiliates and 1010data, and that FD plc and its affiliates and 1010data may use such information for purposes of contacting you, sending marketing materials from and/or sending invitations to events.
results.name: Intro to implementing Neural Networks & Query Routing in kdb+

results.description:
The Beginner Buddhist Book Circle is for anyone interested in or new to Buddhism. In this biweekly series, we’ll explore classic introductory Buddhist books. Although we have “reading assignments”, the meetings focus more on basic Buddhist teachings rather than strict discussions of the books. Our meetings are casual and informal; all levels of interest and experience are welcome. When possible, we’ll have copies of the current book available at no cost. Meetings occur on the second Wednesday and fourth Thursday of the month unless otherwise noted. Please see the Meetup page and calendar for the full schedule.

*** Right Now We’re Reading: “The Heart of the Buddha's Teachings" by Thich Nhat Hanh***

In "The Heart of the Buddha's Teachings", renowned Vietnamese Buddhist monk, teacher, poet, and peace activist Thich Nhat Hanh (Thay) presents the essentials of Buddhist teachings in a clear, compassionate, and concise manner. In addition to covering teachings at the core of all Buddhist traditions, Thay also covers many key Mahayana Buddhist teachings. In all discussions, Thay helps guide us to the heart of what the Buddha taught; the transformation of suffering into peace, joy, and liberation.

First released in 1999, "The Heart of the Buddha's Teachings" has become a classic and essential read for anyone interested in learning more about basic Buddhist teachings. The book is widely available in bookstores and libraries in print, ebook form, and audio book form.


For the Feb. 25th meeting, please read Chapters 20 and 21

Discussion points include:

-What happens to our bodies when we become enlightened?


-What are the Three Jewels?


-How does one "become a Buddhist"?


***

Happy reading and we hope to see you soon!
results.name: Beginner Buddhist Book Circle

Hi Creative Apps Community!

Join us to hear stories from founders who are making creativity apps! We'll also have plenty of time for networking while having a beer and enjoying some pizza.

Featured guests:

Jeff Kenoff and Mark Collins, Morpholio (http://www.morpholioapps.com/)

Morpholio is a group of applications that reinvent creative processes for designers, artists, photographers and any imaginative individual. Morpholio's apps have been recognized on numerous "Best Apps" lists as well as featured in FastComany, USA Today, ABC News, ArchDaily, Metropolis Magazine, MacLife, Resource Magazine, Dwell and many more.

John Balestrieri, Tinrocket (http://www.tinrocket.com/)

Tinrocket makes original, creative, visual software for Mac and iOS. Their apps include Popsicolor, Waterlogue, and Percolator. Tinrocket’s apps have been featured on Wired, BuzzFeed, the New York Times, Macworld, and more.

Andreas Borg, VectorSNAP (http://vectorsnap.it/)

Turn your photos into vector art with VectorSNAP, which offers a range of artistic tools to create, open, edit and share SVG files. VectorSNAP lets you colorize your vector images using colors from other images or from hundreds of color palettes of famous painters.


Guest moderator:

Natasha Fong, Siestus (http://siest.us/)

Natasha is the founder of Siestus, which lets you join other creators and innovators who are discovering intentional space to take strategic breaks.

Natasha is also an organizer of Founders Friday (http://www.meetup.com/In-Good-Company-NYC/), a weekly meetup introducing successful founders and VCs to entrepreneurs in NYC.

Schedule:

• Doors open at 6:30pm.

• We start at 7:00pm.

• Entry is not guaranteed after 8:00pm.

See you on the 25th!

results.description:
Why don't men call to ask women out anymore?

I thought we had such a great time on our date. Why did they Fade?

I'm newly divorced and re-entering the dating scene...what can I expect?

Why didn't he pay the tab on the first date?

Where do I find someone who is looking to commit and settle down?

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

All ATWYS members who pay in advance for this event will receive a promo code for $7 off a speeddating event as well as $5 off our Mix & Mingle Happy Hour. Please be sure to check your eventbrite order confirmation for the promo codes to use to redeem your discount.

$10 in advance only

Prepay here: https://hesaidshesaidatwys.eventbrite.com

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~


These are just a sample of the questions we've fielded from past attendees of our He Said/She Said Panel. Got questions of your own? Care to enlighten others on why men or women do and say the things they do? Then you definitely need to join us!

 We all know that men are from Mars and Women are from Venus but does that apply to the species living in New York City???!!!  Why do things seem so different here??!!  Join us for this fun and interactive night where we get to the bottom of what the opposite sex is thinking.  We have reserved the private lounge on the 3rd floor of The  St Pat's Bar and Grill in the heart of midtown for this fun and informative evening.  Come alone or bring a friend, either way it is going to be a great  night out.

Here is how it works..

-Arrive between 6:30-7:30pm for socializing, mixing and mingling.  During that time you will anonymously fill out your most compelling questions, comments and observations about the opposite sex and drop them into a hat.

-When we have filled the hat our moderator will sit everyone down and read off the questions that will be directed to the opposite sex.  Participants are invited to answer, debate, add to and explain with hopefully useful information  for the opposite sex.

This has been an awesome night for us in the past and usually very informative when it comes to finding out what the opposite sex is thinking about dating, relationships, sex, etiquette, behavior, professional advice and more.

There will be $5 drink specials on beer, wine and cocktails until 8pm.

A full menu is available.

Can I come alone?  Yes 99% of those attending will come on their own.

Dress code: Business casual

Is there food?  Yes St Pat's has an awesome menu.  Get there closer to 6:30pm if you wish to eat.
results.name: He Said/She Said Forum Plus Singles Happy Hour

results.description:
Like our Facebook Page!:

   facebook.com/ManhattanInternationalCoedSoccer

Game description: 

Teams are 4 V 4, no goalies, no gender requirements (but we'd like at least 1 female player per team). Games will be played on a 1st goal rotation basis or 15 minutes time limit. The team that scores first stays on  the field. But if your team remains on the field after scoring 3 goals, we'll split the team up so that everyone has a fair chance to have a great game.

RULES OF THE GAME:

First and most important rule of the game is to have fun and enjoy the time on the field! 

VERY IMPORTANT: 

- NO FOULS

- NO SIDE TACKLING

- NO PUSHING

- NO TELLING OFF

* ZERO TOLERANCE*


By minimizing physical contact, we minimize injuries and violence.


         “Futsal is not a physical but a technical game ”

If you don't sign up for the game, do not show up.

Rough play and offensive language will absolutely not be tolerated!!

We encourage competitive, but safe play. 

We reserve the right to ask anyone to leave who has exhibited any behavior that could be construed as violent, offensive, or dangerous. 

Those that don't comply with these rules, will kindly be asked to leave the field so others can enjoy the game. 


Any other questions regarding the rules of the game or anything else, should be directed to the organizer directly or to the assistant organizer/s!!!

Please check our meetup message board, 10 PM the night before to see what team you are on. This will save us a lot of time on the field.

Location and Directions:

West End Presbyterian Church

165 West 105th Street, New York, NY

Near the lines: 1, 2, 3, B, and C trains.

AS YOU COME IN, TAKE THE STAIRS ON YOUR LEFT AND WALK TO THE 4TH FLOOR.

Call me if you can’t find us - (917)[masked] Manny S.


What to bring with you: 
A positive attitude, pair of sneakers or INDOOR shoes (ONLY), shin guards (recommended) and lots of water.

Fee: 
You will be asked to pay $9.25 dollars when you RSVP. This $9.25 dollars is used to pay for: permits, meetup fees, Amazon fees, Goals, soccer balls etc.

Refund Policy: 


* The Meetup is cancelled

* You can cancel at least 2 day(s) before the Meetup


Very IMPORTANT Due to the location where we will be playing:

We expect everyone to respect the facilities and act accordingly.

Anyone who is asked to leave will not be refunded and WILL be permanently banned from the group

After the game we can go for a quick drink at:

                                            TAP a KEG

                                         2731 Broadway

                                     New York, NY 10025

                            Betwee[masked]th and Broadway  

By RSVP'ing you agree to our Liability waiver:

PARTICIPATING IN MANHATTAN-INTERNATIONAL-COED-SOCCER ACTIVITIES AGREEMENT: 


I certify that I have no known medical or other conditions that could interfere with my participation in Manhattan-International-COED-Soccer activities. I also understand and accept that the practice of soccer, both indoor and outdoor, involves certain risks of physical injury. Therefore, I, individually, hereby release and discharge, Manhattan-International-COED-Soccer Organizer and Assistant Organizers from any and all claims, actions, damages, losses, liabilities, costs and expenses of any kind whatsoever, including but not limited to any claims of negligence, arising out of, resulting from, by reason of, or in connection with my participation in any of Manhattan-International-COED-Soccer programs or activities. Manhattan-International-COED-Soccer Organizer and its Assistant Organizers reserve the right to take and utilize photographs, video, or any type of recording of participating person while engaged in our or associated activities. I consent to Manhattan-International-COED-Soccer use the photograph, video, or recording of me, for advertising, promotional, or related purposes, and waive all rights to compensation and other rights which may arise as a result.

results.description:
Abstract 

The security landscape is rapidly changing with greater cloud adoption and the high rates of application, machine, and container changes. Join HashiCorp as we discuss how to approach security with Vault in this dynamic environment. Topics that will be explored are secret sprawl, dynamic secrets, the zero-trust datacenter, and more. 


Schedule 
6:30 - 7:15PM Food, Drinks, & Networking 

7:15 - 7:50PM Armon Dadgar, HashiCorp 

7:50 - 8:10PM Q&A, Discussion Speakers 

8:10 - 9:00PM Continue networking 

Presenters

Armon Dadgar, CTO, HashiCorp  

Armon (@armon) has a passion for distributed systems and their application to real world problems. He is currently the CTO of HashiCorp, where he brings distributed systems into the world of DevOps tooling. He has worked on Nomad, Vault, Terraform, Consul, and Serf at HashiCorp, and maintains the Statsite and Bloomd OSS projects as well.
results.name: Securing the modern datacenter with Vault by HashiCorp

results.description:
Please read carefully: This event is being sponsored by Dave Cervini's New York Social Network and their partner Meet Up Groups.  The number of RSVP's listed on your Meet Up reflect only a portion of those actually attending from all the groups participating, you won’t be alone!.  If you have questions regarding this event contact the host directly at [masked] or call[masked]-2256.

We all know that men are from Mars and Women are from Venus but does that apply to the species living in New York City???!!!  Why do things seem so different here??!!  Join us for this fun and interactive night where we get to the bottom of what the opposite sex is thinking.  We have reserved the private lounge on the 3rd floor of The  St Pat's Bar and Grill in the heart of midtown for this fun and informative evening.  Come alone or bring a friend, either way it is going to be a great  night out.

Here is how it works..

-Arrive between 6:30-7:30pm for socializing, mixing and mingling.  During that time you will anonymously fill out your most compelling questions, comments and observations about the opposite sex and drop them into a hat.

-When we have filled the hat our moderator will sit everyone down and read off the questions that will be directed to the opposite sex.  Participants are invited to answer, debate, add to and explain with hopefully useful information  for the opposite sex.

This has been an awesome night for us in the past and usually very informative when it comes to finding out what the opposite sex is thinking about dating, relationships, sex, etiquette, behavior, professional advice and more.

There will be $3-$8 drink specials on beer, wine and cocktails.

A full menu is available.

Cost:  Pay $5 at the door

Can I come alone?  Yes 99% of those attending will come on their own.

Dress code: Business casual

Is there food?  Yes St Pat's has an awesome menu.  Get there closer to 6:30pm if you wish to eat.
results.name: The Differences Between Men and Women Great Face Off Forum & Happy Hour

results.description:
This is a fun and informal mixer and networking event to catch up with your peers working on, or interested in, the New York City sharing economy. The sharing economy continues to evolve and this is a chance to mix informally with others from this rapidly growing economic sector.

The event is hosted by the sharing economy organization Ouishare and organized by Jeremy Osborn, who is visiting New York City from Montreal. Ouishare is planning a North American Summit in Montreal in September of 2016 and you can learn more about this event as well, if interested.

There is no agenda for the evening, just informal drinks and conversation.
results.name: Partner Event: Ouishare Drinks

results.description:
This is a special event geared for startups, makers, designers, and inventors to showcase stylish tech products. While also being able to have it broadcasted and streamed via Periscope. Everyone is encouraged to BYOP (Bring Your Own Product). Everyone is encouraged to bring their own product that that has a tangible, hardware, style component.

• Technology displayed must be applicable to consumer technology
• Technology cannot already be commercially available
• The technology must be demonstrable as a prototype or software mockup; no paper/concept/slideshow entries.

The moderator of the event will be Sandy Choi who is a former radio host in Hawaii, and a prominent live streamer on Periscope and headliner at the Periscope Summit.

The event will also be broadcasted online and will be live from where the event takes place in Manhattan.
results.name: BYOP (Bring Your Own Product/Prototype) and Live Streaming

results.description:
Weekly Thursday open figure drawing night at the Shoestring Press!

Models include Burlesque performers, drag kings and queens, SVA and Pratt model alums, dancers, yogis, and more...

6:30-9:30pm, stay afterward for dinner gratis! Every Thursday afternoon we fire up the crockpot and see what comes of it. Bring desert or fruit if you so desire. Beer is in the fridge, coffee is hot (or cold depending on the season) and the camaraderie is warm.

At the Shoestring Press's new digs (we re-opened in February) 663 Classon Ave between Bergen and Dean in Crown Heights.

Members of the Press pay $10, $15 for non-members, or $10 if you bring a friend.

results.description:
Join us for an introductory dive into Ruby, a beginner-friendly language used on servers in backend web development (i.e., the stuff that goes on between entering a URL and getting a web page back). In this workshop, we will walk you through the basics of the Ruby language and how to use it to set up a basic web server.

Key Takeaways: 

• All the tools you need to get up, running and coding with Ruby

• Ruby syntax for basic programming concepts like variables, loops, methods, strings, arrays and hashes

• The basics of how the World Wide Web works under the hood

• Setting up a simple web server and sending HTML pages to a browser

• Using your server to interact with Twitter via its API


Prerequisites and Preparation: 

• Please bring your own laptop (Mac, PC or Chromebook). 

• Please download and install Sublime Text (Hint: the download button is on the home page).

• Light snacks will be provided. 


*This event is open to adult (18+) beginners and is an introduction to concepts covered more deeply in the immersive program.
results.name: Ruby For Beginners

The <DIV> Awards will celebrate individuals & organizations championing the nationwide movement to increase diversity in the fields of Science, Technology, Engineering, and Math (STEM).


This special night, a capstone event of Social Media Week 2016, will bring together leaders from the tech, government, non-profit and education sectors for the biggest celebration of its kind.

This one of a kind event will include special guest speakers, an open bar, passed hors d'oeuvres, a silent auction, tickets to see special musical guest, a Tech in Motion after party across the street at B-Bar, and more!

results.description:
</a><a href="http://nodeschool.io/">NodeSchool gives you a chance to work on interactive programming workshops with mentors available in case you get stuck or have any questions.  This event is recommended for engineers with JavaScript experience but no Node.js experience is required.

Bring: An ID to show security and your laptop 

Prepare: 

Install Node.js before arriving. We'll certainly be available to help get Node.js installed if you're having issues, but coming prepared will mean more time for coding!

Workshops:

For this NodeSchool, you will have 4 workshops to choose from. Choose one to start.

CORE WORKSHOPS: 

• JavaScript (javascripting)

• ES6 (count-to-6)


• Node (learnyounode)

FEATURED WORKSHOP: 


• Express (expressworks)

You can get more details on about the workshops at: http://nodeschool.io. We'll be focusing on the workshops mentioned above, but attendees are welcome to try any of the workshops available on nodeschool.io

Agenda:

6:30 - 7:00: Mingle, drinks (including beer!), and pizza.

7:00 - 8:30: Get cracking on the workshops 

8:30 - 9:00: Wrap-up

Facilitator:

Andrew Ingraham will facilitate the event. 

Mentors:

- Andrew Ingraham - Facilitator

- Gautam Arora - Host

- Maxwell Watson

- Tapan Shah

- William Blankenship

- Christopher Lee

- Evelyn Leathe Straigt

- Stefania Druga

- Gil Chen Zion

- Alex Mejias

- Cormick Browne

Host:

Condé Nast is generously offering space, food and drinks. 

Condé Nast is a premier media company renowned for producing the highest quality content for the world’s most influential audiences. Attracting 115 million consumers across its industry-leading print, digital, and video brands, the company’s portfolio includes some of the most iconic titles in media: Vogue, Vanity Fair, Glamour, Brides, Self, GQ, The New Yorker, Condé Nast Traveler, Details, Allure, Architectural Digest, Bon Appétit, Epicurious, Wired, W, Golf Digest, Golf World, Teen Vogue, Ars Technica, and Style.com. Built While Flying is Condé Nast’s digital team who is dedicated to growing our already rapidly expanding digital consumer base. 

= = = = = = = = = = = = = = = = = = = = = = = = = = = = 

NY JavaScript expects all speakers and attendees to follow the JSConf Code of Conduct.

Due to limited seating, RSVPs for our events are $3-15. There are no refunds or transfers. Proceeds go to ScriptEd, a charity to increase code literacy among NYC youth at under-resourced schools.

If you would like to sponsor or speak at one of our events, please email us at [masked].
results.name: NodeSchool: JS, ES6, Node, Express

results.description:
Get Full Details & Tickets At: http://www.clickmixers.com/speed-dating-40s-50s.html

Speed Dating - Ages 40s & 50s (Must Pre Pay Online)

When: Thursday, February 25th, 2016
6:30 PM - 8:30 PM (Check in at 6:20)
Where: Tagine Lounge  (221 West 38th St.New York, NY - Between 7th & 8th Ave)

PRICE: $34  (Must Pre-Pay Online. No Tickets Sold At Event Door)
(We recommend getting your tickets as far in advance as possible because once we fill up for a certain gender we will list event as sold out for that gender. Sign up now to secure your spot).

The RSVP list on this page is not an indication of actual event attendees. This event is being listed on over 10 different singles Meetup groups and also outside of Meetup.

EVENT DETAILS:
Speed dating is so much fun and a great way to meet quality, single professionals in the busy city of NYC. Most people know within a few minutes if they would like to see someone again. We may be biased but we definitely think this is a much better way to meet people than online dating or at a random bar.

You will go on between 7 and 15 mini dates each lasting between four and eight minutes each (we lengthen or shorten the date time according to how many people attend). Women stay seated and the men rotate from table to table until they meet each woman.

You will get a match card and at the end of each mini date you'll discreetly indicate whether or not you'd like to see the person again. At the end of the evening you will hand your match card in to the event host. If you both select each other, we will send you each others' email address the next day so you can set up a future date!

Get Your Tickets At: http://www.clickmixers.com/speed-dating-40s-50s.html

* There is a one drink minimum at the event. If you don't drink alcohol, you're welcome to order soda, juice or an item from the food menu.

FAQ:

WHAT IS THE DRESS CODE?
Please no sneakers, t-shirts or gym attire.

CAN I PAY AT THE EVENT DOOR?
We do no accept payment at the event door. You must pre-pay online.

WHEN WILL I GET MY MATCHES EMAILED TO ME?
We will email you matches within 48 hours after the event.

IS THERE A REFUND POLICY?
If you need to cancel, please email us and we can transfer you to a future event. However we do not offer refunds if you cancel on the day of the event or don't show up.

WHO IS ATTENDING?
The RSVP list on this page is not an indication of actual event attendees. This event is being listed on over 10 different singles Meetup groups and also outside of Meetup. Most people attending are not from Meetup. You can feel free to RSVP page to let the group know you're attending but you still have to go to the above link to pay for the event.

Get Tickets At: http://www.clickmixers.com/speed-dating-40s-50s.html

results.description:
This is a FREE yoga class that meets from 6:30 to 8:00 pm, instructed by Chia-Ti Chiu, one of the organizers of this Meetup group.

It is an OPEN LEVEL HATHA FLOW class, appropriate for beginners to advanced students.  There are many variations given to accommodate the different levels of yoga experience.


** You will need to bring your own mat.  There are no yoga mats for rent or use. You can buy yoga mats inexpensively at Marshalls, Filene's Basement, Modells, TJ Maxx, and Target. Many yoga studios also carry a wide range of mats for sale.

IF YOU COME FOR THE FIRST TIME: PLEASE FILL OUT THE REGISTRATION FORM AT THE FRONT DESK. RSVPing on Meetup does not count as Beacon registration.  Your participation and registration helps keep the numbers needed for this program to stay free!


FOR EVERYONE: PLEASE SIGN IN AT THE FRONT DESK CLEARLY AND LEGIBLY

DIRECTIONS:The Beacon Center is located in PS 198. It is an elementary school that takes up the whole block; entrance is on 3rd Ave. The exact address is: 1700 Third Avenue, between 95 & 96 St.

BY SUBWAY: 6 train to 96 St. Walk 1 block East on 96 St to Third Ave. Make a right onto Third Ave.

BY BUS: Third Ave Bus - M101, 102, 103 to 96 St.

Madison Ave Bus - M1, M2,M3, or M4 To 96 St.


ANY QUESTIONS? Contact Chia-Ti through Meetup or through her website: www.onelovewellness.com

results.description:
Get Full Details & Tickets At: http://www.clickmixers.com/speed-dating-40s-50s.html

Speed Dating - Ages 40s & 50s (Must Pre Pay Online)

When: Thursday, February 25th, 2016
6:30 PM - 8:30 PM (Check in at 6:20)
Where: Tagine Lounge  (221 West 38th St.New York, NY - Between 7th & 8th Ave)

PRICE: $34  (Must Pre-Pay Online. No Tickets Sold At Event Door)
(We recommend getting your tickets as far in advance as possible because once we fill up for a certain gender we will list event as sold out for that gender. Sign up now to secure your spot).

The RSVP list on this page is not an indication of actual event attendees. This event is being listed on over 10 different singles Meetup groups and also outside of Meetup.

EVENT DETAILS:
Speed dating is so much fun and a great way to meet quality, single professionals in the busy city of NYC. Most people know within a few minutes if they would like to see someone again. We may be biased but we definitely think this is a much better way to meet people than online dating or at a random bar.

You will go on between 7 and 15 mini dates each lasting between four and eight minutes each (we lengthen or shorten the date time according to how many people attend). Women stay seated and the men rotate from table to table until they meet each woman.

You will get a match card and at the end of each mini date you'll discreetly indicate whether or not you'd like to see the person again. At the end of the evening you will hand your match card in to the event host. If you both select each other, we will send you each others' email address the next day so you can set up a future date!

Get Your Tickets At: http://www.clickmixers.com/speed-dating-40s-50s.html

* There is a one drink minimum at the event. If you don't drink alcohol, you're welcome to order soda, juice or an item from the food menu.

FAQ:

WHAT IS THE DRESS CODE?
Please no sneakers, t-shirts or gym attire.

CAN I PAY AT THE EVENT DOOR?
We do no accept payment at the event door. You must pre-pay online.

WHEN WILL I GET MY MATCHES EMAILED TO ME?
We will email you matches within 48 hours after the event.

IS THERE A REFUND POLICY?
If you need to cancel, please email us and we can transfer you to a future event. However we do not offer refunds if you cancel on the day of the event or don't show up.

WHO IS ATTENDING?
The RSVP list on this page is not an indication of actual event attendees. This event is being listed on over 10 different singles Meetup groups and also outside of Meetup. Most people attending are not from Meetup. You can feel free to RSVP page to let the group know you're attending but you still have to go to the above link to pay for the event.

Get Tickets At: http://www.clickmixers.com/speed-dating-40s-50s.html

results.description:
This is a free group for anyone who enjoys playing board games and would like to make new friends while doing so. No previous knowledge of board games is necessary. We're happy to help newcomers along with how to play, as well as how to plan strategies to win the games.  

Our event is every Thursday night at Dave & Buster's in Westbury Long Island from 6:30pm to 10:30pm.  You can leave prior to 10:30pm if you want, also please note that Dave & Buster's closes at Midnight for those who want to stay later. 

Most people arrive at 6:30pm.  We use the first 30 minutes to talk, order food/drinks, and pick out games while we wait for any people that are a little late.  Promptly at 7pm we split into groups and play our games that typically take 2 hours to play.  So, if you arrive after 7pm there is a good chance that you will not be able to get into a game and can watch us play if you'd like.  At the end of the night we play a couple of additional shorter games that you can get into.

This group meets in the Large Dining Room at the table directly in front of the wall with 9 Big Screen TV's.   We are 1 room over from the pool tables.  There is no cover charge to enter Dave & Buster's and plenty of parking is available. Also, there is no fee to join this meetup group. All that management at Dave & Buster's asks is that each person purchase $5 off their menu (it can be 1 appetizer, or 1 dessert, or a few sodas, basically whatever you choose).  

Plenty of board games will be present at this event, but feel free to bring some of your favorites. Some of the games that we play are Kingsburg, Stone Age, Lords of Waterdeep, Istanbul, Ticket to Ride, Carcassonne, Castles of Mad King Ludwig, Love Letter Batman, Splendor, Pirate's Cove, Five Tribes, Castles of Burgundy, and more.  

Here is a list of the board games I own on the BGG website: 

https://boardgamegeek.com/collection/user/MarkNY8?own=1&subtype=boardgame&ff=1

Here is a list of Co-Host Kenny's games on BGG: 

https://boardgamegeek.com/collection/user/kenk1982?own=1&subtype=boardgame&ff=1

Looking forward to meeting you. 

Mark
results.how_to_find_us: This group meets in the Large Dining Room at the table directly in front of the wall with 9 Big Screen TV's.   We are 1 room over from the pool tables.
results.name: Thursday Night Board Games at Dave & Busters!

results.description:
I'm loving the momentum of this group and witnessing how folks are improving their language skills and making friends. To me, it makes all of this worth doing!

So let's get ready for another great meetup! 

As always, first introduce yourself in the language you are studying. Then introduce yourself in your native language. 

Following that, we will dedicate 30 minutes towards helping those learning English, then 30 minutes of Chinese. 

Then we mingle again until its time to go. 

We are usually done by 8:30 but those that want to stick around or continue hanging out after the meetup (bubble tea, karaoke, etc) are more than welcome to do so!

Thanks again for your support thus far and let's have many more great meetups! 非常感谢大家的支持！

results.description:
Aside from our League play we offer Open Play 6 days a week. 1 hour and 45 minute sessions only $11 midweek.

Format: 3 teams of 5 per court. Score by 1’s. Games to 7. Winner stays but must sit after 2 games. No refs. Call your own. Our moderator will help things along. All players must bring a white and a dark shirt (not grey). This is a friendly run. Anyone with the wrong attitude will not be allowed back. Age: 21+

Our open runs are designed for good fun and a run. The A / B breakdown is purely a self rating device to try and split things up in an enjoyable manner. Think of it as if you were going to the park to play. If you are average or above go to the A court. If you are average or below go to B.  It is not exact. There is always going to be some crossover.  

***Please note- RSVP'g on Meetup will not reserve your spot. Please go to our website to sign up.*** A credit card payment is required to reserve your space. Just click the session that interests you.


http://nyurban.com/open-play-basketball/

We will send you a confirmation email. Show up at the Gym with I.D. We will have you on our list but please bring your receipt. No payment at the door.

In the bitter cold of a land mired in eternal winter, hunters take the shape of wolves to better kill their prey. They stalk the snow-filled forests on paws of deadly silence. Powerful and swift, these evil shape-changers roam the land at will, murdering those who oppose them and plundering the weak. At the head of this pack paces the great Black Wolf of the wood. Are you clever enough to survive against villains who are stronger, faster, and fiercer than any you have ever encountered? The Black Wolf awaits your answer in the biting cold....
More info can be found here at http://njdnd.boards.net/

results.description:
Intimacy: Making Relationships Meaningful

with Kadam Peter

Why do relationships seem to cause us so many difficulties? Why does attachment keep us trapped in painful cycles, making it hard to love and cherish others? This series will help strengthen, deepen or revitalize our relationships. Create fulfilling and vibrant connections with restored intimacy, joy, and generosity.  Join our sangha (our spiritual community) as we learn to develop warm, vital relationships in our journey toward wholeness and freedom.

Kadam Peter Kurczynski is the resident teacher of Dharmachakra BuddhistCenter. He has been practicing Buddhism in formal study programs of the New Kadampa Tradition for nearly twenty years. His teachings are timely, practical and easy to apply in everyday life.  In 2013, he received the title “Kadam,” meaning senior lay resident teacher. Kadam Peter has participated in numerous meditation retreats, and regularly attends international festivals of Kadampa Buddhism.

$15.00 suggested donation. No one turned away for lack of funds.

results.description:
On a Dark Winter’s Night...

at a Private New York Address...

with Open Bar and Music...

a Masked Ball in Festive Dress!


The United Nations Association of New York invites you to our inaugural winter soirée for 2016: A Winter Masquerade. It's conceived in the same spirit as our popular Summer Soirée — but with an added dash of mystery and elegance to warm up a cold winter evening in grand style. The National Arts Club in Gramercy Park, which usually opens its doors to its members only, will host this winter-season event that is dedicated to a night of fun, music, drinks and food. Wear your most festive garb, include an amusing mask or headdress you can hide behind (for a while, at least!), then come out to meet, mix and mingle with other UNA members, their friends and guests who share our enthusiasm for international affairs and the work of the United Nations. This Winter Masquerade will be held from 7 to 10 p.m. and will feature an open bar, Tuscan hors d'oeuvres, dancing, and an exclusive view of one of the most wonderful private art collections in New York, gracing the many rooms of the Club. We cordially invite you to book yourself for this Winter Masquerade. Merriment, mystery, music and fantasy on a cold winter's night... will someone be able to recognize you?

R E S E R V A T I O N S 

$75 – UNA Members

$90 – Non-members and Guests

REGISTER HERE
results.name: A Winter Masquerade

results.description:
We will have one station hooked up to a projector for presenting materials. I encourage you all to bring your images, before & afters, layered files, etc., so that we may review and critique them. The room we will be using seats 18, with electrical outlets for those of you who would like to bring your own laptops. I'd like to review members' portfolio websites as well, so make sure your sites are up-to-date. If you have business cards, or a physical portfolio book, please bring those too.

If anyone has something in particular they are interested in discussing, please send me an email about it and I'll do my best to prep for it! Bring your questions, people!

Please be aware when you RSVP that if you say you will be in attendance, and then do NOT show up– WITHOUT updating your RSVP to reflect your inability to attend– you will be fined $10. If you are a no-show (meaning you say you'll attend and don't show up without changing your RSVP) three times, you will be dismissed from the group.

There is no penalty for changing your RSVP (BEFORE the scheduled meetup). So if you say you'll come, and then you can't make it, simply change your RSVP to "no"; no harm done. Please just be respectful with your participation (or lack thereof). Thanks!

results.description:
Please read carefully: This event is being sponsored by Dave Cervini's New York Social Network and their partner Meet Up Groups.  The number of RSVP's listed on your Meet Up reflect only a portion of those actually attending from all the groups participating.  If you have questions regarding this event contact the host directly at [masked] or call[masked]-2256.

THIS EVENT IS NOT EXCLUSIVELY FOR MEMBERS OF ANY PARTICULAR POLITICAL PARTY, IT IS OPEN FOR ALL TO ENJOY.  Our gathering is first and foremost a Happy Hour for people to come together and socialize.  Secondly, it is a great way for everyone to keep tabs on all the current candidates and thirdly a great way to see the debate if you don't have access to the channel it is on that night!!   Arrive at 6:30pm for socializing and cocktails, grab a bite to eat then sit back and catch all the action on dozens of large monitors. This will be the Republican Debate.

This event is meant to be a fun and interesting way to kick off the political season. If you attend all we ask is that if you feel strongly about any candidate you keep your comments educated and dignified.  If you feel like you may get too passionate and cause arguing we would appreciate if you watched at home!

Do I have to be a Republican to attend? NO. NO. NO! This event is open to all to get an idea of what the candidates are all about.  We will have parties for the Democratic Debates as well

Can I come alone? Yes, 98% of those attending will be coming on their own.

What should I wear?  Most people are coming from work so they will have on their work clothes, business casual

Is there food available?  Yes they have an awesome menu, separate checks no problem.
results.name: Presidential Debates Viewing Party & After Work Happy Hour 2nd Floor at St Pat's

results.description:
You can also register through eventbrite here: http://bit.ly/20Isv72

Dear Fellow Entrepreneur,

Taxes are the greatest liability as well as the biggest source of stress for small business owners. Not understanding your taxes could cost you tens of thousands of dollars in over-taxation, penalties, and lost time in case of IRS audits.

Please join us for this workshop with small business tax expert Rachel Michaelov, EA, NTPI Fellow, and understand your tax obligations. This free seminar will benefit established businesses, those getting started and individuals anticipating going into business. 

Some of the topics that will be covered in the workshop are:  

1. Types of Entities and why some are better than others (C Corps, S corps, LLC’s)

2. Best Practices for Small business owners and how you should keep your books and records.

3. Payroll tax 101: who needs to file, what documents you need to keep as an employer and important tips for hiring employees.

4. Sales tax 101: who needs to collect sales tax returns, when they are due and penalties for not filing sales tax returns.

5. Corporate tax deadlines and Penalties for not filing on time.

6. Most important: Top Tax deductions that you can write off.  Details of business expenses that you can write off and what you need to deduct specific expenses.

We will follow a structured format:

6:00-6:15pm - open networking/registration 
6:15-6:45pm - Workshop  
6:45-7:15pm - Q&A  

Keep Learning, Keep Growing, 

Aditi
results.name: Taxes for small business(Complimentary workshop)

DramaFever is hosting an advanced screening of "Likes for Likes" at the AMC Empire! 


"Like for Likes," stars Yoo Ah In (Veteran), Kang Ha Neul (Twenty), Choi Ji Woo (Twenty Again) and Esom (Man on High Heels, White Christmas).  

Lee Mi Yeon, who starred as the older version of Duk Sun in "Reply 1988," leads the cast, which also features Kim Joo Hyun, who portrays Duk Sun's adult husband in "Reply 1988."

Tickets for this special event are limited and are specially priced for DramaFever premium members, as well as those who may be considering a membership. 


DramaFever premium members can attend for $4.99 plus a processing fee. Individual general admission is $10.99 plus a processing fee, which is also a discounted rate. 

In partnership with CJ E&M, DramaFever, the leading online destination for international television shows, movies, and concerts, will be hosting an advanced screening on February 25 at AMC Empire 25 in New York.  

Attendees who are not already Premium members will receive a free 30-day DramaFever subscription. 

Tickets can be purchased here. Seating will be limited.


If you are attending, please comment below!

results.description:
Comic time! This week: Granny Smith and The Flim Flam Brothers, and Fluttershy and Iron Will.  So pack your books and come over to this week's meetup for Friends Forever #9 and #10(descriptions and download links below) 

http://vignette2.wikia.nocookie.net/mlp/images/9/91/Friends_Forever_issue_9_cover_A.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20140618164153

Friends Forever #9

The Apple family are on their way to the 45th AppleCon, a convention dedicated to apples and other assorted fruits, with Granny Smith expressing bitterness that the convention has strayed from its apples-only roots. The Apples soon reach the crowded convention grounds and set up their own booth.  Apple Bloom goes to wait in line for a limited-edition apple peeler while Granny Smith wanders the grounds to check out (and scorn) the orange and berry farmers' booths.


Written by: Christina Rice 
Artwork by: Tony Fleecs 

Download link: https://www.comixology.com/My-Little-Pony-Friends-Forever-9/digital-comic/137031?ref=c2VhcmNoL2luZGV4L2Rlc2t0b3Avc2xpZGVyTGlzdC9pdGVtU2xpZGVy

http://vignette2.wikia.nocookie.net/mlp/images/a/ae/Friends_Forever_issue_10_SUB_cover.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20140716160216

Friends Forever #10

The issue opens outside the Friendship Rainbow Kingdom Friendship castle.Twilight Sparkle and Spike enjoy "another perfect day in Ponyville" when a crowd of ponies suddenly runs past them in fear and panic. In the direction the ponies were running from, Twilight and Spike hear Iron Will's booming voice demanding to see Fluttershy.


Written by: Christina Rice 
Artwork by: Agnes Garbowska

Download link: https://www.comixology.com/My-Little-Pony-Friends-Forever-10/digital-comic/150110?ref=c2VhcmNoL2luZGV4L2Rlc2t0b3Avc2xpZGVyTGlzdC9pdGVtU2xpZGVy

601 Lexington Ave – Btw. 52nd & 53rd Street – Take the 6 train to 51st Street. The building itself is actually connected to the 53rd Street E/M/6 MTA subway station and is one of New York's largest skyscrapers.

results.description:
On February 25, 2016, we'll benefit The Humane League.

The mission of The Humane League is to reduce animal suffering by inspiring change at all levels.

Web: http://www.thehumaneleague.com/
Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/thehumaneleague/
Twitter and Instagram @TheHumaneLeague

Support The Humane League: make donations, buy merchandise and raffle tickets for a chance to win books on animal rights activism and a selection of THL merch.

Food by Yeah Dawg!

Come say goodbye to Fontanas Bar at the last Vegan Drinks before they officially close :(

----

Vegan Drinks is a monthly social networking* event for people interested in promoting veganism and advocating for animal rights. Vegan Drinks’ mission is to bring together a diverse group of people—from cupcake aficionados to animal lawyers to veg*ns of all stripes in between—to build new coalitions and promote the sharing of resources. Vegan Drinks is for newbies and oldies. All we expect is an interest in animal rights, veganism and the pursuit of after-work fun. Show up and introduce yourself, pass around business cards (if you've got ‘em) and embarrass yourself at least once an hour.

*Although we think love is grand, Vegan Drinks is not a singles’ event. But, if you happen to meet the love of your life at Vegan Drinks, don't forget to invite us to the wedding!

-- What to do?
Be friendly! We'll be passing out nametags, so you can march right up to someone and greet them by name.
Promote! If you're representing an organization (either as an employee or volunteer or general supporter), talk up the organization and the work you've been involved in. If you're representing you, talk up your vegan and AR interests, your favorite restaurant, your dream job for animals, your blog, etc., etc.
Make a shout out! Starting around 8:30pm, we'll turn down the music and encourage people to promote themselves, their groups and/or causes for 30 seconds. If you represent a veg*n or animal rights group, come prepared with your spiel and literature!
Sip a drink (alcoholic or non-alcoholic, we don't care!) and relax with like-minded folks for a couple of hours.

What to bring?
Business cards
Pamphlets promoting your organization
Tip money for the cute bartenders
Your A-game
Vegan Drinks takes place the last Thursday of the month (usually; check the date to be sure!) from 7pm to 10pm. It's an alcohol-based event and it's at a bar, so you have to be at least 21 years old.

If you have questions or comments, contact us at [masked].

There is no dress code. If you come straight from work in a suit, we promise not to make fun of you. Entrance is free, but the booze is not. Remember to tip your friendly bartenders!
results.name: Vegan Drinks Benefits The Humane League, Food by Yeah Dawg!

results.description:
Speaker

Speaker will be Chad Ostrowsky from Citrusbyte.

Schedule

• 630pm Doors Open

• 630pm-715pm Happy Hour


• 715pm-800pm Talk & QA

• 8pm-Closing Networking 


Description

You've just signed up for a new web app. Upon first sign-in, it has you fill in a short quiz to get you onboarded.


Easy.

For the user! But if you're not thoughtful while building such an interface, it can quickly turn into an unmanageable mess of deeply-nested if statements.

In this talk, we'll look at how the speaker solved this issue for https://entire.life without using a single if statement (this statement possibly a tiny bit hyperbolic). Discussion of alternate possibilities strongly encouraged.

If there's time and interest, we'll also look at how to port component state from this whole scenario into the Redux global state.
results.name: Quiz Quizzical Quixotic: Managing pure-state UI flows without going mad

results.description:
We're excited to have a Ember core team member Alex Matchneer (@machty) to present a full-length talk on ember-concurrency. Dealing with race conditions can be one of the most frustrating, verbose, and bug-prone part of building browser apps. Alex will show us how ember-concurrency offers an elegant solution to this class of problems.

Plus Lightning Talks...


Phil Gengler (@pgengler) on "Putting Composability to Work"

Dan Sudol on "Concise scenario setup for Ember tests"


And, you'll be witness to the unveiling of the brand new NYC Tomster!

~

We have room for one or two more lightning talks. Please contact luke _at_ lukemelia.com if you would like to present.
results.name: February Meetup - Alex Matchneer on ember-concurrency

results.description:
Love brazilian music? This workshop is for you!
We'll get to work on classics of bossa-nova, understand the rhythm patterns and learn the finger style technique to master comping and the nuances of brazilian clave.
You'll get familiar with 7th, 9th, 13th, diminish chords.
Nylon string guitar is recommended for this class but you won't get turned away if you bring a steel string guitar.
You must be familiar with open chords and comfortable playing songs and switching chords in time. Barre chord knowledge is a plus but nor required for this workshop.
This is a one hour workshop with the option of performing three songs May 1st at Arlene's Grocery.
Obrigada!
results.name: Brazilian Guitar Workshop

results.description:
Kingdom Empowerment, Inc. Radio - Kingdom Girl's, Talk Show Host, Roxanne Brown-Robinson interviews Christian Song Artist, Myra Graham Quince on “Let’s Talk About Purpose".

Date: February 25, 2016 at 7 PM Eastern Standard Time

Call in to speak with the guest @ (646)[masked]

Short Bio: Myra Graham Quince

Psalmist, Radio personality, and Writer Elder Myra Graham Quince of Latta, SC currently resides in Wilmington, NC with her husband Elder Kenneth Quince Jr. From an early age God called her to be a Psalmist which was recognized by her mother who gave her the nickname “Song Bird”. Myra began to develop her gifts as a Praise and Worship Leader at her Father's Ministry New Memorial Temple of Christ at age of 14. With the foundation set, God began to reveal to Myra not only the power of her voice but her ability to deliver the word of God providing deliverance to many. In Myra’s obedience to God many other opportunities have opened such as acting. In 2012 Myra was cast as one of the Church ladies in the Screenplay “The Color Purple”. With her ability to harmonize and project the door opened for her dream role as Effie in the 2013 Screenplay “Dream Girls”. Following these two projects in August of 2013 Myra released her first single “Psalm 91” followed by her Christmas rendition of “Oh Holy Night”. In 2014 Myra’s ministry began to blossom even more showing her that God wasn’t finished yet.

In early 2015 God began speak to Myra concerning a new ministry project. In this time of God speaking and tugging on her heart "You Made Me New"was developed. A powerful delivering message to the people of God that God is able to make ALL things new. The development of this EP happened so swiftly but came out to perfection because it was in the glorification of God, to edify his people, and to build the Kingdom. Since the releasing of this EP "You Made Me New", God has continued to show up and show out for Myra, and He is not finished yet!

In October 2015 Myra join Gospel Joy 1490am WWIL, IN Wilmington,NC as an host on the Gospel Train which airs every Sunday morning.

In December 2015, Myra became the worship leader at Freedom’s Way Ministries, in Wilmington, NC. This is only the beginning. Myra Graham Quince can often be heard saying: "the timing of God is absolute, and His favor is remarkable".
results.name: Kingdom Girl's Roxanne Brown-Robinson interviews Myra Graham Quince

results.description:
At some point, everyone wants to get away...to travel, see' new things, meet new people, get to know a new side of YOU. 

With GET AWAY as the theme, #EvolutionOpenMic  will touch on that, with the help of the night's #AscendedArtists  who know thing or two about traveling: The Bi-lingual hip hop duo, Negros Americanos  (Mcenigma Lyle and Jordan Fields )

SHOWTIME: 7PM to 9PM 

*List opens for sign ups at 6:30PM--- 20 SLOTS ONLY!!!

* one piece limit for poets, singers, and emcees. 5 minutes for other performers.

Kween Moore of Urban Kween Brand will present the #CanvasOfResource

 for us to fill up with our musings through paint.

* $5 cover plus donations

. 


ABOUT THE SHOW: 

EVOLUTION is about pushing through the comfort zone and into the unknown, for individuals must go beyond remedial to truly say they are grown. This combination open mic/ discussion forum is a safe space for all races, genders, sexual preferences, spiritual backgrounds, and art forms. Attendees will be presented a theme each week to engage as an artist and/or spectator. Part training ground, part chill spot, EVOLUTION only grows as a platform for expression so long as the people grow by using it. Risk must be taken here, if only to show others, and ourselves, what is still needed to 

#EVOLVENJ

.

results.description:
Speed dating is the most effective way for men and women to meet. Nothin' beats meeting someone face to face in a nice and safe environment. Join us for an unforgettable night of speed dating, where you will meet up to 10 singles just like you in one FUN evening!

How does it work?


You will go on about 10 dates with someone of the opposite sex, each date will be 5 minutes long/short. We will provide you with materials to tell us who you liked. If the same person(s) you pick also pick you, you will be a "Match" and we will give you each others' contact information - then the rest is up to you! Call each other up and make plans to go out!

Recommended ages: Men 25-38, Women 23-36

Tickets are $25 if you RSVP on our Meetup group / $40 at door without RSVP if space is available.


PS: We are promoting this event on several Asian professionals groups, so don't go by the amount people you see RSVP on our Meetup alone - we assure you we will have a good amount of men and women participate at our event.

results.description:
WHAT IS HRCS (HUDSON RIVER COMMUNITY SAILING)

We're a 501(c)3 nonprofit community sailing center.  We offer a year round afterschool program,  dozens of youth internship positions.  We also have an adult sailing club membership and offer public lessons.

WHO'S THIS FOR

This event is for people who have been a long time sailor, used to sail often, or have outdoor guiding experience and want to bring your passion to the water. 


WHY

Being a sailing instructor is the most fun you can have in New York City.  You have access to the water, you get to meet new people, and you’re paid to have adventures.  Schedules are flexible with opportunities for day-time, evening and weekend instructing with minimal commitment.  Instructors receive paid training, access to our fleet of sailboats and get to join a fun community. 

WHAT'LL HAPPEN

At the event you’ll get to meet and connect with other outdoor and sailing enthusiasts.  And yes, there will be snacks.  Afterwards, we’ll migrate to a local bar.  


FACEBOOK.....

Want to invite more Friends?  You can send them this Facebook Event invite:

https://www.facebook.com/events/1666000876990187/

results.description:
Overview 


This night of talks will be on Security & Programming. 

!!! Please Note !!!

Security for this event (funny enough) is very high. The building security require a list of first and last names for all attendees. Thus you MUST rsvp to this event with a profile that includes your first and last name. Also, we can not allow "+1"s. Please have them register separately. Sorry for any inconvenience. 

Talks

• Lightning Talk - (Faraz Fazli)


• Choose OAuth 1 - Jon Banafato

• Lightning Talk - (Greg Mueller)


• Yosai - Security For Any Python Application (Darin Gordon)


• Lightning Talk - (Matthew Zadrozny & Evan Misshula)

Sponsor

• DigitalOcean (https://www.digitalocean.com/) 

Lightning Talks

What's a lightning talk?

A talk that takes less than 5 minutes. A lightning talk can be on any subject that you are interested in. (Please no recruiting or advertising for your company).

Interested in giving a lightning talk? 

If you are interested in giving a lightning talk, please let us know in this event's comment stream. Just post something like "I'd like to give a lightning talk!" and well get in contact with you.

Interested in giving a future talk or tutorial?

Interested in giving a future talk? Fill out the form here: https://bit.ly/pythontalk

Interested in giving a tutorial on a Saturday? http://bit.ly/teach-python


Suggest a talk night topic: http://bit.ly/suggest-talk

results.description:
In this course you will learn how to use the Arduino to control many types and sizes of motors - from tiny motors the size of a fingernail to hacked cordless drills.  After this two hour course you will know how to select motors for their various purposes and how to write the software that drives the motors at different speeds and direction and to confirm that the commands have been carried out properly.

Reviews from our previous courses:


• "Awesome! I'd definitely go to a follow-up."

• "Great workshop, just the right touch to whet my appetite."

Requirements

We will provide laptops and Arduinos for participants.


About The Rockland County Makerspace and CILK119


This course is hosted by the Rockland County Makerspace @CILK119 (www.cilk119.com), a co-working space located in Nanuet, NY.  

Dr. Duncan Bell is a life-long tinkerer who graduated from making go-karts and skateboards to designing industrial robots that support pharmaceutical research. Along the way he earned a PhD in Botany and Biophysics and conducted research in Scotland, Italy, and the United States in photosynthesis, cancer, and arthritis. In addition to spreading the word about the fantastic capabilities of the current generation of microcontrollers, he heads up a small company that develops custom storefront displays with coordinated motion and lighting—all driven by Arduinos. Recently, his Arduino-based float was a prize winner at the Nyack Halloween parade and his Persistence of Vision special effect was featured in Elmwood Playhouse’s recent production of “Sunday in the Park with George.” 

Attendees at a recent Arduino Course

results.description:
There are lot's of adaptive learning solutions out there and new ones appearing all the time. What, if anything, does that mean for this generation of students? Does adaptive learning work? If so, where are the gains and which adaptive approaches work best?


Join us to hear a panel of educators and industry players discuss the state of adaptive learning today and what to expect in 2016 and beyond.

• Chaitu Ekanadham, Managing Data Scientist, Knewton  

• John Rinderle, Chief Technical Officer, Acrobatiq 

• Melissa Kronsberg, Managing Director of Academics, LightSail 

• Dr. Richard Simpson, Associate Professor of Computer Science at New York Institute of Technology 

• Panel Moderator: Adam Aronson, Co-Founder NYEdTech Meetup & Adaptive Learning product expert. 

Here's to another great NYEdTech Meetup! In the meantime, connect with fellow NYEdTech'ers online at: 

• Facebook - http://ow.ly/h4CZc

• Twitter - @NYEdTech

• Hashtag - #NYEdTech

And of course, we would like to thank our gracious sponsors! 

The world's largest learning company now has a developer platform! Build your own applications using Pearson's exciting content. Learn more at http://developer.pearson.com

WeWork is the platform for creators. We provide the space, community, and services you need to make a life, not just a living.


Knewton personalizes digital courses for students so every student is engaged and no student slips through the cracks.
results.name: Personalize My Education: Is Adaptive Learning There Yet?

results.description:
So .... there has been a lot of fuss about this desktop 3D printing revolution thing for a while now. Still very exciting! 


We have a new-old idea that leaps beyond the news hype and celebrates the wonder of the activity itself. Let's get together every Thursday evening to explore this broad field, in all of its many facets and manifestations. And get to know each other better -- from bold pioneers, to new adopters, from teachers to students, manufacturing experts, to code and electronics hackers. This is your space to grow and share.

Topics we might explore on a typical Thursday evening include:

- 3D design software and techniques. From getting started, to pushing boundaries.

- Explore more of the 3D ecosystem, from making use of 3D printing service bureaus to starting and managing your 3D Hub.

- How to prototype and develop your own physical products, tools, and artwork.

- 3D printing materials: strategies for fabricating in more than just 1-2 plastics.

- Casting and mold-making: from precious metals to candy bars.

- Finishing techniques. Sanding, painting, sealing, melting, deforming, decorating, hydro-printing.... Why just make things that look like plastic?

Let's spend time together sorting out better ways to use these tools, and better ways to design.

results.description:
You're invited to join us for this weekly opportunity to sharpen your drawing skills! This session is open to sketchers of all levels.

What makes our sessions different? 

• We start on time in a large, clean, well-lit space. 

• Sketchers can concentrate because our room is quiet while the model is posing.

• We have coffee and cookies at the long break. 

• We finish on time so you can be headed home at 9:00 p.m sharp! 

• (Latecomers can be seated at a break.)


• This is a two hour drawing session to work from a live (nude) model.  

• We start with short 2 minute poses and work up to a 20 minute pose by the end of the session. We take a 5 minute break every 20 minutes. 


• There are seats for everyone tables and several light weight easels. 


• Access to a sink is available for watercolor artist.

• Bring your own materials (no oil or acrylic paint and no sprays please.)

As always if you have any questions please feel free to email me. I look forward to seeing you there. 

Simon

results.description:
The East River Park track is east of the FDR at East 6th Street. It is a little over a mile from the closest subway stops (6 to Astor Place or L to First Ave).

Thursday workouts change from week to week and will be announced in advance.

Important Information about East River Park Track: The Whippets have been running here for many years and have experienced thefts of our belongings. We will take extra precautions to keep our bags safe, but please avoid bringing valuables -- and it would be safest to run with your wallet on you.

Please be aware that there are limited overhead lights, so it gets a little dark, and during winter months the bathrooms are locked and the water fountains are off. If you have a bike, make sure you have a lock because you'll have to keep your bike outside the track area.

If you feel uncomfortable leaving your personal belongings at the track, you can drop them off at Ace Bar (531 East 5th Street between A and B) -- ask for Justin or Charlo and tell them you run with the team.  They will store our belongings for us.  ***Please note that they will not let you in without your ID so please bring that with you to the track.   http://www.acebar.com/about.html

See you there -- and please contact a Whippet captain if you have any questions!

results.description:
Finalist for the PEN/Faulkner Award for Fiction, The Music of Chance follows Jim Nashe who, after squandering an unexpected inheritance, picks up a young gambler named Jack Pozzi hoping to con two millionaires. But when their plans backfire, Jim and Jack are indentured by their elusive marks and are forced to build a meaningless wall with bricks gathered from ruins of an Irish castle. Time passes, their debts mount, and anger builds as the two struggle to dig themselves out of their Kafkaesque serfdom.

New York Times-bestselling author Paul Auster (The New York Trilogy) brings us back into his strange, shape-shifting world of fiendish bargains and punitive whims, where chance is a powerful yet unpredictable force.
results.name: Let's Meetup and Discuss "The Music of Chance" by Paul Auster

results.description:
Join us for Reikishare--No experience required.

$10 in advance/$15 at the door

Reikishare is a chance to get together for camaraderie, meditation, learning and energy.

Reiki is a Japanese method of hands-on healing that promotes deep relaxation and stress reduction. As humans, it is our birthright to be able to heal with our hands. So there is no need for training or attunement in order to participate. Reiki helps us channel the frequencies of divine light and love to others. Working together we raise the vibration of all who participate.

Our agenda for the evening will be the Ocean of Holy Love meditation, followed by discussion. Then everyone present will "take a turn on the table," receiving healing energy from all the other participants.

If you have never been to a Reikishare before, it is a must-try experience. You'll keep coming back every month to find calm, peace, grounding and maybe even enlightenment!

All are welcome! Please RSVP to let me know you are coming. You can buy your ticket here: https://www.eventbrite.com/e/reikishare-tickets-21140990271 or pay $15 at the door.

Hope to see you there!!!

results.description:
Toastmasters is a place where you develop and grow - both personally and professionally. You join a community of learners, and in Toastmasters meetings we learn by doing. Whether you're an executive or a stay-at-home parent, a college student or a retiree, you will improve yourself; building skills to express yourself in a variety of situations. You'll open up a world of new possibilities: giving better work presentations; leading meetings - and participating in them - more confidently; speaking more smoothly off the cuff; even handling one-on-one interactions with family, friends and colleagues more positively.

In a club meeting, you practice giving prepared speeches as well as brief impromptu presentations, known as Table Topics. There is no rush and no pressure: The Toastmasters program allows you to progress at your own pace.

Constructive evaluation is central to the Toastmasters philosophy. Each time you give a prepared speech, an evaluator will point out strengths as well as suggest improvements. Receiving - and giving - such feedback is a great learning experience. In Toastmasters, encouragement and improvement go hand-in-hand.

Visiting a club is an exciting first step in reaching your goals. There’s no need to feel pressure to participate at your first club meeting – you can simply observe if you wish.
results.name: General Toastmasters Club Meeting
