results.description:
The Open Web Application Security Project (OWASP) is a 501(c)(3)worldwide not-for-profit charitable organization focused on improving the security of software. Our mission is to make software security visible, so that individuals and organizations worldwide can make informed decisions about true software security risks. OWASP does not endorse or recommend commercial products or services, allowing our community to remain vendor neutral with the collective wisdom of the best minds in software security worldwide. 

To access thousands of hours of video content, hundreds of projects visit www.owasp.org today.

=============================================

AGENDA

7:30pm - Networking

Session 1

Chapter News Globally and Locally with Tom Brennan 

30k OWASP RFP and other things for 2016

Session 2

The ThreadFix Ecosystem: Vendors, Volunteers, and Versions, Dan Cornell

Abstract: ThreadFix is an open source application vulnerability management system that helps automate many common application security tasks and integrate security and development tools. This presentation looks at the components of the platform and how they work together to help developers and application security analysts build more secure software. In addition to being a platform, ThreadFix is also an ecosystem of users and volunteers and the presentation will look at several case studies of how these groups have worked together to extend and improve the ThreadFix platform.

Session 3

Forensic Investigations – Tools and Hacks Observed, Ondrej Krehel


Abstract: Investigation of hacking incidents often requires combine effort of different technologies. Network forensics is one of the components in the process of finding compromised hosts, capturing and reconstructing malicious sessions. This lab will cover open source tools used for network forensics. Variety of tools can produce quite significant supplement to electronic evidence, and in many cases also capture the malicious executable transmitted in the traffic, or ex-filtrated data. 

Various network protocols and their structure will be presented. Open source network forensic tools will be used on the traffic captured from a hacked web server. Different tools will be introduced for specific tasks in the investigation process. Captured traffic will be analyzed and reconstructed and various artifacts found in the investigation will be discussed. 


=============================================


Special thanks to our venue host Thoughtworks and to our meeting sponsors Hewlett Packard, Netspi, Talener, LogRhythm and all of our local chapter supporters.  

=============================================

If you are interested in submitting a talk for an upcoming meeting click here or becoming a sponsor click here.  Have questions or need any additional information, please contact Dawn Aitken at [masked] or[masked]-6186.
results.name: RSVP OPEN - NYC Cyber Security Meetup w/ FREE Beer ;)

results.description:
Real Self Defense is Offensive in nature. 

KravMaguy offers a true, authentic Israeli Defense Forces (IDF) training experience emphasizing hand-to-hand combat, tactical and warrior training for both men and women. The Head instructor was featured in the History Channel – The Human Weapon- a documentary about Krav Maga in Israel. His last assignment was as Tactical Security Team Leader working off the coast of East Africa. 

In this basics class you will learn to defend yourself and survive knife wielding assassins, sexual assaults or any would be attacker looking to take your life using the basic principles of kravmaguy level one system. In the end only your are responsible for your own protection. You cannot rely on others when split seconds count.

Topics covered in Level One 8 week course:
Jab cross 
Fighting Stance
Weak body spots
Hook uppercut
Basic footwork
Punching jab cross
Elbows regular
Knees
Groin strikes- knees, shin to groin, groin jab (lead leg)
Knife hands
Escape- RNC
Escape guillotine
Escape schoolyard headlock (requires matted area)
Physical requirements to pass level one:
20 pushups
35 sit ups
30 squats
Level 2 training prep


check out this youtube video to see kravmaguy knife defense in action, these techniques are used by murderers and terrorists to kill countless innocents and knowing these basic defenses can save your life and the ones you love

results.description:
The Supreme Court vacancy left by Antonin Scalia's death
has become a disaster for democracy
as GOP Senators pledge not to consider any nominee,
a move that may prove a disaster for them as well.

The GOP primary opened a Pandora's Box of vitriol
catapulting Donald Trump into frontrunner status
which will either be a disaster for the Grand Old Party
or an even more dire disaster for America.

And with Jeb bushed and the field narrowing,
Cruz and Rubio are playing dangerous games
with international, social, and domestic policy
as they try to outmaneuver each other
for the prize of coming face-to-face with Donald.

The GOP is creating a Court disaster
and they are actively courting disaster
in Washington, across America and in the election.

It'd make for a really fascinating train wreck
if our country weren't on the tracks.

Compare notes, share a night,
and join in astonishment at GOP insanity
at your local progressive social club.

DRINKING LIBERALLY
Weekly gathering and GOP Debate Watch
Tonight - and every Thursday
730pm onward; 8:30pm debate
Rudy's - 9th Ave btw 44th & 45th
Look for DL buttons and banner
in the heated upper deck of the backyard.
Debate will be on the big screen.
Tonight's hosts: Justin Gerald and Keith Stewart

You can find us in the covered upper deck of the backyard -- look for a large banner on the wall, like the one shown above. The NYC Chapter of Drinking Liberally has been gathering at Rudy's Bar & Grill since our in inception in 2003.

results.description:
At the Pleasure of Mazarin: Roman Treasures from the Bibliothèque Nationale de Paris

Click here to buy tickets or call[masked]

TYPE IN DISCOUNT CODE MTP AT CHECKOUT FOR $10 DISCOUNT ON ALL PRICE LEVELS

Jessica Gould, soprano; Diego Cantalupi, archlute; Charles Weaver, theorbo; James Waldo, cello; Kenneth Hamrick, harpsichord

A Cardinal who never took holy orders, Mazarin, né Giulio Raimondo Mazzarino (1602 – 1661), was born near Naples, grew up in Rome, and became Chief Minister of France. The most powerful advisor to Louis XIV was more fascinated by art than theology, and although Bernini in Paris would ultimately be the prize of Mazarin's successor, the Cardinal imported innumerable Italian compositions and a fair number of Italian composers to his adopted country. His dedication to artistic splendor was a hallmark of his tenure and a gift to subsequent generations.

Native sons whom he championed include Luigi Rossi (1597 – 1653), whose Orfeo was one of the first operas to be staged in France, Virgilio Mazzocchi (1597 – 1646), and Giacomo Carissimi (1605 – 1674), who became the teacher of Charpentier. Their music, mostly Roman, and mostly born of the decadent Barberini papal court, came to transform the course of French music. Arias, cantatas, and operas by these Italian composers and more can be found to this day at the Bibliothèque Nationale de Paris, where many treasures of Mazarin’s collection still await a performance in our own time.

A wine and cheese reception follows the concert.
results.name: Roman baroque music followed by a wine and cheese reception

results.description:
Our Level 1 Salsa class on Thursday had a great start. The class could have gone any better. We had a good turnout and we learned everything we set out to learn for the day. The class for Week 2 of the cycle will be on Thursday February 25th. We will be on Studio H, this studio will be on building 519, which is across the street where our first class took place. Full address below.

For those who could not make it to week 1, you can still join this cycle next week Feb 25th. We will review the basic step and reiterate the same concepts. So do not fear, just come to the class and you will learn what you missed, step by step. Additionally, we will learn the right-turn footwork and how to lead it and follow it during partnerwork. We will also drill all the steps, repetition, repetition. You waited 1 whole month to start taking this class, don't miss it.

Join our facebook group for music, videos, questions/answers, and general class info: https://www.facebook.com/groups/453057848231239/

Location: Pearl Studios, 519 Eighth Avenue, 12th Floor (Btwn 35th & 36th)

Room: Studio H (12th floor)

Fee: $15 per class (cash only). You do not pay in advance. you pay when you take a class only.

Time: 8pm-9:30pm.

Here is a partial preview tentative syllabus for the first 6 weeks out of the 12:

During each week, the following concepts will be taught along with the material when necessary:

(Posture) (Weight Shifting) (hand rotation) (spotting) (pacing) (balance) (distance control) (musicality) (timing) (body coordination) (body isolations) (etc)

Week 1 (open house - anyone can join)

Footwork: Basic Step, Basic variations, upper body movement, Body isolations and coordination exercises, Timing, Music

Partnerwork: Open Hold, Close Hold, Hand placements, Correct Frame, Correct Tension

Week 2 (open house - anyone can join)

Footwork: Previous class review, Right-Turn

Partnerwork: Previous class review, Leading The right-turn, Following the right-turn

Week 3 (semi open house - only those who know the material taught on weeks 1 & 2 can join. A special class will be offered for those who want join the cycle and need to catch up)

Footwork: Previous class review, Left-Turn

Partnerwork: Previous class review, Cross-Body-Lead and Follow.

Week 4 (closed - no new students accepted)

Footwork: Previous class review, Shine 1 and 2 (Footwork variations)

Partner-work: Previous class review, Cross-body-Lead combined with Inside Turn, Turn Combinations

Week 5 (closed - no new students accepted)

Footwork: Previous class review, Shine 3 and 4 (Footwork variations)

Partner-work: Previous class review, Open-Break Step

Week 6 (closed - no new students accepted)

Footwork: Previous class review, Shine 5 and 6 (Footwork variations)

Partner-work: Previous class review, Walk-Around Turn

Week 7 - 12

More fundamental footwork and partnerwork
results.name: Week 2 - Level 1 Salsa Class Cycle (Feb 25th)

results.description:
Our Level 1 Salsa class on Thursday had a great start. The class could have gone any better. We had a good turnout and we learned everything we set out to learn for the day. The class for Week 2 of the cycle will be on Thursday February 25th. We will be on Studio H, this studio will be on building 519, which is across the street where our first class took place. Full address below.

For those who could not make it to week 1, you can still join this cycle next week Feb 25th. We will review the basic step and reiterate the same concepts. So do not fear, just come to the class and you will learn what you missed, step by step. Additionally, we will learn the right-turn footwork and how to lead it and follow it during partnerwork. We will also drill all the steps, repetition, repetition. You waited 1 whole month to start taking this class, don't miss it.

Join our facebook group for music, videos, questions/answers, and general class info: https://www.facebook.com/groups/453057848231239/

Location: Pearl Studios, 519 Eighth Avenue, 12th Floor (Btwn 35th & 36th)

Room: Studio H (12th floor)

Fee: $15 per class (cash only). You do not pay in advance. you pay when you take a class only.

Time: 8pm-9:30pm.

Here is a partial preview tentative syllabus for the first 6 weeks out of the 12:

During each week, the following concepts will be taught along with the material when necessary:

(Posture) (Weight Shifting) (hand rotation) (spotting) (pacing) (balance) (distance control) (musicality) (timing) (body coordination) (body isolations) (etc)

Week 1 (open house - anyone can join)

Footwork: Basic Step, Basic variations, upper body movement, Body isolations and coordination exercises, Timing, Music

Partnerwork: Open Hold, Close Hold, Hand placements, Correct Frame, Correct Tension

Week 2 (open house - anyone can join)

Footwork: Previous class review, Right-Turn

Partnerwork: Previous class review, Leading The right-turn, Following the right-turn

Week 3 (semi open house - only those who know the material taught on weeks 1 & 2 can join. A special class will be offered for those who want join the cycle and need to catch up)

Footwork: Previous class review, Left-Turn

Partnerwork: Previous class review, Cross-Body-Lead and Follow.

Week 4 (closed - no new students accepted)

Footwork: Previous class review, Shine 1 and 2 (Footwork variations)

Partner-work: Previous class review, Cross-body-Lead combined with Inside Turn, Turn Combinations

Week 5 (closed - no new students accepted)

Footwork: Previous class review, Shine 3 and 4 (Footwork variations)

Partner-work: Previous class review, Open-Break Step

Week 6 (closed - no new students accepted)

Footwork: Previous class review, Shine 5 and 6 (Footwork variations)

Partner-work: Previous class review, Walk-Around Turn

Week 7 - 12

More fundamental footwork and partnerwork
results.name: Week 2 - Level 1 Salsa Class Cycle (Feb 25th)

results.description:
At the Pleasure of Mazarin: Roman Treasures from the Bibliothèque Nationale de Paris

Click here to buy tickets or call[masked]

TYPE IN DISCOUNT CODE MTP AT CHECKOUT FOR $10 DISCOUNT ON ALL PRICE LEVELS

Jessica Gould, soprano; Diego Cantalupi, archlute; Charles Weaver, theorbo; James Waldo, cello; Kenneth Hamrick, harpsichord

A Cardinal who never took holy orders, Mazarin, né Giulio Raimondo Mazzarino (1602 – 1661), was born near Naples, grew up in Rome, and became Chief Minister of France. The most powerful advisor to Louis XIV was more fascinated by art than theology, and although Bernini in Paris would ultimately be the prize of Mazarin's successor, the Cardinal imported innumerable Italian compositions and a fair number of Italian composers to his adopted country. His dedication to artistic splendor was a hallmark of his tenure and a gift to subsequent generations.

Native sons whom he championed include Luigi Rossi (1597 – 1653), whose Orfeo was one of the first operas to be staged in France, Virgilio Mazzocchi (1597 – 1646), and Giacomo Carissimi (1605 – 1674), who became the teacher of Charpentier. Their music, mostly Roman, and mostly born of the decadent Barberini papal court, came to transform the course of French music. Arias, cantatas, and operas by these Italian composers and more can be found to this day at the Bibliothèque Nationale de Paris, where many treasures of Mazarin’s collection still await a performance in our own time.

A wine and cheese reception follows the concert.
results.name: Roman music from Paris, followed by a wine and cheese reception

results.description:
We will meet as a small intimate group setting, in which we share what clarity we want to bring in our lives, relationships, career, or anything important to us. I will provide professional coaching, as the rest of the group can chime in. You can choose be to be coached or observe. "Group coaching" as this is called, provides an uncommon experience in which we learn a lot from one another, since we take a deep dive into each other's personal experience. I just request that the environment is safe--that we are understanding of each other, and that what comes into this Meetup stays in this Meetup. Coaching is an experiential, vulnerable, empowering, creative, and non-judgmental process. I have coached many individuals and groups, and have a masters in psychology.

If you attend, please RSVP to the main Meetup group sponsoring this: http://www.meetup.com/NYC-Empowered-Life-and-Business-Growth/events/228653814/
results.how_to_find_us: NYC Empowered Life sign on table, #908-531-2962
results.name: Clarify your Life (in intimate setting)

results.description:
Like our Facebook Page!:

   facebook.com/ManhattanInternationalCoedSoccer

Game description: 

Teams are 4 V 4, no goalies, no gender requirements (but we'd like at least 1 female player per team). Games will be played on a 1st goal rotation basis or 15 minutes time limit. The team that scores first stays on  the field. But if your team remains on the field after scoring 3 goals, we'll split the team up so that everyone has a fair chance to have a great game.

RULES OF THE GAME:

First and most important rule of the game is to have fun and enjoy the time on the field! 

VERY IMPORTANT: 

- NO FOULS

- NO SIDE TACKLING

- NO PUSHING

- NO TELLING OFF

* ZERO TOLERANCE*


By minimizing physical contact, we minimize injuries and violence.


         “Futsal is not a physical but a technical game ”

If you don't sign up for the game, do not show up.

Rough play and offensive language will absolutely not be tolerated!!

We encourage competitive, but safe play. 

We reserve the right to ask anyone to leave who has exhibited any behavior that could be construed as violent, offensive, or dangerous. 

Those that don't comply with these rules, will kindly be asked to leave the field so others can enjoy the game. 


Any other questions regarding the rules of the game or anything else, should be directed to the organizer directly or to the assistant organizer/s!!!

Please check our meetup message board, 10 PM the night before to see what team you are on. This will save us a lot of time on the field.

Location and Directions:

West End Presbyterian Church

165 West 105th Street, New York, NY

Near the lines: 1, 2, 3, B, and C trains.

AS YOU COME IN, TAKE THE STAIRS ON YOUR LEFT AND WALK TO THE 4TH FLOOR.

Call me if you can’t find us - (917)[masked] Manny S.


What to bring with you: 
A positive attitude, pair of sneakers or INDOOR shoes (ONLY), shin guards (recommended) and lots of water.

Fee: 
You will be asked to pay $9.25 dollars when you RSVP. This $9.25 dollars is used to pay for: permits, meetup fees, Amazon fees, Goals, soccer balls etc.

Refund Policy: 


* The Meetup is cancelled

* You can cancel at least 2 day(s) before the Meetup


Very IMPORTANT Due to the location where we will be playing:

We expect everyone to respect the facilities and act accordingly.

Anyone who is asked to leave will not be refunded and WILL be permanently banned from the group

After the game we can go for a quick drink at:

                                            TAP a KEG

                                         2731 Broadway

                                     New York, NY 10025

                            Betwee[masked]th and Broadway  

By RSVP'ing you agree to our Liability waiver:

PARTICIPATING IN MANHATTAN-INTERNATIONAL-COED-SOCCER ACTIVITIES AGREEMENT: 


I certify that I have no known medical or other conditions that could interfere with my participation in Manhattan-International-COED-Soccer activities. I also understand and accept that the practice of soccer, both indoor and outdoor, involves certain risks of physical injury. Therefore, I, individually, hereby release and discharge, Manhattan-International-COED-Soccer Organizer and Assistant Organizers from any and all claims, actions, damages, losses, liabilities, costs and expenses of any kind whatsoever, including but not limited to any claims of negligence, arising out of, resulting from, by reason of, or in connection with my participation in any of Manhattan-International-COED-Soccer programs or activities. Manhattan-International-COED-Soccer Organizer and its Assistant Organizers reserve the right to take and utilize photographs, video, or any type of recording of participating person while engaged in our or associated activities. I consent to Manhattan-International-COED-Soccer use the photograph, video, or recording of me, for advertising, promotional, or related purposes, and waive all rights to compensation and other rights which may arise as a result.

results.description:
At the Pleasure of Mazarin: Roman Treasures from the Bibliothèque Nationale de Paris

Click here to buy tickets or call[masked]

TYPE IN DISCOUNT CODE MTP AT CHECKOUT FOR $10 DISCOUNT ON ALL PRICE LEVELS

Jessica Gould, soprano; Diego Cantalupi, archlute; Charles Weaver, theorbo; James Waldo, cello; Kenneth Hamrick, harpsichord

A Cardinal who never took holy orders, Mazarin, né Giulio Raimondo Mazzarino (1602 – 1661), was born near Naples, grew up in Rome, and became Chief Minister of France. The most powerful advisor to Louis XIV was more fascinated by art than theology, and although Bernini in Paris would ultimately be the prize of Mazarin's successor, the Cardinal imported innumerable Italian compositions and a fair number of Italian composers to his adopted country. His dedication to artistic splendor was a hallmark of his tenure and a gift to subsequent generations.

Native sons whom he championed include Luigi Rossi (1597 – 1653), whose Orfeo was one of the first operas to be staged in France, Virgilio Mazzocchi (1597 – 1646), and Giacomo Carissimi (1605 – 1674), who became the teacher of Charpentier. Their music, mostly Roman, and mostly born of the decadent Barberini papal court, came to transform the course of French music. Arias, cantatas, and operas by these Italian composers and more can be found to this day at the Bibliothèque Nationale de Paris, where many treasures of Mazarin’s collection still await a performance in our own time.

A wine and cheese reception follows the concert.
results.name: Baroque Roman Baroque Music from Paris, wine and cheese reception to follow

results.description:
We are women who OM (OM stands for Orgasmic Meditation, go to onetaste.us to learn more), and we want to tell you our stories. 


(An Event for Women Only)

Charged. Vulnerable. Heated. Curious. Electric.

What happened throughout our lives - how we felt the timbres of our bones shaking and that undeniable yearning to know ourselves in this world more deeply. To push ourselves further, to love ourselves more; to live what we now know to be an Orgasmic Life. Orgasm. Power. Connection. Sex. Desire. Purpose.

We were touched by something wordless and visceral, impossible to explain, but harder to avoid. We argued with everything we’d ever been told about how our bodies should look, how much happiness we were allowed, how our relationships were supposed to go; we worked with our minds just enough to get bodies on the mat to feel that first stroke. 

And from that moment, everything changed. 

That smallest whisper that started out as “despite the fear, i want this” became “i can have it, because it’s my birthright”. That is how we live our lives; on the edge of believing, beyond what 99% of the what the world thinks is possible in the realm of sexuality, spirituality, business and relationship. We are people that would not otherwise meet; from bankers to dancers to electricians to actors to teachers to entrepreneurs. But we all want one thing; to make this world better, more intimate, and to put the passion inside of us to better use.

Join the New York women of the OM community for an evening of their journey into Orgasmic Meditation. 

For more information contact Marissa at[masked]
results.name: Women Who OM (Special Event for Women Only)

results.description:
This group meets on the 4th Thursday of each month to discuss various works of "modern" masters or upcoming talent in SF, fantasy, paranormal, horror and related genres. It also occasionally explores classics and the 'masters' of the classics.

Mistborn:  The Final Empire by Brian Sanderson

Brandon Sanderson, fantasy's newest master tale spinner, author of the acclaimed debut Elantris , dares to turn a genre on its head by asking a simple question: What if the hero of prophecy fails? What kind of world results when the Dark Lord is in charge? The answer will be found in the Mistborn Trilogy, a saga of surprises and magical martial-arts action that begins in Mistborn . For a thousand years the ash fell and no flowers bloomed. For a thousand years the Skaa slaved in misery and lived in fear. For a thousand years the Lord Ruler, the "Sliver of Infinity," reigned with absolute power and ultimate terror, divinely invincible. Then, when hope was so long lost that not even its memory remained, a terribly scarred, heart-broken half-Skaa rediscovered it in the depths of the Lord Ruler's most hellish prison. Kelsier "snapped" and found in himself the powers of a Mistborn. A brilliant thief and natural leader, he turned his talents to the ultimate caper, with the Lord Ruler himself as the mark. Kelsier recruited the underworld's elite, the smartest and most trustworthy allomancers, each of whom shares one of his many powers, and all of whom relish a high-stakes challenge. Only then does he reveal his ultimate dream, not just the greatest heist in history, but the downfall of the divine despot. But even with the best criminal crew ever assembled, Kel's plan looks more like the ultimate long shot, until luck brings a ragged girl named Vin into his life. Like him, she's a half-Skaa orphan, but she's lived a much harsher life. Vin has learned to expect betrayal from everyone she meets, and gotten it. She will have to learn to trust, if Kel is to help her master powers of which she never dreamed. Readers of Elantris thought they'd discovered someone special in Brandon Sanderson. Mistborn proves they were right. 

(Joe Cirillo recommendation)
results.name: Modern Masters:  Mistborn:  The Final Empire by Brian Sanderson

group.name: The Science Fiction Society of Northern New Jersey

results.description:
We are women who OM (OM stands for Orgasmic Meditation, go to onetaste.us to learn more), and we want to tell you our stories. Charged. Vulnerable. Heated. Curious. Electric.

What happened throughout our lives - how we felt the timbres of our bones shaking and that undeniable yearning to know ourselves in this world more deeply. To push ourselves further, to love ourselves more; to live what we now know to be an Orgasmic Life. Orgasm. Power. Connection. Sex. Desire. Purpose.

We were touched by something wordless and visceral, impossible to explain, but harder to avoid. We argued with everything we’d ever been told about how our bodies should look, how much happiness we were allowed, how our relationships were supposed to go; we worked with our minds just enough to get bodies on the mat to feel that first stroke. And from that moment, everything changed. That smallest whisper that started out as “despite the fear, i want this” became “i can have it, because it’s my birthright”. That is how we live our lives; on the edge of believing, beyond what 99% of the what the world thinks is possible in the realm of sexuality, spirituality, business and relationship. We are people that would not otherwise meet; from bankers to dancers to electricians to actors to teachers to entrepreneurs. But we all want one thing; to make this world better, more intimate, and to put the passion inside of us to better use.

Join the New York women of the OM community for an evening of their journey into Orgasmic Meditation. For more information contact us at[masked]

Jessica Gould, soprano
Diego Cantalupi, archlute
Charles Weaver, theorbo
James Waldo, cello
Kenneth Hamrick, harpsichord

A Cardinal who never took holy orders, Mazarin, né Giulio Raimondo Mazzarino (1602 – 1661), was born near Naples, grew up in Rome, and became Chief Minister of France. The most powerful advisor to Louis XIV was more fascinated by art than theology, and although Bernini in Paris would ultimately be the prize of Mazarin's successor, the Cardinal imported innumerable Italian compositions and a fair number of Italian composers to his adopted country. His dedication to artistic splendor was a hallmark of his tenure and a gift to subsequent generations.

Native sons whom he championed include Luigi Rossi (1597 – 1653), whose Orfeo was one of the first operas to be staged in France, Virgilio Mazzocchi (1597 – 1646), and Giacomo Carissimi (1605 – 1674), who became the teacher of Charpentier. Their music, mostly Roman, and mostly born of the decadent Barberini papal court, came to transform the course of French music. Arias, cantatas, and operas by these Italian composers and more can be found to this day at the Bibliothèque Nationale de Paris, where many treasures of Mazarin’s collection still await a performance in our own time.

A wine and cheese reception follows the concert.
results.name: At the Pleasure of Mazarin: Roman Treasures from Bibliothèque Nationale de Paris

Futsal Pick up games (intermediate to advanced level)

Fee: $10 dollars per player per game; pay through paypal.

Only 10 players per game, no subs (the roster shows 11 spots only because it includes the organizer who will play if needed). One game is 55-60 minutes. Please come a little early so that we all can start on time and play 1 solid hour. Goal keeper rotation every 5-6 minutes. We play without a break. Regulation size goals with nets. Futsal ball. Please make sure to bring a white and a red t-shirt (if you don't have red, a solid dark will do), indoor shoes. Games are competitive, but friendly. Please keep in mind that these games are definitely not for the beginners. Please no fouls, zero tolerance to this. “Futsal is not a physical but a technical game ”. Minimum physical contact means fewer injuries and no violence.

more info at [masked]

Thank you,

Jaime Arias

• ABSOLUTELY NO CLEATS ALLOWED! NO EXCEPTIONS!!

• Permit Disclosure: No permit but field is usually unoccupied at this time.

• BRING AN ALL WHITE SHIRT (Your teammates can see you better when you wear white under the fluorescent vests.)

• We play rain or shine!

(Leader- Chris W.)

(Co-leader- Art K.)

(We are looking for new Co-Leaders, are you interested? Talk to Chris W)

• PLEASE ARRIVE ON TIME - 8:00PM!! Game starts at 8:15pm sharp .

• NO BALL SMASHING! THIS IS A SPECIAL NIGHT BALL!

• Full rules explained at the game.

Code of Conduct:

Positivity - Constructive criticism after the game is way better than yelling and complaining during the game.

Safety - Want to kick someone really hard? go take jiujitsu. We like our shins.

2 = Teamwork. It takes 2 to complete every pass.

Generosity!!!! - Not just your money (though it helps). We want clapping and good cheers.

The proceeds go to our charity network: http://ps2g.org/charities

All RSVPs are final. No credits or refunds. (It's all for charity anyway)

If the game is cancelled, request a refund by filling out this form.

If you can't afford the meetup fees, please visit our website to learn how to become a game leader. Game Leaders play for free. http://ps2g.org/gameleaders

PS2G raises money for charities that use soccer for social good restoring dignity where it's been lost through the game of soccer. We share the impact of this movement through multiple channels and promote generosity on the field through safe and supportive play.

PS2G - Local Game. Global Change. 

Disclaimer By taking part in group activities you hereby are agreeing to the rules and regulation of the meetup. In addition, you acknowledge you are volunteering to play at your own self will and at your own risk. Neither organizer nor assistant organizers are responsible for any injuries or mishaps while partaking in the games. We encourage love of the game and for each other. We encourage friendly competition. Organizers reserve the right to remove players from the game if they refuse to be friendly.

(Leader- Chris W.)

(Co-leader- Art K.)

(We are looking for new Co-Leaders, are you interested? Talk to Chris W)

Format: 3 teams of 5 per court. Score by 1’s. Games to 7. Winner stays but must sit after 2 games. No refs. Call your own. Our moderator will help things along. All players must bring a white and a dark shirt (not grey). This is a friendly run. Anyone with the wrong attitude will not be allowed back. Age: 21+

Our open runs are designed for good fun and a run. The A / B breakdown is purely a self rating device to try and split things up in an enjoyable manner. Think of it as if you were going to the park to play. If you are average or above go to the A court. If you are average or below go to B.  It is not exact. There is always going to be some crossover.

results.description:
Please register for Enterprise-grade streaming under 2ms on Hadoop; and Integrating Apex with Nifi on Feb 25,[masked]:00 PM at: 

https://attendee.gotowebinar.com/register/8781155429978070788

Agenda - This event has two talks; the first talk with cover a fully fault tolerant distributed native Hadoop application with under 2ms latency. The second talk covers ingestion and egression of data into/from Hadoop using Nifi. The Nifi connectors are part of Apache Malhar library.

9:15pm - Toppling the mainframe: Enterprise-grade streaming under 2ms on Hadoop - Ilya Ganelin (Capital One Data Innovation Lab)

10:00pm - Q&A

10:15pm - Integrating Apex and Apache NiFi by Bryan Bende (Hortonworks)

11:00pm - Q&A

Abstract - Toppling the mainframe: Enterprise-grade streaming under 2ms on Hadoop:  

These days everyone is excited about big data and fast data. Capital One has embraced this new generation of technology with open arms. However, “There ain’t no such thing as a free lunch.”

For many years, there’s been a very real battle around the standard operating model of software. Tech giants like Oracle and IBM have traditionally built massively expensive enterprise-ready products, while the open source community provides free, albeit usually inferior, software. For a product to be enterprise-ready, it must guarantee complete reliability alongside performance and flexibility. We had not yet seen open source succeed in the realm of distributed stream computing.

Capital One set out to find whether we could build or find enterprise-ready technology in the open source world to tackle difficult streaming problems that also provides equivalent performance, durability, and availability as a mainframe computer. Ilya Ganelin details Capital One’s attempt to answer this question in a rigorous and complete way, not just by making a prototype or discovering exciting new tools, but by creating an open source-based, enterprise-ready product that can transparently replace an enormously expensive proprietary solution. Ilya presents Capital One’s novel solution for real-time decisioning on Apache Apex.

Topics include:

- A detailed dive into the business requirements of a new real-time decisioning platform for model building, feature computation, and model scoring.

- A survey and analysis of the leading open source technologies for stream processing and what tradeoffs Capital One considered when selecting their technology stack.

- Capital One’s solution, based on Apache Apex, which provides unparalleled performance on Hadoop and meets the stringent performance, scalability, and durability requirements necessary for enterprise-grade decision making

Bio: Ilya Ganelin is a roboticist turned data engineer. After a few years building self-discovering robots at the University of Michigan and another few years working on embedded DSP software with cell phones and radios at Boeing, he landed in the world of big data at the Capital One Data Innovation Lab. Ilya is an active contributor to the core components of Apache Spark and a committer to Apache Apex with the goal of learning what it takes to build a next-generation distributed computing platform. Ilya is an avid bread maker, cook, skier, and race-car driver.

Abstract - Integrating Apex and Apache NiFi

In this talk we will give an overview of Apache NiFi and how it can be used to bring data to an analytic platform like Apache Apex. Specifically we’ll discuss the details of the NiFi input and output operators that were developed for the Apache Apex Malhar library, and talk through use-cases for integrating the two technologies.

Bio: Bryan Bende is a Member of the Technical Staff at Hortonworks where he develops dataflow capabilities around the core framework of Apache NiFi, and has over ten years of experience developing enterprise software solutions. Bryan received a B.S. in Computer Science from the University of Maryland at College Park, and a M.S. in Computer Science from John Hopkins University.

results.description:
Havana CUBA & Beyond
Thursday, Feb 25 to Monday Feb 29 OR to Thursday, March 4
Where: Havana Cuba
5 Days/4 Nights OR 8 Days/7 Nights

Join us for four or seven days in Havana CUBA & Beyond and get a full immersion of the rich culture, art, food, and music of this unique and captivating country. Traveling to Cuba can be one of those life transforming experiences! This trip will be an exciting People to People learning journey as we explore the colorful, vibrant history and culture of Cuba through meeting with the local people. Discover elegant, exuberant Havana....its friendly citizens, contemporary artists, exceptional architecture, music, and colorful outdoor markets. It will surprise you with its richness and depth of culture. Enjoy music and dance everywhere as an expression of the soul of the Cuban people. Visit with musicians, students, and doctors as you meet local people who welcome visitors with friendly smiles, laughter, and conversation.
Hosted By: www.circletheworld.com

Included
Charter Flight Miami-Havana-Miami
1 Night Hotel Miami (before charter flight)
All ground transportation on itinerary
3 OR 6 Night Accommodations in 4 Star Hotel (all in Cuba)
Full Breakfast Buffet Daily
All Lunches
Expert Tour Guide 
Guest Speakers
All entrance fees on itinerary
Cuban Insurance (health and evacuation)
Travel with authorized people to people organization
Cuban Visa
Cuban airport departure tax

Sale Price: $2295/4 night
$2895/7 night (ends 11/22)
Base Price: $2395/$2995
$500 deposit to reserve your spot! HERE
*See below for payment due dates and procedures*

Not included: Domestic flight to Miami, dinners, alcohol drinks, airline baggage fee ($20), tips for Cuban guides and staff (expect around $50) and any activities not included in the itinerary.

Thursday, Feb 25: Arrival Miami Hotel
Arrive to Miami and transfer to hotel to meet group and trip leader. It is suggested to arrive anytime from 6-11pm.

*Note: If you do not need accommodations for this evening and would like to meet the group Friday AM at Miami airport for the charter flight, please email on discounted rate*

Friday, Feb 26: Havanna Arrival & Classic Convertible Sunset Drive
In the early morning we will transfer to Miami Airport for our Havana charter flight and check in as a group. Upon arrival in Havana, we'll drive half an hour to our conveniently located hotel. We'll absorb our first impression of the tropical air, rhythm and color wafting out of the doorways we pass, laughter and conversation bouncing amongst neighbors easily, meeting local people along the way. In the evening, we'll experience a special Classic Convertible car ride by sunset in Old Havana!

Saturday, Feb 27: Havana Old Town & Jazz Concert
After breakfast we begin our day with a talk on the history of the city’s restoration and fascinating past as told to us by an expert architect and city planner. We learn about the restoration which is necessary to provide housing for local inhabitants. Lunch will be O’ Reilly 304 (rated #1 on Tripadvisor). After lunch we will visit Taller de La Grafica and meet Cuban painters at their collective.

Street music and dancing celebrate the Cuban heritage of the people here. The feeling of cooperation and ingenuity are palpable and many of the people you will meet will surprise you with their multitude of talents, which they have had to develop to survive in a society lacking basic resources. In the evening, we'll view a private jazz concert by world renowned Cuban musicians!

Tonight we'll have dinner at a chosen Paladare (price not included). A paladar is a small family run restaurant licensed to provide meals in their homes. Here, you will taste some of the best food in Cuba as well as a experience being in the intimate, warm, and real spaces of local people. A trip to Cuba wouldn't be complete without trying one of the many Paladares.

Sunday, Feb 28: Local Cuban Art & Dance
Today we'll get up close and personal and visit the private home studio of world renowned artists Juan Moreira and Alicia Leal and see their exhibits as well as a very interesting modern art exhibit by a young up and coming artist. After lunch at Paladar Juana La Cubana, enjoy a children’s rueda dance performance with Cuba’s top children’s dance group. This group will amaze your with their talent! How well can you dance? In the evening we'll take a Cuban salsa dance class with amazing Cuban dancers.

Monday, Feb 29: Visit Organic Market (time permitting) & Home/3-Day Extension
After breakfast at the hotel, we'll transfer for the short trip to the airport for our flight to Miami and bid farewell to our new Cuban friends. We'll arrive Miami airport in time for you to board your evening flight in from Miami to your designated city arriving Sunday evening.

3-Day Extension: Cienfuegos to Trinidad
If you are doing the extension, after breakfast we'll visit Jose Fuster’s art galleries and community project and enjoy lunch at Sloppy Joe’s Bar before departing for Trinidad. On our way, we'll stop in the small town of Cienfuegos, the birthplace of Cuba’s legendary singer Benny More, for quick walk and photo opportunity. Once we arrive in Trinidad, a city that just celebrated 500 years and check in. In the afternoon/evening we'll view a live outdoor salsa band and dancers at Casa de La Musica.

Tuesday March 1: Discover Trinidad & Beaches
In the morning we'll get a in-depth walking tour of Trinidad from a local Cuban expert. After lunch enjoy a visit at a cigar factory!

We will also visit the beaches of Trinadad during the day. In the evening, we'll take a horse-drawn carriage ride though the cobblestone streets of Trinidad,marvel at Trinidad’s beautiful traditional live music at the Casa de La Trova.

Wednesday, March 2: Scenic Trinadad & Havana
In the morning, we'll take a trip to scenic areas just outside Trinadad to see waterfalls and beautiful scenery. In the afternoon enjoy a visit to one of the last remaining Sugar Baron houses. We'll depart for Havana in the mid afternoon.

Thursday March 3: Havana & Miami
Depending on airport time, we will stop at a local market. Our charter flight will depart early afternoon, arriving in Miami in mid afternoon. Note: Your return flight must be later than 5pm.

This itinerary is subject to change. In-country programming is customized for each group to maximize your cultural experience. To maintain authenticity, many of the places we visit are not tourist destinations and are not always available.

Payment Due Dates and Procedures
All payments must be made on time to secure your spot. You may pay the balance in full anytime on/before the first due date.

After deposit pay the balance in either 3 ways:
-Quick Chase Pay (Chase account not required)
-Send check to Circle The World P.O.Box 20484 NY, NY 10011
-Pay online through website (a 3% service fee will be added to total

Due Dates
$1000 4Day/$1395 8Day Dec. 27  
$795/$1000 Jan 18 (final payment due)
(if you signed up after sale price, your final balance is $895/$1100)

results.description:
Mt. Beacon Fire ~Tower Hike ~ SUNRISE

 A steady pace all the way so we make the sunrise and can get to work after.  Not good for a first time hiker .


4 miles 

Hiking Poles are helpful


Trail info- We will be taking the steps from the Gateway park to the Red trail. The trail is 6 or 7 switchbacks up to the old casino with a very rewarding look out point where you can see sweeping views of the Hudson river and surrounding area.


Distance: 4 miles round trip

The First 0.8 miles of this hike is hard, and very steep with 1000ft. elevation gain.
Mount Beacon is the second highest point in the Hudson Highlands. Depending on the map, it may be called Mount Beacon or Beacon Mountain. The mountain consists of two peaks. The northern peak is 1531ft and has a series of radio antennas on its summit. The higher southern peak is 1610ft and has a lookout tower on its summit.
On a clear morning we will see the NYC skyline lights from the summit as well as views of the town of Beacon and the majority of the Highlands (including Storm King, Breakneck Ridge, and little Sugarloaf).

We leave right at 5:45AM.  Don't be late.

+++

HUDSON VALLEY HIKER LEGAL DISCLAIMER  & WAIVER OF LIABILITY

You agree when you sign up for this group or any of the events that you have read and understand the below.

If you join us for a hike (or any other event), please understand that you are responsible for your own preparedness and well-being and will hold no one else liable in case of injury or mishap. You agree not to hold the Organizer, Assistant Organizers, or any other members responsible for any injuries, mishaps, or any other situation that may happen at a planned event. You are responsible to research the event, know the area, and bring the proper gear.

The Hudson Valley Hikers Club does not provide liability insurance for the protection of individuals who may participate in any of the events planned by the Organizer or Assistant Organizers.

This release extends and applies to, and also covers and includes, all unknown, unforeseen, unanticipated and unsuspected injuries, damages, loss and liability.

Your attendance on a hike signifies that you have read and accept the terms of this liability waiver. By signing up for this group or event you understand that you are attending all events AT YOUR OWN RISK. Organizers and Assistant

Organizers of this group are just that, we organize the events and hike together as friends. There are no leaders on these hikes, you are your own leader - This is YOUR hike

results.description:
Running is a good workout. Running up a hill is an awesome workout. Be awesome!


Every week is an adventure in hill work. Every week is different. Some workouts include... 

30 minute continuous run. Sprint up the 0.4 mile incline, touch the graffiti wall at the top, turn around and jog back to the bottom and then repeat.

http://vimeo.com/81450322

Timed interval sprints. 45 seconds as hard as you can up. 1 minute and 45 seconds recovery jog back to the start. You will be winded!

http://vimeo.com/81966561

Obstacle course training. Workout stations with short sprints between them. Sprint to the first, do a bunch of situps. Sprint to the next, do some lunges. Sprint a bit further and do some squats. Sprint to the top and do some pushups. Jog back to the start and repeat.

NOTE: there is NO secure place to store bags, valuables, etc. Please use caution and do not bring anything you cannot afford to lose. If you do leave your belongings at the bottom of the bridge (where we start running) be aware that there is a lot of foot traffic and it would not be surprising if something "walked away."

This 2016 Show spotlights the drone revolution with new exhibitors and a special multicopter flying area. results.description:
Hello Fam!

This week we have Frank Barletta (UpTop) coming by and sharing his journey!

Frank is the co-founder and CEO of UPTOP, a real estate technology marketplace that connects owners, managers and renters together, then automates the entire process. As a renter for 10 years, he has moved 8 times and understand how painful paying broker fees are, the stress that comes with finding a new place, then moving is.

We'll get a chance to hear about his journey, with Q&A and community shout outs afterwards! Also join us for good coffee, good bagels, and excellent conversation.

Until then, stay warm and classy... See you then!

results.description:
For coworking space, it's first come first served. You'll want to get there early to find a desk before it fills up. The space is available from 10am to 6pm. If you are planning on attending, you'll need to do the following things:

• Register at the AWS Pop-up Loft Space - https://aws.amazon.com/start-ups/loft/ny-loft/

• Once you are registered you can pick up a badge and attend any of the co-working meetups.

• Let us know you are going by signing up for the event on meetup. This also lets other people in the group know who is going to be there too.

• Remember to check the Pop-up Loft website to make sure it is open. We'll do out best to cancel meetups on holidays and days the space won't be available but you should also double check before coming out.

• While there are snacks and drinks at the space, lunch is not provided. There are a number of restaurants, delis and other places to get food in the area so plan accordingly

• These daily coworking events are self run. A co-organizer will not always be at the event. These events are designed to give game developers a free space to work so you'll basically be left alone at the space to do you own thing. We suggest reaching out to other attending through the comments to sit together or meet up at a specific time in the space.

Last thing, two times a month we'll have a dedicated space for you to come out and work as well as listen to talks and get help from myself and others in the community. Those will be different events you'll need to register for which are separate from the daily co-working space.
results.name: Indie Coworking Space

Some of our members will have an exhibition booth displaying their UAV and FTP multirotors and there will be a netted area (in the center of the show this year) - Click here for Full Show Details

There is free parking and the entrance fee (that you pay at the door) is Adults $15.00 per day (Children under 16 free) .... 2-Day pass!  $7 for return with purchase of one day ticket.

-----------------Resources---------------


Great C# tutorial for unity beginners:

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=tzq-DJeNIrU

This is our first official class in session session.
Learn how to build your own VR app using Unity and the Google Cardboard SDK, iPeople are welcome too, works perfect with iOS.


I'll be available from 1pm-6pm for hands on Unity tutoring, bring your projects and I'll show you how to make them work in VR.


From 6pm - 7pm I'll be doing a mini advanced session, an inside look at virtualations Room Scale VR

<a href="http://virtualations.com"></a> For total beginners that don't have a project they are working on, come get inspired I will show you some simple amazing things you can do right away!


Every single person that brings a laptop and follows my simple instructions will go home with their own VR application.

If you don't have your own VR headset, we got each of you covered with Go4D goggles (20$) and Google Cardboards ($15), use them free in class to develop.

There will be food, drinks and many other goodies, a blend of Serbian and Chinese cuisine.

The nearest train is the L (Halsey st) or M (Forest ave) , parking is abundant for those that drive.
results.name: Unity Education - Beginner - You can make a VR app!

results.description:
You need to REGISTER with the Englewood Parks & Recreation Department at the following link:

http://register.communitypass.net/Englewood

You may need to set up an account &/or select "Englewood, City of." After you are directed to the Englewood page, click the yellow "Register" button, then the yellow "Continue" button under "2016 Winter Programs, and follow the prompts. To register, you will need to click on or add your child's name and some other information (age, emergency contact, etc.) You will be able to pay the $40 fee online, as well. If you have any trouble, please call the Englewood Parks & Recreation Department at[masked] or email [masked].  Please DO NOT PAY BELOW.

This fee covers all 10 classes.  I hope you will attend ALL 10!!  (There is no refund for missed classes.)

Course:  Fun Fingers

Age Suggestion:  2 1/2 through 5

Class:  Getting Started

Synopsis:  This first class is the most basic.  It introduces the essentials of working in a classroom.  Learning these help both your child and the group cooperate and succeed.  This class begins to teach the children how to sit with others for circle time, how to complete a "work cycle" from choosing an activity to returning it to its correct place, and how to work at a table or on the floor.

Activities:  Pegged Puzzles, Chunky Beads, other Transitional Materials (which are self-explanatory exercises any child can do before learning specific Montessori materials) such as play dough, stamping, a pegboard, Mega Blocks

Adult Learning:  Adults will be made privy to Montessori rationale such as why we use a work mat, why particular apparatus is chosen, how the classroom set-up promotes learning, and various spontaneous information.

A Peek Ahead:  After the first class, lessons are based upon observation, so specifics are unknown.  The goal of the course, however, is to develop fine motor control and hand strength, prerequisites to handwriting.  Materials will be demonstrated to that end.  Many exercises promote these skills.  The following are some exercises that most likely will be presented and then available for the children to choose.

Self Care:  lacing cards, folding scarves, opening and closing containers

Transferring Materials:  using a spoon, tongs, a melon baller, pouring

Extra Care Needed:  cutting, tracing, gluing with a paintbrush, pin pushing

Squeezing:  using a sponge, an eyedropper, clothespins
results.name: Let's Start Classes!!!

results.description:
****READ THIS FIRST || Parade Grounds Game Standards ****


Meet on field 8!!!

The game is scheduled to start at 3:00. Your RSVP is good if you come on time. If you come after teams are divided then you run the risk of not playing. Those who have RSVP’ed get first preference to play (This does not apply to anyone on the waiting list). Also, please  Un-RSVP if you will not be attending. That gives other people a chance to play.

Rules and guidelines:

These games are geared towards advanced to intermediate players.

Teams are divided by two team captains (captains pick players in turns in an attempt to keep teams balanced and competitive)

Physical play is allowed as long as it isn't overly aggressive or dirty.

Slide tackles are allowed only to block a shot on goal or to intercept a pass  NO slide tackling on a player with the ball.

Ball hogging is absolutely not tolerated 

Keep in mind as we don't have permit, we need to be flexible.

results.description:
We are going to Killington Ski Resort - the biggest & best ski resort in NorthEast. Located in central Vermont, Killington has 141 trails and 21 lifts, extending across six interconnected mountain peaks. The main peak, Killington Peak (4,241 ft (1,293 m)), is the second highest in Vermont and has the second greatest vertical drop in the east (3,050 ft (930 m)) after Whiteface Mountain in Wilmington, New York (at 3,430 ft (1,050 m)). The mountains that make up the Killington resort separate the town of Killington (with its access road) from the city of Rutland, Vermont.

For this trip, we will stay at Comfort Inn in Rutland. We will also have a full size bus so everyone can relate and avoid 5 hours-long drive. Three hot breakfasts are included. Check out the similar trip to Killington & stay at Comfort Inn we had last ski season, with multiple 5 stars rating. All rooms feature micro-wave refrigerators, 32" Flat Screen TVs, Coffee/Tea maker, Hair Dryer, Iron/Ironing Board, Radio Alarm Clock.

New This 2015/2016 Season:  
* Room Renovations are 100% Complete!  
* All Guest Rooms- new EVERYTHING!! 
* New Lobby -Completed- New Guest Computer Room! 
* Free WiFi, Indoor heated pool and spa!

*** Trip plan email will be sent out to everyone confirmed (including those paid by Chase Quickpay) via Eventbrite 2 to 3 days before the departure date providing trip logistics and details. ***

Depart Date: February 26th Friday. Please arrive 15 minutes earlier. 

Depart 4:00 PM from Queens: (Sheraton LaGuardia East Hotel)[masked]th Ave, Flushing, NY 11354 (Map)

Depart 5:00 PM from NYC: (Garden City Deli) Northwest corner of 43rd St & 9th Ave New York, NY 10036 (Map)

Depart 5:45 PM from NJ: (Route 17 Park & Ride) 575 New Jersey 17, Ridgewood, NJ 07450 (Map)

Return: Depart from Killington at 3:30 PM on Sunday Feb 28th and expect to arrive at NJ at 9:00 PM, NYC at 9:30 PM & Flushing at 10:00 PM.

Hot Breakfast (Included): Eggs, Sausage, Toasting Breads, Belgium Waffles w/syrup, Bagels/Cream Cheese, Hot and Cold Breakfast Cereals, Yogurt, Bananas, Apples, Oranges, Breakfast Pastries, Juices, Tea, Hot Chocolate, Coffee, Milk

Trip Includes: 2 days 2 nights ski/snowboard trip; 2 nights accommodation at Comfort Inn Rutland. 2 days all mountain lift tickets at Killington. Luxury bus/van round trip transportation from NYC, daily transportation between hotel & ski resort, tolls & parking. 2 daily hot breakfasts.

Cost:
Early Birds: Quadruple Occupancy (Includes Transport) $249; Double Occupancy (Includes Transport) $289 for first 26 spots or 21 days in advance; Regular: $30 more afterward.

Buy Ticket Here: http://feb2016killington.eventbrite.com/ You can also Chase Quickpay me at [masked] to avoid transaction fee. (How to Use Chase Quickpay?) If Quickpaying, please indicate your boarding location. Your spot is NOT confirmed until you have prepaid the ticket.

Note: Quadruple Occupancy = 4 persons in a two Queen beds room; Double Occupancy = 2 persons in a two Queen beds room.

Additional Cost: 2 day equipment rental (skis or snowboard) is at group rate $70 (regular $120). $15 for 2 day helmet rental. $120 to upgrade 2 day lift tickets to 2 days Learn to Ski or Ride (lower mountain lift tickets, ski or snowboard rental & beginner group lesson & free 3rd day for future trip).

Refund Policy:
* Full refund minus $30 processing fee if cancelled 21 days in advance;
* 50% refund if cancelled 10 days in advance;
* No refund for cancellation or no show within 10 days; however, spots can be transferred to your friends with $30 processing fee.

results.description:
REAL WOMEN, REAL VOICES


With more than one million women behind bars or under the control of the criminal justice system, women are the fastest growing segment of the incarcerated population increasing at nearly double the rate of men since 1985.

The Real Women, Real Voices Symposium examines the issues that impact incarcerated women.  Each of the two panels will feature currently and formerly incarcerated women discussing the impact of incarceration on their lives and the lives of their children and families, as well as the need for changes to policy as it relates to women and incarceration.

This is a pre-launch event in advance of the 2016 Beyond the Bars Conference (w/ Angela Davis)

References:
American Civil Liberties Union: Facts about the Over-Incarceration of Women in the United States

Fight Slavery Now! Penal Labor 

"To be a prisoner means to be defined as a member of a group for whom the rules of what can be done to you, of what is seen as abuse of you, are reduced as part of the definition of your status." Catharine MacKinnon

Registration
Free and open to the public
No registration necessary
*First come, first seated*

Sponsors
Ladies of Hope Ministries
Center for Justice
Beyond the Bars Fellowship
Heyman Center for the Humanities
Center for the Study of Law and Culture
AMPLIFI
Families for Justice as Healing
Women Who Never Give Up

Organizers
Topeka K. Sam

In honor of February Fashion Week NYC, Chris Benedict, Co-Founder of Felix Gray  eyewear (and former analyst and head of quantitative data  for UBS) will talk to Byte students and a limited number of community members.  He will discuss what its to like launch a start-up and his FashionTech company.  The product uses medical technology (MedTech) to reduce blue light and therefore eye strain at the computer, while remaining chic. Eyestrain is a common ailment for coders' and other professionals' who spend a lot of time at the computer.

Although the glasses are only in soft launch, BA students will have had the chance to demo the product for 2 weeks.  Mr. Benedict's visit will be at the end of the demo when he comes in to answer questions, talk about the eyewear's technology and discuss his background including  the startup world and tips.

About Felix Gray: Do you stare at a computer all day? Of course you do, and that’s bad for your eyes, and your health. Felix Gray creates eyewear that mitigates the short and long term negative effects of staring at digital devices. Their specialized lenses filter the most harmful wavelength range of blue light, eliminate glare, and have an optional slight magnification. This means less eye strain, fewer headaches, better sleep. 

Felix Gray was founded by David Roger, who worked at Tony Hsieh's Down Town Project through Venture for America and Chris Benedict, a former analyst and head of the quantitative data business for UBS Global Asset Management.
results.name: Startup Talk, FashionTech:  Founder of Felix Gray

I am a Spanish native speaker and suggest we meet at pret a manger to help you to improve your Spanish!

There is a maximum of 7 students per group and costs $10/person if there are more than 3 people or $15/person if they are 1-3 people.

My phone number is[masked] just in case you cannot find me.

Don´t sign up if you are not sure you can come.

The lesson lasts 1 hour.

Hasta pronto!

Beguinner level means: you are not able to speak without the help of the teacher, you just know really little common expresions. We will go thought the basics.

Intermediate level means: you can explain yourself with the help of the teacher, you can build up sentences but they are basic or you make mistakes on them. You have lacks of vocabulary and grammar.

Advanced level means: you are fluent in Spanish, you can explain yourself without a lof of problems. You know the vocabulary. Advanced students normally make gramatical mistakes when they talk and can forget some words, that is perfectly normal.

results.description:
**Come any time between 6pm and 9pm. Stay as long as you want, or leave when you need to.**

How better to start your weekend than sipping a cocktail amongst your fellow vegetarian & vegan friends at the posh cafe/bar K2 Lounge at the beautiful Rubin Museum of Art!  This beautiful evening is free - no admission charge to one of the largest collection of art dedicated to the Himalayan areas. (There is a charge of course for drinks.)

FREE admission to the Rubin Museum galleries from 6-10pm and free museum tour at 7pm.  

2-for-1 drink specials from 6 to 7pm.

Select Vegan Food Options: (1) Caramelized onions and arugula flatbread, (2) steamed edamame with truffle salt, (3) roasted brussel sprouts with kimchi, fried garlic, (4) kabocha squash with romesco sauce, rosemary oil, (5) roasted cauliflower tree with mint and cilantro salsa verde, chili oil, (6) side steamed vegetables and (7) side jasmine rice.

From the New York Times: "Every Friday, before the sky goes black, the lights go down in the lobby cafe of the Rubin Museum of Art, which fills the old Barneys building at Seventh Avenue and 17th Street... older couples in flannel and tweed mingle with younger visitors in expensive heels and cuffed designer jeans, while the occasional business executive enjoys a cocktail in the company of a BlackBerry."

From the New York Magazine: "The six-story spiral staircase, originally designed by Andrée Putman for the Barneys that previously inhabited the building, now suggests cycles, transcendence, and the rippling forms of Buddhist art."


Per Inside New York, "The Rubin Museum ... houses one of the most superb collections of Himalayan and Nepalese art in the world."  These include collections of religious art from cultures such Nepal, Tibet, and Bhutan as well as the interrelated traditions of India, Mongolia, and China. 

Steve McCurry: India Exhibit


"Steve McCurry needs no introduction. He's one of the most celebrated photographers in the world, renowned for his work in National Geographic," Bokeh by DigitalRev.  He reached international recognition from the famous cover photo of a green-eyed Afghan girl.

In collaboration with the International Center of Photography, this exhibit includes new never seen before images of India.  Time: "McCurry’s colorful work shows an India never before seen. ... One signature element of his work is his portrait-style photos. His subject’s unabashed stare into the camera suggests a stunning kind of intimacy."

Tibetan Shrine Room Exhibit


Through crowdfunding, the Rubin Museum created a new expanded Tibetan Buddhist Shrine Room, where art and ritual objects are presented as they would be in an elaborate private household shrine.  Per Hyperallergic, the Shrine Room: "... acts not as a period room or re-creation, but a simulation of being immersed in a Tibetan Buddhist’s private household shrine. ... the Shrine Room is an attempt to immerse visitors in a feeling of meditation."

Our event runs from 6:00pm to 9:00pm. Feel free to arrive at anytime. That said, we appreciate your arriving as close to 6:00pm as is practical for you.

With all the wonderful vegetarians and vegans who attend each of our events, every event we do is liked by our members, but our "Veg Night Out!" events are the most popular of all. People enjoy the fact they can mingle (speak with lots of different people), and they love the beautiful venues that we go to. Join us for a stellar evening of lively conversation and lovely surroundings with fellow vegetarians and vegans.

For our new members: this is an incredibly friendly and welcoming group. We'll have our own section in the club, and you can get to know all our wonderful members.

Where To Find Our Group: We will be the large group that is near the DJ. Just look for the DJ, and you'll see our large group there. Pretty much everyone near the DJ will be us.

Come join us at the K2 Lounge / Cafe Serai at the Rubin Museum of Art. Look forward to seeing you!

Eddie

results.description:
PLEASE RSVP ON DHARMA DRINK MEETUP PAGE (www.dharmadrink.com - thank you!)

 

A great way to get Dharma connected in New York!

Meeting monthly at the Rubin during the summer - but special events will be announced like "Dharma Drink at the Beach or the Park" plus special group visits to see amazing teachers as the come to NYC over the summer!  Should be awesome!!!

 

For people interested in Buddhism or meditation or just leading a kinder life who are up for meeting like minded people.

Dharma Drink is now Self Service!

The table is always reserved in the same spot - just show up and see what happens  - just like if you were hanging out meeting other Buddhists randomly in Kathamandu or India. And don't take the RSVP too seriously - people are coming now who don't RSVP. The word is getting out....

Everyone is invited! Dharma Drink is all about building community amongst the Buddhist and like minded crowd in New York City. I was inspired to start Dharma Drink by hanging out with all of the great students of all of the different lamas in Kathmandu - Kagyu, Nyingma, Sakya, Gelug - totally Rimey (also Zen, Thai, Theravadan, yoga travelers, just about everyone!).  We all became great friends and learned from each other. We're there every Friday night - see you there.


Motivation:  To make the Rubin Museum Lounge on Friday night the Buddhist  hang-out spot in New York.

Who:  ALL ARE INVITED.  Feel free to spread the word.  The more, the merrier.

Time:  6-?pm
Date:  Every Friday - like clockwork
Place:  Rubin Museum Lounge, 17th Street and 7th Avenue
How to find us:  Look for a table with the small sign "Dharma Drink"                          + Lounge staff  will know where we are.

 

www.dharmadrink.com
results.how_to_find_us: We'll be at a high-top table with little sign that says Dharma Drink opposite the Ganesh statue - the lounge staff will know where we are in case you get totally lost.
results.name: Dharma Drink: the hangout for Buddhists and like minded people

results.description:
Black Women's Blueprint Honors Salamishah Tillet and Scheherazade Tillet, Founders of A Long Walk Home and  Joanne Smith, Founder of Girls for Gender Equity.


One Night Only at Roulette Theater in Downtown, Brooklyn. Join us as we honor the Founders of A Long Walk Home—Salamishah Tillet, Scheherazade Tillet and the Founder of Girls for Gender Equity—Joanne Smith.


Our Honorary Co-Chairs:
Jamia WilsonWomen, Action & the Media
Shawnda Chapman-BrownCUNY Institute for State and Local Governance
 Alexis FlanaganOcean Ana Rising & Hope Works


____________________________________________________
FRIDAY, FEBRUARY 26, 2016
ONE NIGHT ONLY MOTHER TONGUE: A Praise Song for Black Girls, Reclaiming Our Mothers Bones
6:00pm Reception
8:00pm Performance

FOR TICKETS
http://www.brownpapertickets.com/event/2498263

A Benefit Performance to Support the Work of the First Black Women's Truth and Reconciliation Commission in the Country and its Work to End Rape/Sexual Violence in Our Communities.

What Will MTM2016 Be Like? With award winning poets, playwrights and choreographers Piper Anderson, Pope Jackson, Lorraine LaPrade, Ifetayo Cultural Arts Academy, Crystal Valentine, Nina Angela Mercer, Dorcas Davis and more who will take the audience through journeys, moments, incidents, and narratives of generations of women who seeded moments we now see manifested in the reflections, movements and protests of girls—in mind, flesh and bones—talking bones. They talk stories. Like ancestors who carried past, present and future across oceans, the girl in us and those around us, in our communities carry stories from block parties and ancient village dance circles, where drum beats spoke to them and they responded with swaying hips without fear, restraint or judgement.

Should You See It? Yes, with stunning visuals, sound and movement, MTM beckons us back to a place where our very existence is ritual.  Mother Tongue is a praise song and a ring shout from the heart of Black women who continue to imagine revolutionary spaces with us fully in it. 

Roulette Theater
509 Atlantic Avenue (at 3rd Ave)
Brooklyn, NY 11217
 RSVP here
___________________________________________________


#MTM2016 is Jamia Wilson, Shawnda Chapman-Brown, Alexis Flanagan, Piper Anderson, Pope Jackson, Lorraine LaPrade, Nina Angela Mercer, Crystal Valentine, Charnae Betton, Ifetayo Cultural Arts Academy, Dorcas Davis, Sevonna Brown, Adaku Utah and Farah Tanis on stage, speaking life, speaking truth to the experiences of Black girls and Black women.


http://www.brownpapertickets.com/event/2498263 FOR TICKETS

results.description:
Please join The Animals’ Battalion in protesting Ringling Bros. and Barnum & Bailey Circus. at the Barclays Center arena- LET’S SHOW THEM THAT ANIMAL ABUSE IS NOT WELCOME IN NEW YORK!

www.ringlingbeatsanimals.com



WHEN: Friday February 26, 6–7PM

WHERE: In front of Barclays Center, 620 Atlantic Ave., Brooklyn, NY 11217 accessible by the 2,3,4,5 trains (See this map.) http://goo.gl/maps/IVX0G

Ringling Bros. and Barnum & Bailey Circus is known for its long history of abusing animals. In 1929, John Ringling ordered the execution of a majestic bull elephant named Black Diamond after the elephant killed a woman who had been in the crowd as he was paraded through a Texas city. Twenty men took aim and pumped some 170 bullets into Black Diamond's body and then chopped off his bullet-ridden head and mounted it for display in Houston. Ringling Bros.' cruel treatment of animals continues today.

Elephants in Ringling's possession are chained inside filthy, poorly ventilated boxcars for an average of more than 26 hours straight—and up to 100 hours at a time—when the circus travels. Even former Ringling employees have reported that elephants are routinely abused and violently beaten with bullhooks (weapons that resemble a fireplace poker) in order to force them to perform tricks.

To learn more about Ringling's lengthy history of abusing animals, check out PETA's factsheet. http://circuses.com/pdfs/RinglingHiddenTruthFSetc.pdf

There will also be protests every day Ringling's will be at the Barclay Center.
results.name: The Animals’ Battalion: Ringling Brothers Circus Protest @ Barclays Center

Metta, or Lovingkindness Meditation (LKM), is the practice of wishing oneself and others happiness, health, and ease. Studies indicate that practicing LKM positively impacts our emotions, our physical health, and our sense of connection. Our weekly Metta Meditation Group meets for practice and discussion every week with IDP's Executive Director, Kimberly Brown. 

This offering is open to both beginners and experienced meditators. Cushions and chairs will be provided. We request a $10-$20 donation to support our organization, though no one will be turned away for lack of funds.

Note we are located on the 2nd floor of a walk-up building. There is no elevator.


The Interdependence Project
302 Bowery 3rd Floor, Middle Buzzer
Between Houston and 1st Street

results.description:
SPECIAL NOTE: Friends from Buddhist Global Relief (BGR) will come join us at our Dharma Drink Fridays to tell us about their next fund raising project, 5th Annual Concert to Feed the Hungry.  BGR is a non-profit organization started by Venerable Bhikkhu Bodhi that sponsors projects that provide food relief and poverty alleviation both in the developing world and in the U.S. 

--------------------------------------------------------------------

A great way to get Dharma connected in New York!

For people interested in Buddhism or meditation or just leading a kinder life who are up for meeting like minded people.

Dharma Drink is now Self Service!

The table is always reserved in the same spot - just show up and see what happens  - just like if you were hanging out meeting other Buddhists randomly in Kathamandu or India. And don't take the RSVP too seriously - people are coming now who don't RSVP. The word is getting out....

Everyone is invited! Dharma Drink is all about building community amongst the Buddhist and like minded crowd in New York City. Greg the founder of Dharma Drink: "I was inspired to start Dharma Drink by hanging out with all of the great students of all of the different lamas in Kathmandu - Kagyu, Nyingma, Sakya, Gelugpa - totally Rimey (also Zen, Thai, Theravadan, yoga travelers, and the curious - just about everyone!).  We all became great friends and learned from each other." We're there every Friday night - see you there.


Motivation:  To make the Rubin Museum Lounge on Friday night the Buddhist and like minded hang-out spot in New York.

Who:  ALL ARE INVITED.  Feel free to spread the word.  The more,             the merrier.

Time:  7-?pm
Date:  Every Friday - like clockwork
Place:  Rubin Museum Lounge, 17th Street and 7th Avenue
How to find us:  Look for a table with the small sign "Dharma Drink"                          + Lounge staff  will know where we are.

Please see the following Meetups too!

Buddhist Events New York     and

Zen / Chan Buddhist Activities

www.dharmadrink.com
results.why: Because Buddhists and like minded people are great to hang-out with.
results.how_to_find_us: We'll be at a high-top table with little sign that says Dharma Drink, the high table overlooking the lower level and closest to the elevators - the lounge staff will know where we are in case you get totally lost.
results.name: Dharma Drink: hang-out for Buddhists + Friends from Buddhist Global Relief

group.name: Dharma Drink: the hangout for Buddhists (& like minded)

results.description:
Join us for networking and coding! 


Socializing starts at 6:30PM — Make new friends, find a study group or study partner, or just practice your people skills. :-) 

Xcoding — That's what it's all about, right? During a typical MeetUp people socialize, work on Stanford assignments, ask other members questions, ask for help with a bug, offer help to others, etc. There is no set agenda and no formal presentation. If you prefer to sit in a corner and code away, you can do that. If you want to walk around offering people a helping hand, you can do that too.

Just Getting Started? Follow these steps . . .

• Stanford CS193P Winter 2015 Class (Swift) — Developing iOS 8 Apps with Swift 

• Stanford CS193P Fall 2013 Class (Objective-C) — Developing iOS 7 Apps for iPhone and iPad 

• Get the homework assignments and lecture code from Stanford University

• Download Xcode from the Mac App Store

• Sign up for a free Developer Account (note: the free account doesn't allow you to install apps on your device, for that you'll need the $99/year account)
results.name: iOS Study Group, 4th Friday

results.description:
活动收取门票$5每人。到场并参与游戏的请准备$5现金，刷卡$6。只观战不参与游戏的，不需要交费。晚到或提前退场但参与游戏的，门票价钱一样$5。

---------------------------------------------------------

如果你玩过杀人游戏或狼人杀，却还没听过阿瓦隆，那我不得不说您有点out啦！

与狼人杀相似，阿瓦隆也是一款角色扮演加逻辑推理游戏，玩家扮演不同身份，在辩驳之中分辨好人坏人。与狼人杀不同的是，玩家人数为5 - 10人，每一位玩家都能够参与到游戏最后，不存在被杀被票死就只能干看别人玩的情景。

这个游戏考验玩家的逻辑分析能力以及彼此的信任度，是一款绝对不会让你失望的游戏！如果您没有玩过这款游戏也不用担心，游戏规则很简单5分钟就可以学会，即便您对此游戏一无所知来参加我们活动也没关系。

玩家人数达到5人即举办活动，游戏时间2月26日6:30pm - 9:30pm。如果人数多，会开两桌或组织升级等其他游戏。地点在距离Penn Station步行五分钟的XYZ IMPRESSION Studio。地址：470 7th Ave, Suite 410, New York, NY 10018. 由于游戏受玩家人数影响，请大家尽量早到5 - 10分钟，不要迟到，6:30pm准时开始介绍游戏规则。

报名请RSVP并将姓名，Email，电话私信(message)给Lisa Yu.

results.description:
This free workshop introduces the The Art of Living Foundation's seminal programs.  Over 40 million people worldwide have benefited from the Foundation's programs which teach simple yet powerful breathing and meditative techniques for reducing stress, anxiety, and fear, while increasing the potential for clarity, joy, and inner peace.

In the workshop we explore the connection between breath and meditation and state of mind.  Participants will experience the breath as a fundamental tool to unlocking a happier, more relaxed state of being with higher levels of awareness, focus and clarity.  We will experience the yoga of breath and end with a guided meditation.

Participants will also learn more about the additional course offerings at Art of Living Foundation which will allow them to develop a personal home practice. 

When:Friday 6:30pm-7:45pm

**Please arrive early for seating and registration

Where: 286 5th Ave  5th Floor (between 30th and 31st St) NY 10001
results.why: I Meditate NY is a movement empowering New Yorkers to do more things they love by recharging through meditation, a practical way to refresh every day, invented thousands of years ago. Reinvented in 2011. Our mission is to recharge New York!
