results.description:
Hola amigos y amigas:


Join our Culture, Grammar & Conversation Workshops to improve your speaking and listening skills in Spanish in a fun and natural way. During the workshops an experienced instructor will help you develop the vocabulary and grammar structures necessary to be able to converse on various subjects of interest. We have two levels:

BEGINNERS & LOWER INTERMEDIATES

The workshops are very interactive, fun and stimulating. They are conducted by an experienced Spanish instructor who will correct mistakes, explain grammar and usage -whenever necessary- and highlight essential vocabulary for effective communication in Spanish.

COST: Just $15 per person, includes: workshop, printouts (if needed), pencil, fun!

IMPORTANT: Clicking "YES" without payment does not reserve a spot - ONLY ADVANCE PAYMENT DOES - This goes for ALL our events

--------------------------------------------------------------------------

LEVEL: LOWER INTERMEDIATES (B1*)

TIME: From 6:30pm to 8:00pm

TEACHER: Jorge Gallegos

****CLICK HERE TO PAY & REGISTER****

-----------------------------------------------------------------

LEVEL:  MIDDLE BEGINNERS and UP *

TIME: From 6:30pm to 8:00pm

TEACHER: María Angélica García

****CLICK HERE TO PAY & REGISTER****

---------------------------------------------------------------------------

(*) NOT SURE ABOUT YOUR LEVEL OF SPANISH? Visit HERE for some guidance.

Need to confirm your payment went through? Read ---> HERE

Previous Spanish Conversation Workshops for small groups were a big success! Read comments ---> HERE

**************************************

DETAILS
We'll have two groups running at the same time: Middle Beginners and Lower Intermediates.

Duration: 1 hour and 30 minutes per workshop

Jorge Gallegos and María Angélica García from Easy Espanol (www.easyespanol.org) will be your language coaches. Jorge is a skilled Spanish language instructor with over fourteen years of experience teaching Spanish as a second language. María Angélica is a dynamic instructor from Venzuela with a good sense of humor, very patient and a deep knowledge about contemporary cultural issues from the Spanish speaking world.

Please be aware that late tolerance is 15 minutes (you can't join a workshop if you are over 15 minutes late after 6:30pm).

ABOUT RSVP: Keep in mind that for all our paid events, RSVP does not guarantee a spot, only advance payment does

WHERE TO FIND US

The workshops will be held at 555 8th Avenue, Suite 110 (between 37th & 38th)

See where we are in a map---> HERE

CANCELLATIONS: You can cancel and get a full refund anytime up to 48 hours before your workshop start time. Read more HERE

¡Nos vemos!

Jorge

results.description:
Futsal Pick up games (intermediate to advanced level)

Fee: $10 dollars per player per game; pay through paypal.

Only 10 players per game, no subs. One game is 55-60 minutes. Be early. Every player rotates as a Goalie for 6 minutes, timed it with an electronic scoreboard. We play without a break. Regulation size goals with nets. Futsal ball. Please make sure to bring a white and a red t-shirt, indoor shoes. Games are competitive, but friendly. Please keep in mind that these games are definitely not for the beginners. 

Please no fouls, zero tolerance to this. “Futsal is not a physical but a technical game ”. Minimum physical contact means fewer injuries and no violence. No charging, no displacing with your arms or body to gain the position on the ball. No running into the opponent. Play the ball, not the player. Time it, don’t foul it. 

Refunds will be honored only with a minimum of 24 hour cancelation.  No refunds for late cancelations; no exceptions. 

The school entrance is located on East 109th street between 2nd and 3rd avenues (near 2nd avenue) on the south side of the street. You'll see a row of 5-6 metal doors. Open the door or ring the buzzer (on your right) and someone will open the door for you.

For questions,  use the MEETUP message and notifications tools. 

Post pictures and videos at:

Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/Futsalacrossamerica?ref=hl

Twitter: https://twitter.com/FutsalAcrossA

Thank you for being part of Futsal Across America.

Enjoy the game!

results.description:
Our Schedule:

7-7:45

Vigée Le Brun was one of the most sought-after and highly paid portrait painters of her time but her success as a young female painter in a male-dominated profession made her an object of envy and the target of cruel, often misogynistic labels in the press during the years leading up to the French Revolution.  In 2015 for the first time, Vigée Le Brun was finally recognized with a retrospective exhibition in her native France, which has now traveled to the Metropolitan Museum in New York.

This exhibit is in the Special Exhibits Gallery #199 on the first floor. Look for us there if you are running late.

http://www.nytimes.com/2015/10/03/arts/international/vigee-le-brun-a-delayed-tribute-to-a-french-trailblazer.html

8:-8:45

Wordplay: Matthias Buchinger's Drawings from the Collection of Ricky Jay

This installation of drawings, prints, and related ephemera by the German artist and performer Matthias Buchinger (1674–1739) explores for the first time the oeuvre of the so-called Little Man of Nuremberg. Standing only twenty-nine inches high, and born without hands or feet, Buchinger was celebrated in his own time as a draftsman and calligrapher as well as a magician and musician.

Gallery 690

8:45-9:00

Meet up again at the bench in front of the book store on the first floor. We will then go somewhere nearby for food/drinks.

We are a lose knit group who like to go to museums. Our schedule for the night is printed above. People typically move at their own pace throughout the night. You are welcome to check out any of the other exhibits which might be of interest. We typically do not all stick together. Meet up with us again at 8:45 for food and drinks.  This is the best time to make some new friends.  

We look forward to seeing you there!!

Please also note you can always pay what you wish at The Metropolitan Museum.

results.description:
Our monthly group meet-up is a great way to meet up the group, socialize, catch-up, pitch, get support for your projects and just to have fun.

Agenda:

Informal Networking: Getting to know each-other. Specially useful for the new-comers.

Round-table: Members share who they are, what they do, what are they planning or intending to do and what kind of help or collaboration they need.

Review & Plan: Reviewing the progress done in the last month and the plan for the coming month.

Open Forum: Any ideas, suggestions, feedback etc.

Social: Going somewhere in the neighborhood to eat, drink and more chit-chat.

Parking: There is ample parking at the back of the property or at the side road.

Some of the projects:

Feature length film "Kites Day". Script is ready and the project requires funding.

Members are welcomed to bring any friends, food and drinks in the meeting.

Contact #:[masked] for any other information or help in directions etc.
results.how_to_find_us: A corner place at Amboy Ave & Hoover Ave, block away from route 1 & Tano Mall, at the border of Metuchen and historical Clara Barton section of Edison.
results.name: Monthly Meet-up: Last Friday

results.description:
Join us for Happy Hour and appetizers while you imagine yourself sailing in cool breezes during the hot summer or racing competitively Wednesday evenings.   Get good at it and imagine being invited on the Round Long Island or Bermuda races.
Most people are totally amazed at seeing the Raritan Bay from our deck in Perth Amboy for the first time. All ages and experience levels welcome. Boat owners and non-boat owners too.
results.name: Meet the Raritan Bay and Yacht Club Members

results.description:
All are welcome to join us as we sit in circle to connect with Spirit!

Please arrive promptly and dress comfortably.

Feel free to bring a beverage of choice - I usually have water.

If this is your first circle we will:

• Learn how to raise our vibration for the best connection;

• Learn all the ways Spirit uses our senses to let us know they are near;

• Share in the energy of like-minded individuals;

• Send distance healing to all whose names we offer.

This monthly meetup is free - However, the suggested donation is $5 - $10. None are refused!  I look forward to seeing you there!!! xoxo
results.name: Development Circle

New Jersey Winter Wine Festival                              </a>

Friday February 26, 20167pm to 10pm
Hilton Short Hills
41 John F. Kennedy Pkwy
Short Hills, NJ
$69 Tickets on sale now!

LET'S SEE IF WE CAN GET A DISCOUNTED ADMISSION IF WE GET 10 OR MORE PEOPLE.  SIGN UP TODAY!!!

EVENT OVERVIEW:

New York Wine Events is pleased to invite you to the New Jersey Winter Wine Festival on Friday, February 26, 2016 at the Hilton Short Hills Hotel, New Jersey’s Premier Urban Resort.

Taste the night away and enjoy an amazing array of 150+ wines sourced from the world’s best wineries! Enjoy full-bodied and rich reds, crisp whites, many specialty wines — great wines for winter!

Join us from 7-10pm, hang out and meet up with other wine lovers while enjoying live jazz. Our 4th Annual Winter Wine Festival promises to be yet another great night of wine and merriment to remember.

<a href="https://www.showclix.com/event/new-jersey-winter-wine-fest/non-member">

Note: 15% Group Discount for groups of 10 or more is available on the checkout page. If you would like to split payment on a group discount purchase, please email [masked]

GENERAL ADMISSION TICKETS INCLUDE:Wine: 3 hours of tasting over 150 wines at our sampling tables.Food: Feasting on light accompaniments prepped by the Hilton’s Four Diamond culinary team — Farmstead Artisan Cheeses, Crostini, Ficelles, Baguettes, Crudite/Dips, Selection of Hot Pastas, and Chef’s Choice Passed Desserts.Live Music: Attendees will enjoy a live jazz performance from a soon-to-be-announced award winning musician.BONUS Wine Glass: Your custom etched tasting glass to keep after the event.Go with a group: A 15% group discount for groups of 10 or more is available on the checkout page. results.description:
This month we'll watch movies that I've actually seen, so I know exactly what we're in for. You don't, but hey, life isn't fair.

8 PM - Otto; Or, Up With Dead People - So... this may be the weirdest movie I own. It's a pretentious indie mockumentary satirizing pretentious indie films, featuring a gay zombie who people don't realize is a zombie so they cast him as the zombie in the movie-within-a-movie. Also it's German, shot in English.


http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=C0uZB-OCXPM

10 PM - Pierce Brosnan uses virtual reality (1992 virtual reality) to turn the guy with Downs' Syndrome (who is also secretly Hollywood looking) into a telepathic evil genius. Based on a Stephen King story (which had nothing to do with virtual reality).  This is worth it just for the CYBER SPAAAAAACE!


https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=YCxFGxqLsHE

Please arrive between 7 and 8. Food and drinks appreciated.
results.name: Up With Dead People + Lawnmower Man

results.description:
Sorry guys, I just called Han Dynasty to confirm the reservation and they couldn't find it. So thus, we're going to one of my favorite Si Chuan food restaurants in NYC, Legends! Their lamb is really yummy! Put your vegetarian diet on a pause! 

I completely understand if you don't want to come because of this. So please change your RSVP accordingly!  

THANK YOU!!! 

Katie!
results.name: Legends Restaurant

results.description:
Join us for the NY Shamanic Healing Circle with Irma StarSpirit Woman

The NY Shamanic Healing Circle meets about every last Friday of the month from 7 -9:30 pm

Dates for circle are: 1/29, 2/26, 3/25, 4/29, 5/27, 6/24

Location: YoGanesh Yoga – 208 W. 29th St, 2nd Fl., #201 (btw. 7th & 8th Ave), NYC.(door closes at 7:30pm)

Exchange: $20

Register to hold space email: [masked]

We open new doors for personal and communal healing. Experience and practice a vast range of healing modalities. As we work, we allow ourselves to be “seen and heard’ by Spirit. Bring your worries, illness and dis-ease into a Sacred Space and allow your healing to manifest.

Please bring a drum or rattle.
Have extra socks for warm cozy feet, and a blanket or shawl for comfort, water.

About Irma Caceres “StarSpirit Woman”

Irma StarSpirit Woman is a Medicine Woman honoring the ways of the curanderas (medicine healers) & her Mayan Ancestors, her medicine elders, She is a shamanic and Reiki practioner, Certified Crystal Healer, Dreamworker, an Ordained Minister in the Order of Melchizedek, Co-Founder of the New York Shamanic Healing Circle, and core member of the NY Shamanic Circle for 18 years.

StarSpirit Woman uses sound healing, fire readings, crystals, and works with the “poderios”, the elemental forces we need to keep an open channel of communication. Her style is accompanied by prayer work and traditional indigenous ceremonies to heal her community with heart. Irma StarSpirit Woman currently lives in Queens, NY Contact her at [masked] or visit: shamanicfirereiki.com
results.how_to_find_us: nyshamaniccircle@gmail.com
results.name: NY Shamanic Healing Circle

results.description:
Occasionally one is confronted with ailments that resist conventional therapies. One feels like they’ve been “cursed” (“No matter what I do I can’t shake it off”). Through past life regression or readings, often a deeper reason for the ailment is found. Healing of the past can be achieved through bioenergy, and occasionally with homeopathy. Another aspect discussed is what shamans call soul retrieval. Bioenergy healing addresses this category in an energetic way. Examples, readings and therapies will be reviewed during class.

NOTE: Following a one hour presentation, the Edgar Cayce Healer’s Group practitioners will offer Bioenergy Healing to all who attend the evening and request it. Occasionally the length of the presentation portion may be adjusted to accommodate a guest speaker, or as karma dictates.
results.name: Karmic Healing and Soul Retrieval with Bioenergy with Anton Baraschi

results.description:
In conjunction with the exhibition
Setting Out
organized by Shona Kitchen, Aly Ogasian, and Jennifer Dalton Vincent

Janna Kaplan and Heidi Neilson will each present on topics relating to human survival in outer space. Kaplan will draw from her experience as a Space Research Specialist to discuss the tasks and challenges of preparing astronauts for spaceflight, while Neilson will present her Menu for Mars Supper Club project, which envisions the future of cuisine on Mars. 


Setting Out explores how the nature of expeditions has evolved into the modern day. Incorporating the work of archaeologists, engineers, scientists, and artists exploring a variety of realms both geographical and beyond, the exhibition demonstrates that all these expeditions share the same eager hunger to uncover the unknown. 

Janna Kaplan, M.S., is Lecturer in Psychology and Senior Research Associate at Brandeis University’s Graybiel Lab, specializing in Neuropsychology and Space Research. At Brandeis since 1983, she studies human adaptation to various conditions of space flight, such as zero-G, high-G, artificial gravity environments, spatial orientation, and space motion sickness. Within the Graybiel Lab, Kaplan has developed a program initiating commercial and private payload and research of astronaut training, of which she is now Program Lead and Senior Scientist. The training protocol focuses on sensorimotor human factors of flight, such as space motion sickness, spatial disorientation, spatial illusions, and movement errors in changing gravitoinertial force environments. Kaplan serves on Faculty Advisory Councils of the Brandeis-Genesis Institute for Russian Jewry, and of the Hadassah-Brandeis Institute for the Study of Jewish Women. She frequently lectures on the science of space exploration. Of special interest to her is the role of STEM curriculum (science, technology, engineering, math) in the empowerment and intellectual development of adolescent girls. 

Heidi Neilson is an artist addressing topics such as weather, fake snow, and the cultural landscape of outer space. Her work is often collaborative and publishing-based. She is a member of the ABC Artists’ Books Cooperative, co-founded SP Weather Station, and her work is included in over 60 museum and university collections. Born in Oregon, Heidi received a BA in biology from Reed College and an MFA in painting from Pratt Institute, and lives and works in New York.

Please join us for this free and open to the public apexart event.

apexart's exhibitions and and public programs are supported in part by the Affirmation Arts Fund, the Andy Warhol Foundation for the Visual Arts, Bloomberg Philanthropies, Edith C. Blum Foundation, Mary Duke Biddle Foundation, The Greenwich Collection Ltd., Lambent Foundation Fund of Tides Foundation, and with public funds from the New York City Department of Cultural Affairs and the New York State Council on the Arts. 

See more at: http://apexart.org/events/kaplan-neilson.php#sthash.Kw7P5Nvd.dpuf
results.name: Preparing for Outer Space: Astronaut Training and Menus for Mars

results.description:
Learn to act while overcoming stage fright. Meet new people and increase your confidence and poise. 10-session program. Scene Work - Improvisation - Monologue Study - Showcase Performance opportunities.

The focus is on relaxation and natural performance based on sound fundamental acting technique. We also provide the unique opportunity to perform before live audiences in our own in-house showcase productions.

Acting programs are often very intimidating. The instructors are harsh and anxiety is not addressed. We offer a more humane and effective alternative. Our program is designed to empower as well as guide you through the acting experience.

Many people who attend our classes have never acted before and just need a supportive environment to try it out. We work in very manageable steps. You will not be asked to do anything you are not comfortable with.

Please do come in and see for yourself, if the program is right for you.

Initial session is free of charge. If you do decide to enroll at the
Free Trial, you will receive a $49.00 discount, and 2 bonus sessions.

Discounted rate:$250 for 12 sessions.

Regular rate: $299 for 10 sessions

Our next Meetup will be in Bed-Stuy at the newest (and possibly coolest) craft beer bar in the city...The Wilky. How do I have such inside knowledge of the bar? Because I'm the beer buyer there!

We opened in mid-January, and I'm really excited to share this awesome spot with all of you. The Wilky has 18 tap lines, specialty cocktails, great sandwiches, and the best (and biggest) soft pretzel you'll ever have.

results.description:
Привет! Давайте попробуем грузинскую кухню!!!

"Oda House" in east village is so far the best Georgian restaurant you could find in NYC:-) I've been there many times with American friends, Russian friends, and other European friends before. Everyone liked the food, wine selection from Georgia, and service as well. 

It'll be nice to gather everyone at this cozy place for one of cold nights! Please RSVP if you plan to come, so I could reserve a table.  

***UPDATE #1***

The restaurant is SMALL, and made reservation last night for 19 people through my friend who works there. I don't know if it's good going there with such a big group. So, I limited the number of people to come for now. PLEASE CHANGE your RSVP if you/your guests can not come, so we can save space for other people.

***UPDATE #2***


I changed the max number of people to bigger!
results.name: Let's taste Georgian food!!

results.description:
Приглашаем  зайти на Mt Colden!

Mt Colden, 11 вершина Adirondack. С вершины открываются виды наивысших точек Adirondack.

http://www.adktrailmap.com/pdfs/HikeColden.pdf

http://www.summitpost.org/mount-colden/150556


План маршрута:

Выехать в пятницу. 

Ночевка в отеле.

Рано утром на маршрут.

В воскр: желающие могут прогулятся по Lake Placid, столице 2х зимних олимпийских игр, на горных или беговых лыжах, на собаках по Lake Placid.

---------------------

В вскр.

Надеюсь будет достаточно снега. Только для желающих. Давайте  вспомним как ходить  и страховаться на снежном склоне с ледорубом. (Self -arrest). Это необходимо для тех кто собирается в горы. Вам понадобятся: каска( подойдет любая), ледоруб. Если  нет своих, я захвачу с собой.

----------------------

возвращаемся домой

Не должно быть открытых участков тела.

Наверху нежарко :-)

Ходим Медленно :-)

--------

We start from Adirondack Loj

Distace: 12 miles

--------------

You need:

- snowshoes ( you may rent)

- mickrospikes

http://files.meetup.com/9125272/One%20Day%20Winter%20Hike%20List.rtf

-------------

Mount Colden, at 4714 feet, is the eleventh highest peak in New York State. The peak is named after David S. Colden, an investor in the McIntyre Iron Works, in 1836. The peak was briefly renamed "Mount McMartin" the next year, but the older name persisted. The mountain is known for its distinctive Trap Dyke, a large crevice running up the center of the mountain, which can clearly be seen from Avalanche Lake.


---------------

difficulty: strenuous


---------------

The Adirondak Loj address is: 1002 Adirondack Loj Rd, Lake Placid, NY 12946 

The Adirondak Loj and High Peaks Information Center is approximately 8 miles (or a 16 minute drive) from the town center of Lake Placid. 

Adirondack Loj GPS Coordinates: Latitude :[masked] | Longitude : [masked] 

From the South: Take the Adirondack Northway (I-87) to Exit 30. Turn left on Route 73 toward Keene and Lake Placid, continue on Route 73 for 26.5 miles. Turn left on Adirondack Loj Road (High Peaks Trailhead sign). It is 5 miles to the Loj. 

From the North: Take the Adirondack Northway (I-87) to Exit 34, Keeseville. Follow Route 9N to Jay and Route 86 to Lake Placid. Turn left on Route 73 before going through Lake Placid. In three miles look for the High Peaks trailhead sign and turn right on Adirondack Loj Road. It is 5 miles to the Loj. 

From the West: Take Route 3 or Route 86 into Saranac Lake. Continue on Route 86 through Lake Placid. At the third traffic light, turn right on to Route 73 towards Keene. In three miles look for the High Peaks trailhead sign and turn right onto the Adirondack Loj Road. It is 5 miles to the Loj. 

Parking: There is parking for about 200 cars at a charge of $10 per day (ADK members pay $5 per day). 

------------------------------------

If you join us for hiking (or any other event), understand that you are responsible for your own preparedness and well-being and will hold no one else liable in case of injury or mishap. You agree not to hold the Organizer, Assistant Organizers, or any other members responsible for any injuries, mishaps, or any other situation

that may happen at a planned event. It is your responsibility to research the event, know the area, and bring the proper gear.

Your attendance on this trip signifies that you have read and accept the terms of this liability waiver.

Please, review safety information 

http://www.meetup.com/Brodyaga/files/
results.name: Mt Colden / Adirondack

results.description:
How Your Defenses Against Pain Block The Possibility Of Happiness With Dr. Jay Kantor

When we get psychologically overwhelmed and hurt as children, and lack parental support to help us cope with it in a mature manner, our brains may take extreme steps to protect ourselves from experiencing any more trauma or pain. We may erect powerful defenses to keep us safe, but these same defenses may prevent us from growing up and prevent us from having a life worth living.

We may unknowingly create a life that is safe, but not meaningful and satisfying. As unhappy as we are keeping ourselves away from really living our life, we may fearfully cling to our defenses and refuse to make any changes which we wrongly believe will lead only to failure and unhappiness. The traumatized child in us can only imagine and fear that the trauma from the past will repeat in the future.

The fearful child spends her or his life watching out for danger, hyper-vigilantly anticipating the painful, shameful disaster that is bound to occur.

Defenses against danger – psychological, emotional, or real – will remain in place until we take the actions necessary to drop them - actions we won't take if we continue to be controlled by fearful beliefs formed many years ago.

The child in us needs our help if we ever hope to overcome past trauma. Tonight, we will discuss and explore the things you can definitely do to change what the fearful children inside us believe and feel. If we really hope to be safe in our lives, we must learn to function in the real world, utilizing the powerful abilities which currently lie hidden beneath our fearful thinking.

Join us tonight to take a vital step toward releasing psychological patterns which now keep you stuck in a painful, unsatisfying place.

Program starts at 7:30PM.

Information about the facilitator: http://DrJayKantor.Com
results.name: How Defenses Against Pain Block The Possibility Of Happiness W/ Dr. Jay Kantor

group.name: North Jersey Body, Mind, Spirit Meetup

results.description:
Over and over and over. We are on auto pilot now, so we will have this, or another event, at a place to be determined, (TBI), every two weeks, with a pancake or some other panic event tossed in to keep everyone aggravated to the fullest.

As usual, if you RSVP 'yes' but can't make it, call me; your merry group organizer, Greg, at[masked] 1066.

And the standard 'It's ok to come late, or bring well behaved young ones' is in effect as well. 

Veggie Heaven is open till 11pm, and sometimes later(we loose track of time, someone keeps ordering scallion pancakes, and the staff is slow to tie up the evening's loose ends, so we are usually there for a good spell, I think 12AM is our record). Thus, lateness due to scheduling issues, etc, is no biggie. 

If we have a change of venue, for any given week, we will let you know in advance.

results.description:
Дорогие друзья, давайте вспомним о настоящем театре. Петербургский Малый Драматический предлагает Вашему вниманию классику жанра, спектакль Антона Павловича Чехова " Вишневый Сад" на сцене Brooklyn Academy of Music.

Пьеса написана в 1903 г, впервые поставлена в 1904 в Московском художественном театре .


Это последняя пьеса Чехова, завершённая на пороге Первой русской революции за год до его ранней смерти.

Подарите себе незабываемые минуты!

---------------------

The Cherry Orchard

Running Time: 3hrs (with intermission)

In Russian with English titles

By Anton Chekhov Maly Drama Theatre of St. Petersburg, Russia Directed and adapted by Lev Dodin

Chekhov’s masterpiece reverberates across more than a century in this spare new staging from visionary director Lev Dodin and his St. Petersburg-based Maly Drama Theatre.

Билеты здесь.


http://www.bam.org/m/theater/2016/the-cherry-orchard
results.name: "Вишневый Сад" на сцене Brooklyn Academy of Music /The Cherry Orchard

results.description:
Come join this wonderful on going FRIDAY EVENING co-ed (men and women) Yoga Class 7:15-8:15pm.  This is an adult yoga class for all ages and levels (if interested in children's yoga, please contact me).  Beginners are welcome and encouraged to join.  NO gym membership required.  Reiki is part of the entire class, however specifically given to each person during the quiet beginning of the class (meditation and centering) and at the end of the class during Savasana (the final pose). Each person receives Reiki during the entire class.  If you have a mat, you can bring it.  If you do not have a mat, I have some to share.  Please visit

www.CliftonYogaNJ.com

for more information or you can email through this meetup group or at [masked]. Text or call (email and text are fastest) directly (862) 621-9642.


Your first class is $10.  Future classes are sold in groups of 4 classes for $40 (still $10 per class).  NO gym membership required.  If you miss a class, you do NOT lose the class- it just stays in your account for future use :) but expires one year from purchase.  This is a wonderful class that builds upon your connection to your inner voice, connects you to your inner wisdom and divine consciousness.  You will build strength, flexibility and peace of mind... come join our group! :)
results.name: On Going FRIDAY EVENING Yoga with Reiki (both men and women are in this class)

Is your life where you desire it to be? What is holding you back from the achievement you want in today? Why can't you do what you know you are capable of doing? Are your negative beliefs just too strong? NO ONE IS STUCK with their negative beliefs. Did you know there are belief altering techniques you are not yet using? Why do so many people believe they can't! Inside their head they say "I can't!"

"I can't": 
Find the love I want 
Find the right place to live 
The work I love to do 
Solve my problems

What if you could rewrite your beliefs and change your life? "I can't" becomes "I CAN MAKE LIFE POSSIBLE." There are belief altering techniques you are not yet using? How much more positive would you become with your BIG DREAMS and goals? Would you become more capable with permission to achieve what you want? With BELIEF COGNITIVE You can turn positive accidents and lucky breaks into everyday events. Luck becomes a natural part of your behavior. The core power of BELIF altering is based in unlocking and using talents you already have in you.

Location

LIVE BELIEF STUDIO: "YOU CAN COMMAND YOUR BELIEFS" SESSION

FRIDAY February 26

Time 7:30 pm To 10:00 pm 
Location: Ripley-Grier 
520 8th Avenue 17 FL 
Between 36th and 37th street 
New York, NY 10018 
Please be on time, allow for traffic and delays in your travel plans.

Take the Right Hand side elevator to the 17 Floor 
Walk though the glass doors and turn left and at the end 
turn right then left to the end of the hall


NOTE: If there is a ROOM CHANGE consult the front desk.


Room: 17 M

DOOR RATE IS $20

ONLINE RATE IS $10

TIME TO OPEN THE BELIEFS BOX  
Everyone lives inside the BOX of their own beliefs and the beliefs they collected from others. Most of the time the BOX is keep closed and invisible. Logical fact or will power rarely, if ever has the power to shift the reality altering power of beliefs and believe systems. Time to open the BOX of our beliefs and look inside for how to make desired happiness and achievements happen. 
Get the job you want 
Influence yourself 
Make better decision 
Transform your mind inside out and your life 
Build pathways of BELIEFS for actions,happiness, health, success and achievement.

WHAT ARE BELIEFS? 
Many people feel beliefs are just areas of life they feel strongly about. This is only a small part of a much bigger story? Beliefs are fundamentally PATHWAYS IN BRAIN-mind that our focus and habits travel down as we live. Beliefs control how we experience the world and our every action. Beliefs even keep us in place and frozen from taking action. Each moment of our lives we travel towards our limits or our POSSIBILITIES down the pathways of our beliefs.

THE COGNITIVE TECHNOLOGY OF BELIEF 
You don't need another philosophy. What you keep searching for is a way to chart your specific beliefs and a way to ecologically change all the beliefs that are holding you back from success and achievement. Learn this state-of-the-Art of the art technology and method for putting you in charge of your belief systems.

WHO SHOULD ATTEND And BENEFIT? 
Entrepreneurs, Running a Start up, Artists, Writers,Self-employed, educators, managers & executives, or Salespersons. Anyone and everyone with beliefs and those who communicate with others that have beliefs. Someone that wants more FREEDOM, CREATIVITY AND ACHIEVEMENT in their lives.

CURATOR

The Cognitive Artist & Stylist James Murdock operates a boutique-consulting and coaching practice. The primary focus of the practice is providing training in Human performance engineering and organizational development. He is a cultural trends tracker, communication skills and persuasion expert. Mr. Murdock is an independent researcher in the areas of cognitive Science, Human Behavior Engineering and accelerated Human change. His work has been featured both nationally and internationally in media ranging from Marie Claire magazine, ABC news, NBC news, The Gayle King Show, Spotlight magazine, Providence journal, New York press, The British Star, Manhattan Spirit, and New York Non-Stop, plus numerous National Radio programs. He has also written for many national and regional publications.
results.name: LIVE BELIEFS STUDIO: "YOU CAN COMMAND YOUR BELIEFS" SESSION

results.description:
Does reason have any place within Islam?  

Join us in viewing two short introductory videos on this subject.  The first is a video of Muhammad Assad on the topic of Ijtihad in Islam.  Ijtihad is the use of independent reasoning to find solutions for contemporary problems using the Quran and the Hadith.   Mohammed Assad was born an Austrian Jew and converted to Islam in 1926.  He is best known for his books the Road to Mecca and The Message of the Quran, a wonderful translation and interpretation of the Quran in English.

The second video is an interview with Murad Hoffman, a German convert to Islam.  Murad Hoffman has worked as a Director of NATO.  He was also posted as the German Ambassador to Algeria and later to Morocco.  He has published several books on Islam. In this video, Murrad Hoffman discusses the role of rationality within Islamic History.  

After the videos we will have a discussion on this topic. Please feel free to bring healthy snacks to share after the screening. 

We ask attendees to contribute $5 each for the rental of the location.
results.name: The role of reason in Islam

Interested in speed dating on a Friday Night? This event Friday night is for men and women at Darbar Grille.  

At present we need both men and women (aged 32 to 42 although there's a little flexibility in the age range). Also don't worry if only a few people sign up on the Meetup as people will be attending from different sources.  

Grab friends and come along to Darbar Grille to meet other energetic NYC singles, and pick out those you feel a connection with and would like to meet again. This promises to be a lot of fun, so you're highly encouraged to come down. To get your spot, you must:

(a) RSVP on the MeetUp site

(b) please also e-mail me directly at

<a>[masked]</a> to say you want to come and kindly give your age and first name.

As this is a speed-dating event, and the balance of men and women is very important, I will need to correspond with you briefly by e-mail to confirm your attendance. Also tickets are free for a limited time.  Please note that you are only confirmed once you get a reply from me

(i.e. from <a>[masked]</a>). If you're looking for more details about this event, please visit the New York EasyDates website. Hope you can make it!

Regards, 

Daniel

results.description:
Open level class. Any level student can practice, taking the postures to a more challenging experience. Beginners are welcome, postures can always be modified to suit the individual. As always, listen to your body, take the postures to were it feels right for you and have fun! This class builds upon Basic  yoga postures, continuing our growth. Students always have the option to take this class where they desire... from a basic level and build foundation or to more challenging postures and flow techniques. It all depends on the individual and what their body needs ! Its an open field  for exploration and discovery.

 Breathing techniques focused upon during practice to connect the body and mind with the breath. Power Yoga builds muscle strength from the core outward, tones the body, creates endurance and stamina. Great for over all health. Breathing techniques calm the mind and ground the self.

There is a 15 minute optional deep relaxation and  guided meditation after class going deeper into chakra balancing.
results.name: Yoga - Open Class

results.description:
Friday nights under the lights! Teams are 7v7, it's a  60min + game and coed friendly.


Pls aim to arrive early and be ready to start on time. All players must bring a white and black t-shirt. Pass the ball & have fun!


***********************************************************

Details:

1) Teams divide into equal ability - players are welcome to signup with friends.

2) No metal cleats. Turf shoes or molded cleats. Proper Soccer attire only.

3) Played in a fun & chill environment. Rough play, tackles, or sliding are not tolerated. Emphasis on passing over dribbling.


4) If there are no dedicated goalkeepers, players rotate in goal.


5) If you arrive late wait until a break in the game. Inserting players in the middle of the game disrupts the flow- it's not fair to those that arrive on time.

All players must RSVP w/ payment. This goes toward light rentals, field permits, equipment and fees.

CANCELLATIONS/REFUNDS:

If you cannot attend, you'll need to update the RSVP 24 hours before the match, in order to receive a match credit. This is so other members have a chance to take your place.

See you at the pitch!

By joining this group and attending events you agree to the Waiver Of Liability.
results.name: Friday Soccer 7v7 COED @7:30pm | W. Village 60min+

results.description:
Please join us for this special evening of coloring meditation. The word mandala comes from the ancient Sanskrit language and loosely means "circle" or "center." The mandala is a circular matrix with a center point, a sacred center that helps to stimulate and promote creativity, relaxation, healing, and other positive states of being. As an alternate style of meditation, coloring allows us to enter into and experience the power of the mandala in our lives.

Rev. Paul will begin the evening with a brief talk on meditation and the mandala before we begin our evening of coloring. Our coloring meditation will be a silent one followed by a time for refreshments and conversation.

Crayons, colored pencils, and coloring mandalas will be provided.

Bring a friend. We look forward to seeing you!
results.name: An Evening of Coloring Meditation

results.description:
Futsal Pick up games (intermediate to advanced level)

Fee: $10 dollars per player per game; pay through paypal.

Only 10 players per game, no subs. One game is 55-60 minutes. Be early. Every player rotates as a Goalie for 6 minutes, time it with an electronic scoreboard. We play without a break. Regulation size goals with nets. Futsal ball. Please make sure to bring a white and a red t-shirt, indoor shoes. Games are competitive, but friendly. Please keep in mind that these games are definitely not for the beginners. 

Please no fouls, zero tolerance to this. “Futsal is not a physical but a technical game ”. Minimum physical contact means fewer injuries and no violence. No charging, no 

displacing with your arms or body to gain the position on the ball. No running into the opponent. Play the ball, not the player. Time it, don’t foul it. 

Refunds: Cancel your RSVP ,  24 hours or more before the game and we will make the refund. No refund for late cancelations; no exceptions. 

The school entrance is located on East 109th street between 2nd and 3rd avenues (near 2nd avenue) on the south side of the street. You'll see a row of 5-6 metal doors. Open the door or ring the buzzer (on your right) and someone will open the door for you.

For questions,  use the MEETUP message and notifications tools. 

Post pictures and videos at:

Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/Futsalacrossamerica?ref=hl

Twitter: https://twitter.com/FutsalAcrossA

Thank you for being part of Futsal Across America.

Enjoy the game!

results.description:
Whether you are a tournament player or a “newbie,” if you love making friends while playing the world's #1 Word Game, SCRABBLE, as we do then…

•   Come On Down!

      •   Bring A Guest! 

          •   Feel free to bring your Scrabble set and

               • Enjoy the night with us!

We normally meet EVERY 2ND AND 4TH FRIDAY

                         • EATING starts AT 7:30PM
              (whether it's dinner or just dessert/drinks)

            • GAMES START NO LATER THAN 8:15 PM.

In addition, (after an initial round of “Scrabble”) THE 4TH WEEK OF EVERY MONTH, we enjoy TEAM TRIVIA, pitting two teams of those who want to play against each other in a battle of wits over totally insignificant information.

(Those who are not trivia aficionados continue their Scrabble competition.)

Afterward, for those who want to hang and chill, we play a short group game, chosen at random. (TABOO has been the latest "hot choice.")

ABOVE ALL, WE HAVE ONE HOUSE RULE—

                          LET FUN BE #1!!!

Meetup is at the Dangerfields bar first up front, if you wanna stay for the show you can if not you can just come by and meet others. So some good news Dangerfield's Comedy Club the Longest running Comedy club in the world, started by Rodney Dangerfield himself 45 years ago has been generous to extend free tickets to our meetup group. This should be a fun meetup. This is not an Amateur or Gimmick Comedy show, Dangerfields features best of the best comedians who have performed in leading clubs, motion pictures and tv shows such as Tonight Show with Jay leno, Jimmy Fallon, Letterman, Seth meyers, Conan and Comedy Central. HBO's most successful comedy TV specials were taped at this club.

Im very excited to have the meetup here, its a 2 drink minimum as in any other club and theres a full food menu. But we get the tickets for free which is a $40 value

Hope to see you there. This weeks is hosted by Q (Quinten Heggs), Lineup includes Ryan Reiss (Comedy Central), Lenny Marcus (Comedy Central), Rob Magnotti (Letterman), Marc Theobald. Ive personally never been to this club, but the Organizer will have a meetup sign, we all sit together, and meet each other so look for the meetup sign and the organizer will give you the Free Tickets.

Show Starts at 8:30, so come at 7:45 to meet your fellow meetup members! Enjoy!

Zagat 2014, "Wonderfully Eccentric"

Thank you so much for coming to the A-Town Swing classes last year. We had a great time meeting and dancing with everyone. Thank you for your beautiful dancing and being such a friendly bunch!! 

Our Lindy hop beginner's class is still for absolute beginners but different material from last session. So you are welcome to take class again even though you took our class in last session. (We will be doing 8 count steps basic)

results.description:
Gotham Atheists weekly Drinking With Atheists Friday Night Socials!

Join us for a great night of conversation in relaxed company in New York City. We go from 8pm to around 11pm or so.

Every Friday Night for 8 years we have gathered to enjoy the evening and the company of each other. Every week we meet at someone's apartment, a park, or a bar. DWA (Drinking With Atheists) is for Atheists, agnostics, Skeptics, Philosophers, Humanists, Freethinkers, Brights, secularists, inquiring minds, and all around nice people. No agenda but good light conversations. Great chance to meet new people and make new friends.

See you Friday Night.

Lee

results.description:
The Rebel Alliance has recruited a team of rogues, misfits and ne'er do wells to infiltrate the criminal underworld of Nar Shadaa! Join the notorious Black Crows gang and assist the Rebels in undermining the influence of the Galactic Empire in the underworld of Nar Shadaa, the smuggler's moon.

This is a Star Wars: Age of Rebellion game that takes place on Nar Shadaa in Hutt Space. PCs are agents of the Rebel Alliance who pose as smugglers, bounty hunters and other scum while carrying out the agenda to free the galaxy of the Empire. Force Users are also welcome, as the ancient practices of the Jedi and other Force sects are the highest crimes that the Empire have decreed.

Character types from all three of the Fantasy Flight Star Wars games (Edge of the Empire, Age of Rebellion, Force and Destiny) are allowed, and the special FFG dice are provided. New players will be shown how to play this great game, so beginners are welcome.

results.description:
Hey all. Let's go see the biggest horror film of this year!

In 1630 New England, panic and despair envelops a farmer (Ralph Ineson), his wife (Kate Dickie) and four of their children when youngest son Samuel suddenly vanishes. The family blames Thomasin (Anya Taylor-Joy), the oldest daughter who was watching the boy at the time of his disappearance. With suspicion and paranoia mounting, twin siblings Mercy (Ellie Grainger) and Jonas (Lucas Dawson) suspect Thomasin of witchcraft, testing the clan's faith, loyalty and love to one another.

(NOTE: We'll pin down the exact location and time when it gets closer.)
results.name: LET'S GO SEE THE WITCH!

Join us on Friday, February 5th, 2016 for a night of mingling, socializing and creating business connections. Meet like minded women who want to increase their professional contacts in a warm and socially engaging atmosphere.

It does not matter what business or field you are in: therapists, lawyers, coaches, web designers, doctors, nurses, tradespeople, teachers, technicians...

Your next client, business associate, business connection, professional consultant or entrepreneurial partner could be there ! It is also a great way to find out what professional women are creating within our community and how we can support their efforts.

results.description:
New to Blues dancing? Check out our FAQ. 

If you've never been to Friday Night Blues NYC before, it's a great idea to check out our policies on Blues etiquette and on harassment before coming.


****************************************************************************

SCHEDULE:

8:30pm-9:30pm - Fundamentals Lesson (Turns) w/ Olivia​ and Melissa​
8:30pm-9:30pm - Extended Topics (Jankey Jukey Close Embrace) w/ Naomi​ and Jeff​
9:30pm-10:00pm - DJs John​ and Kathleen
​10:00pm-11:00pm - LIVE MUSIC!! w/ Binky Griptite​11:00pm-11:30pm - DJs John and Kathleen
11:30pm-12:30am - Binky Griptite
12:30am-1:30am - DJs John and Kathleen


$10 class / $16 dance / $24 both
Cash only


****************************************************************************

FEBRUARY EXTENDED TOPICS:


Close Embrace
This series will hone your close embrace skills. Starting with how to create a comfortable embrace, we will work on how to create space in the embrace to enable both the graceful and traveling movement of the ballroomin' style as well as a more sharp and rhythmic movements of the jukin' style.


This Week: Jankey Jukey Close Embrace
In our final week, Naomi and Jeff will focus on how to do Jukin' movements while in the close embrace hold. We will work on fishtails, grinds, hip bumps and more! We will round off the month by talking about musicality and how the follow can still find space to add despite the seemingly narrow hold. 

Read more about our classes at: http://www.fridaynightblues.nyc/learning

****************************************************************************

DETAILS:

No need to bring a partner! Friday Night Blues NYC is a social dance; we dance with strangers, we dance with our friends... we want to dance with you! Our crowd can typically bring in anywhere from 30 to 80 dancers on any given evening.

Admission on live music nights is $10 for the lesson, $16 for the dance, or $24 for both. (If you use a punch card, we will ask for an additional $4 to help cover the cost of the band.)

****************************************************************************

Volunteers get in for FREE!
Email [masked] to inquire about volunteer opportunities.

Stay informed: join our mailing list!

Friday Night Blues NYC is on Yelp! If you enjoy our event, please consider leaving us a review.
results.how_to_find_us: http://www.fridaynightblues.nyc/about/locations
results.name: Friday Night Blues NYC

results.description:
Come and join us for an evening of fun and TurnOn. How often do we get an opportunity to be real with each other in NYC? We play 3 communication game (you can play at whatever level feels comfortable to you). Imagine meeting new people in an environment where people felt comfortable to be themselves. That's what we have created.

It's a refreshing change from the typical networking or bar conversation.

You get the opportunity to examine yourself. Through other people putting quality attention on you, asking questions with genuine curiosity, and then listening - really listening – to your responses.

What comes up might surprise you!

At the end of the evening we will tell you all about how you can learn the practice of Orgasmic Meditation. What class you can take and what we have to offer so you can have the life that you want.

It's amazing how connected we can end up feeling - even in a room full of strangers - when we are willing to say what's real. In an hour and some you may even forget for a moment you are in New York City.

OneTaste NYC is an organization teaches Orgasmic Meditation, otherwise known as OM. The games we play at TurnON are designed to create the visceral sensation of Orgasm/OM in your body, without having to actually do the practice (or remove any clothing!).

It's a friendly invitation to play and push your edges in a way that feels good. This allows you to stretch yourself and inspires self-discovery!

Come early, doors close at 8:40p. COST TO ATTEND IS $10.

***When you register or attend please make a point to mention to us you found this event through NYC Pleasure without Borders MeetUp.

For questions contact [masked] |[masked]


Can't make this one? visit us at www.turnonny.us
results.name: TurnON Games in Park Slope

Every other week, we meet up in Elmsford for karaoke. Since the music starts at 10:00, some of us also meet up at 8:30 for dinner beforehand, while others come only for the dinner and drinks. Come join us for some alcohol, bar food, and good times!

There is free valet parking, and when the valet guy leaves, he parks your car very close by (as parking becomes more available) and gives you back your keys. Street parking is also readily available.

If you're interested in both eating and singing, don't forget to sign up for the karaoke event too!

Simon

results.description:
No 2-star-only event this week, I'll probably try again soon though. If you have 1 or 2 stars, sign up!

This is for strong intermediate/advanced players only (league/tournament-ready, mostly B/BB-level). If you don't have a * (asterisk) above your name on your SoCom Meetup profile, you MUST message me before signing up if you want to play.

You MUST RSVP to play. Message me on Meetup or text/call me (Dan) at[masked] if you have any questions or RSVP issues. If you're not on the 'going' list, it means you're not signed up.

Please note: If you sign up, we're expecting you to stay and play, not leave halfway through. We only do 12 players per court, so leaving early will leave a team with only 5 players. If you're not sure if you can stay the whole time, send me a message before signing up.

results.description:
We all joined this meetup so we can all learn salsa dancing. As part of this mission, we have a salsa practice party every Friday. The party takes place in a cozy boutique dance studio in Times Square and we have our own DJ and professional Sound system. The fee is only $10. At 9:30pm I teach a complimentary Salsa class at no extra. Come meet and greet the other students and practice what you learned by dancing with everyone. Everyone is friendly and welcoming. If you just want to dance, just come at 10:30 when the DJ music begins and the class ends.

***********************************************************

In this particular friday, the ladies who take the class will be able to join the thursday level 1 class because you will catch up to them in terms of the material we have taught. You will not have to wait for months for the thursday cycle to end in order to take it. Why only ladies? because there is only limited space and we already have the number of guys we need. We have enough ladies but we are looking to have a 1:1 ratio of male:female or close enough. So ladies, come at take this class and learn the joyful dance that is salsa.

**********************************************************

Admission: $10. Note that this will be your only expense for the entire Friday night unless you buy a beverage. But you can also bring your own beverages if you want.

Time: The class starts at 9:30pm and the dancing begins at 10:30pm.

Location: Times Square - 151 West 46th Street, 11th Floor, New York, NY 10036 (between 7av and 6av)

Dress code: Casual/comfortable. Bring shoes that don't slip out of your feet and do not have too much grip on the floor. Boots are not recommended.

results.description:
This underrated effort works both as a horror film and as a satire of the "rural terror" subgenre spawned by films like The Texas Chainsaw Massacre and Race With the Devil. Robert Jaffe andSteven-Charles Jaffe's script keeps the premise from degenerating into a tacky shock-a-thon by doling out the gore in sparing doses and playing up the satirical angle of the script. Indeed, the film devotes as much time to humor as it does to scares and shocks. Motel Hell pokes fun at such diverse targets as televangelism, swingers, and good old-fashioned American capitalism as it chronicles Farmer Vincent's grisly doings. This script is ably supported by subtle, atmospheric direction by Kevin Connor, who captures the script's complex blend of humor and horror nicely and also works in some clever visual references to horror classics like Night of the Living Dead. Motel Hell also benefits from above-average performances. The obvious scene-stealer is Rory Calhoun, who fuels the quietly deranged Farmer Vincent with enough compassion and down-home charm to make him likable despite his villainous ways. His work is supported by a nice range of supporting performances, including slyly comic turns from Nancy Parsons as Farmer Vincent's childlike but deadly partner in crime and Paul Linke as his dim but determined younger brother. On the downside, Motel Hell's leisurely pacing and emphasis on characterization might throw off horror fans weaned on hard-driving fare like Re-Animator and The Evil Dead. However, even viewers turned off by these aspects will want to stick around for the film's bravura finale, which involves a chainsaw duel and a hero swinging to the rescue on a meat hook. In the end, Motel Hell is probably a bit too eccentric and grisly for the average viewer, but its solidly crafted blend of wit and gore makes it a natural for cult film fanatics and horror addicts with a sense of humor.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=k4AR3BgaCdA

You can buy tickets here: https://drafthouse.com/greater-ny/show/prints-of-darkness-motel-hell

results.description:
Futsal Pick up games (intermediate to advanced level)

Fee: $10 dollars per player per game; pay through paypal.

Only 10 players per game, no subs. One game is 55-60 minutes. Be early. Every player rotates as a Goalie for 6 minutes, time it with an electronic scoreboard. We play without a break. Regulation size goals with nets. Futsal ball. Please make sure to bring a white and a red t-shirt, indoor shoes. Games are competitive, but friendly. Please keep in mind that these games are definitely not for the beginners. 

Please no fouls, zero tolerance to this. “Futsal is not a physical but a technical game ”. Minimum physical contact means fewer injuries and no violence. No charging, no 

displacing with your arms or body to gain the position on the ball. No running into the opponent. Play the ball, not the player. Time it, don’t foul it. 

Refunds: Cancel your RSVP ,  24 hours or more before the game and we will make the refund. No refund for late cancelations; no exceptions. 

The school entrance is located on East 109th street between 2nd and 3rd avenues (near 2nd avenue) on the south side of the street. You'll see a row of 5-6 metal doors. Open the door or ring the buzzer (on your right) and someone will open the door for you.

For questions,  use the MEETUP message and notifications tools. 

Post pictures and videos at:

Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/Futsalacrossamerica?ref=hl

Twitter: https://twitter.com/FutsalAcrossA

Thank you for being part of Futsal Across America.

Enjoy the game!

We will return to our favor mountain - Hunter Mountain. It is closer, and has more and better trails. "As the Catskills' premier winter destination, Hunter Mountain celebrates renowned terrain, award-winning facilities and luxury mountainside accommodations together creating a smile on any snow lover's face! Discover Hunter's impressive array of mountainside amenities, including lodging at the Liftside Condominiums and the new four seasons, slopeside Katskill Mountain Club, plus a dozen unique mountain eateries speckled throughout the resort, two full service retail stores and plenty of programs for adults, children, and families."


*** Trip plan email via Eventbrite will be sent out 2 to 3 days before the event providing the details. ***


Date: February 27th, 2016 Saturday. Please arrive 30 minutes earlier. 


Depart 5:45 AM from Queens: (Sheraton LaGuardia East Hotel)[masked]th Ave, Flushing, NY 11354 (Map)


Depart 6:30 AM from NYC: (Garden City Deli) Northwest corner of 43rd St & 9th Ave New York, NY 10036 (Map)

Depart 7:10 AM from NJ: (NJ Transit Ramsey Route 17) 1 Spring St, Ramsey, NJ 07446 (Map)


Return: Depart from Hunter at 4:30 PM and expect to arrive at NJ at 6:45 PM, NYC at 7:30 PM & Queens at 8:00 PM.

Cost: Includes all mountain lift ticket + round trip bus transportation - This is $17 to $20 off comparing to other bus tours. 
* Early birds $79 for first 27 spots
* Regular $89 for last 27 spots.


Additional Cost:
* $30 to upgrade lift ticket to Beginner Package which include lower-mountain lift ticket, rental (skis or snowboard) & group lesson.
* $39 for Ski or Snowboard Rental Package. Ski Rental Package includes skis, boots, poles & helmet; Snowboard Rental Package includes snowboard, boots & helmet.

Maximum: 55

Transportation: Bus is included.

Buy Ticket Here: http://feb272016hunter.eventbrite.com You can also Chase Quickpay me at [masked] to avoid transaction fee. (How to Use Chase Quickpay?) When Quickpaying, please indicate your boarding location and cell #. Your spot is NOT confirmed unless your payment is received 

Refund Policy: 


* Full refund minus $20 processing fee if cancelled 14 days in advance.
* 50% refund if cancelled 7 days in advance. 
* Afterward, no refund for cancellation or no show.
*100% refund if the event is cancelled.

results.description:
Hi everyone,

Please be there 15 minutes earlier so you can get set up, and bring a white and a red t-shirt.

If this game is full click here for our calendar and see other game slots!

Thank you,

Paul

Details Below:

------------------------------------------------------

Game style and Rules:

1. HAVE FUN!!! It's SOCCER

2. We'll play (2) 30-minute games.

3. We will divide into teams based on everyone's experience and skills.

4. No ball hogging.

5. Please use turf shoes or sneakers.

results.description:
Some of us told me that I have been slagging off hiking with Blaze.  After all it is still winter, time to get out and hiking to lose some pounds that we gained over the holidays.  Let's spend a day in the nature!  Let's hike somewhere nearby.

This rugged hike traverses the southeastern corner of Harriman State Park, climbing to several panoramic viewpoints and following the cascading Stony Brook.

The plan is to leave NYC around 830 am on Saturday, Febuary 27, and meet around 930 am at Dunkin' Donuts in Sloatsburg, NY, about 40 miles north of the city. From there we'll drive together to the trail head at the Reeves Meadow Visitor Center.

The hike will be challenging: up to 8 miles up and down or more, with some views of Manhattan. The hike is not easy, but if you're physically fit and prepared for the hike, you should be able to make it. In that sense, beginners are welcome.

You have to be prepared for the hike - it may be cold, rainy, snowy. You have to have boots that don't get wet easily. Bring layers of clothes so that you can add and remove a layer as necessary. The clothes should be synthetic (cotton does not dry when it gets wet from your sweat). Don't forget to bring a rain jacket, gloves and a hat. You also have to have at least a 1.5 liter of water and a lunch snack.

As usual, we'll be carpooling. Please sign up on the waiting list and I'll move you to the yes column as we get more drivers signed up. Also please bring some cash with you to give to your driver to pay the gas and tolls.

If you have a question, post it below or e-mail me. I'll send a spreadsheet to organize the carpool on the Wednesday before the hike.

Driving Directions

Take N.J. Route 17 north to the New York State Thruway and take the first exit, Exit 15A (Sloatsburg). Turn left at the bottom of the ramp onto N.Y. Route 17 north, and continue through the Village of Sloatsburg. Just past the village, turn right at the traffic light, following the sign for Harriman State Park. Cross an overpass over railroad tracks and continue along Seven Lakes Drive for three-quarters of a mile to the Reeves Meadow Visitor Center, on the right side of the road. Park in the Visitor Center's parking lot.


Train Take the NJ Transit/Metro-North Port Jervis Line to the Sloatsburg station.

results.description:
The 2016 Urban hiking series returns with a great line up of 3 urban treks hosted by Stephen Miller! 

2016 URBAN HIKING SERIES Triple Crown Part 1-  30 Miles! 

GW Bridge to the End of the Old Croton Aqueduct Trail 

2016 URBAN HIKING SERIES 

Saturday February 27, 2016 

 Meet time 8:15 A.M. 

 Start time- 8:30 A.M. sharp 

Location: 179th Street and Fort Washington Ave. -GW Bridge to the Northern end the Old Croton Aqueduct Trail(New Croton Dam) 30+ miles 

 This trek will start on the Manhattan side of the George Washington Bridge and head up the Hudson River Greenway to the northern tip of the island before heading over the Henry Hudson Bridge into The Bronx. We will carry on through some beautiful sections of Fieldston and Riverdale before heading over to Broadway and making our way into Yonkers in southern Westchester County. At that point, we will connect with the Old Croton Aqueduct Trail and head up to its northern terminus at the New Croton Dam in Northern Westchester. This trail, which lies above the aqueduct which supplied water to NYC beginning in the 19th century, will carry us through eleven towns in Westchester County to our final destination. Along the way, we will have some amazing views of the Hudson River, some magnificent, historic homes as well as many other historic sightswhile having easy accessibility to the Metro North. 

The OCA portion of the trek will be about 23 miles of primarily level dirt and gravel ground making the entire journey about 30-32 miles . We will have two full fledged breaks to eat as well as some shorter bathroom stops. We'll maintain a brisk pace3+mph. For those unsure as to whether you can do this, get your a** out there. The energy and encouragement of the group will enable you to cover distances you didn't think were possible. This is a great chance to test yourself mentally and physically while discovering new parts of NYC and the surrounding area. Look forward to seeing you all.

For this Healthy Neighborhoods Mobile Market volunteer effort in Harlem, please register through the City Harvest website prior to RSVP'ing with the group (your RSVP will be added here manually after doing so). Use the following link to register:


https://cityharvestvolunteers.civicore.com/index.php?section=indGpRegistrations&action=profile_conditional&fwID=4404


The Registration process is as follows:


• Follow the Group Sign-up Link above and click "New User" to create a new volunteer profile and click "Submit" (repeat or previously registered volunteers can simply log in)

• Read project details and click "Register" to confirm participation

• You will then receive a confirmation email and a reminder the day before the project


Only 10 volunteers are needed. All volunteers must be 18 years and older.

Description of Duties:

Volunteers will be stationed at 3-4 market tables, each supplied with thousands of pounds of fresh produce that they will help distribute to eligible market-goers. Sample produce items may include bananas, onions, cabbage, or potatoes. As the market-goers stop by each table, volunteers greet them-and then weigh and bag the produce. Note: All food is distributed free of charge and the volunteer effort WILL BE indoors in the event of cold temperatures / bad weather.


That's it for now. If you have any questions, feel free to give me (Daniel) a call or text at [masked]. Thanks!

About City Harvest Healthy Neighborhoods Program


Nearly 1.4 million New Yorkers are facing hunger and for many people that City Harvest serves, healthy food is unavailable and unaffordable. In turn, diseases related to poor nutrition – including diabetes and heart disease – tend to be concentrated where demand for emergency food is greatest.

As a natural extension of the anti-hunger work we began more than 30 years ago, City Harvest developed Healthy Neighborhoods programs to respond to the need for emergency food, improve access to fruits and vegetables for residents in low-income communities and provide nutrition education that will inspire affordable, healthy meal choices. Through our Healthy Neighborhoods programs, City Harvest partners with residents, community organizations, afterschool programs, and local businesses. Together we work to achieve a long-term impact in the fight against hunger by engaging residents in healthy choices and enhancing the local food landscape. Building off our nutrition education classes which began in 2000, and our Mobile Markets which began in 2004, City Harvest has since expanded Healthy Neighborhoods programs to high-need communities across the five boroughs.

results.description:
Overview
NOTE. Go all the way to the very end of Rider Hollow Rd to DEC parking area.
This loop hike climbs to the summit of Balsam Mountain, one of the highest peaks in the Catskills. This hike is not for beginners.


Details

Time: 5 hours
Difficulty: Strenuous
Length: 5.5 mils
Dogs: Allowed off leash

Carpooling: post on site if you want to carpool


Directions/ Trailhead GPS Coordinates[masked],[masked]

Take the New York State Thruway to Exit 19 (Kingston) and proceed west on Route 28 (following the signs to "Pine Hill"). Continue along Route 28 for about 35 miles. After passing through the Village of Pine Hill, you'll climb a rather steep hill and reach Highmount. At the top of the hill, follow signs for the Belleayre Ski Area and turn left onto Galli Curci Road, passing the entrances to the ski area on the left. Continue ahead for 4.9 miles from Route 28 (along the way, the name of the road changes to Todd Mountain Road). At the base of a long descent, turn left onto Rider Hollow Road, and proceed for about 2.5 miles to the parking area at the end of the road.


Description

Balsam Mountain is one of the 35 peaks in the Catskill Mountains that is over 3,500 feet in elevation. During the winter, it makes an ideal snowshoe hike under appropriate conditions. Trail conditions in the Catskills constantly change - especially in the winter - bring snowshoes/traction devices.

From the parking area, proceed ahead on the red-blazed Oliverea-Mapledale Trail, soon crossing a stream on a wood-and-steel bridge. A short distance beyond, the trail bears left and climbs higher on the hillside to avoid a trail section destroyed during Hurricane Irene in August 2011. In a third of a mile, the yellow-blazed Mine Hollow Trail begins on the left. The Mine Hollow Trail will be your return route, but for now, proceed ahead on the Oliverea-Mapledale Trail, which descends to recross the stream on a truss bridge. Beyond the lean-to, the trail recrosses the stream (and tributaries) four more times. After the fourth stream crossing, the trail begins to climb rather steeply, gaining about 750 feet in elevation over the next 0.8 mile. This is the most challenging portion of the hike. About 1.75 miles from the start, after a short level stretch, you'll reach a junction with the blue-blazed Pine Hill-West Branch Trail. Turn left and follow this blue-blazed trail for another 0.8 mile. Although you'll continue to climb, the grade is more moderate.

After a steep climb up a rock face, the trail becomes nearly level. Soon, you'll reach the highest point on the hike - the summit of Balsam Mountain. The summit elevation is 3,600 feet above sea level, and you've climbed about 1,600 feet to reach this point. No sign identifies the summit, but you can tell when you reach it as the trail begins to descend a little.

Continue along the trail for another 1,000 feet to a panoramic viewpoint to the right which overlooks the hamlet of Big Indian below. You'll want to take a break here to rest from your arduous ascent of this mountain.

Beyond the very steep section, the trail levels off and then climbs a little. Soon, you'll come to a junction with the yellow-blazed Mine Hollow Trail, which begins on the left. Turn left and follow this trail, which continues downhill. In half a mile, it makes a sharp right turn in a hemlock grove and continues to descend along a stream.

A mile from its start, the Mine Hollow Trail ends at a junction with the red-blazed Oliverea-Mapledale Trail. Bear right and follow this red-blazed trail for a third of a mile back to the parking area where the hike began.
results.name: Balsam Mountain Catskill High Peak

results.description: Its time for a Hartshorne Park Hike - where 200 foot plus hills and the Jersey shore come together! Please try to get to the meeting spot 10 minutes early, so we can start hiking by 9AM or shortly after.  This is an approximately 5 1/2 - 6 mile hike that should take us about  2 1/4 hours. Hiking shoes/boots are recommended.  Bring walking stick(s) if that's your preference.  And bringing a liter of water is a good idea.  There are a number of hills, plenty of ups and downs, uneven terrain, rocks and tree roots - and some great views!.  If you think this hike is too strenuous or you are unsure, there's always the typically flatter and usually shorter Sunday morning walk.  For those suffering "Monthly Hartshorne Hike withdrawal", we will mostly follow Red Bank Charlie's usual route - depending upon trail conditions and our hiking pace.  After the hike, for those interested, we will head to eat at the Town and Surf in Atlantic Highlands,  Great food, great service.  As usual, furry, four-legged friends are barred from the hike.

results.description:
We embark on a “history and culture” road trip - to Philadelphia on Saturday February 27, with visits to Valley Forge National Historical Park, the Philadelphia History Museum, and Reading Terminal Market.  Feel free to join us for all three destinations or just one or two.  Our itinerary is below.  Once in Philadelphia we’ll be joined by several local Meetup friends from the “City of Brotherly Love” throughout the day and they’ll add some local flavor and perspectives to our trip.  The goal of our trip will be to have a fun, educational, and entertaining weekend bringing people together to experience the history and culture of Philadelphia. 

Please note this trip will require a car, either driving yourself or carpooling, at least for the Valley Forge portion of the trip, because we’ll be taking a driving tour through the park with various stops along the way.

Not interested or able to drive?  No worries, we’re planning a second trip to Philadelphia (April or May?) where we’ll be downtown exclusively, in and around Independence National Park, which could 100% utilize public transportation to and from Philadelphia, as well as during our time in the city.  Stay tuned for future details.

Schedule

Valley Forge National Historical Park: Saturday 9:00 am - 11:30 am 

http://www.nps.gov/vafo/index.htm

Address = Valley Forge, PA

Visitor Center Exhibits & Film: 9:00 - 10:00

Indoor/Outdoor Caravan Driving Tour Through the Park: 10:00 - 11:30

We will drive to several stops throughout the park.  We will be both indoors and outdoors for this portion of the event.

Drive from Valley Forge National History Park to Whole Foods: 11:30 am - 11:45 am

Whole Foods Lunch: Saturday 11:45 am - 12:45 pm

http://www.wholefoodsmarket.com/stores/devon

Address = 821 Lancaster, Ave; Wayne, PA

Group lunch is on your own expense – each person purchasing their own meal.

Drive from Whole Foods to Philadelphia History Museum: 12:45 pm - 2:00 pm 

Shouldn't take nearly this long but allowing extra time to park, etc.

Philadelphia History Museum: Saturday 2:00 pm - 3:45 pm 

http://www.philadelphiahistory.org/

15 S 7th St, Philadelphia, PA

First Exhibit = City Stories: An Introduction to Philadelphia

Second Exhibit = The Ordinary, the Extraordinary, and the Unknown: The Power of Objects

Third Exhibit = TBD as time allows and/or your personal preference.

There will be a $10 per person admission fee payable directly to the museum upon our arrival.

Walk from Philadelphia History Museum to Reading Terminal Market: 3:45 – 4:15

Shouldn't take nearly this long but allowing extra time.

Reading Terminal Market Dinner: Saturday 4:15 pm – 6:00 pm 

http://www.readingterminalmarket.org/

Address: 51 N 12th St, Philadelphia, PA

Group dinner on your own expense – each person purchasing their own meal.

Drive from Reading Terminal Market back home : 6:00 – ?

Unfortunately we will not be making anyone’s travel plans to Philadelphia and back, you will need to do that yourself.  However, if you are looking to carpool post a message on the events Message board at the bottom of the event description - you will need to work out those plans on your own.  To repeat, we are not responsible for anyone’s travel or lodging plans.


We will be spending the day Saturday sightseeing 3 great attractions in Philadelphia: Valley Forge National Historical Park, Philadelphia History Museum and Reading Terminal Market.  Feel free to join us for all three destinations or just one or two.  Once in Philadelphia we’ll be joined by several friends from the “City of Brotherly Love” throughout the day and they’ll add some local flavor and perspectives to our trip.

Registration

This trip has no registration fee.  There will be an additional cost for incidentals such as food and parking, plus a $10.00 per person admission fee to the Philadelphia History Museum – payable directly to the museum at the time of admission, not to our Meetup group.

Please keep your RSVP up-to-date if your plans change so we know how many people to expect.

Additional Questions

Please read the above event description carefully.  If we overlooked any items that can’t be determined through the various web links above and/or through Google then please let me know.

Thank you!

Robert Kelleman & Michele Ballard

[masked]

[masked]

REGISTER HERE

“Authentic, straightforward truth straight from the source field.”
– Deepak Chopra on the work of Paul Selig

Award-winning author and channel Paul Selig will lead an intensive, channeled, day-long workshop where you will work directly with his Guides and their practical program for achieving personal growth and overcoming the obstacles that are hindering you on the way. Through lectures, attunements, Q&A and energy work, Paul and his Guides will lead you on an unprecedented journey of self-development to achieve new levels of alignment, healing and life purpose.

The workshop will take place in the comfortable, quiet and intimate Helvetica Room at the Ink48 Hotel. This is a 10-minute walk from the subway stations at Times Square and Port Authority Bus Terminal and a 10-minute cab ride from Penn Station and Grand Central Station

In this workshop, you will:

* Receive individual instruction and teaching from Paul’s Guides
* Become attuned to a higher frequency in a way that you can trust and feel
* Learn to send and receive healing energies
* Develop your own abilities as an empath
* Free yourself from patterns of limitation and fear
* Gain tools to transform your life and awaken to your own divine nature

From a recent workshop attendee: 

“To witness Paul work is to witness true wonder and magic. I wouldn’t believe it, unless I saw it, but Paul’s eyes even changed color when he worked! The energy in the room was palpable and I can honestly say that I left this workshop a different person…I’d even venture to say that the workshop made my personal Top 5 life experiences list. Real energy was moved and I can’t wait to attend Paul’s workshop again next year.” – Samantha Feld Samuelson

ABOUT PAUL SELIG

Paul Selig is a writer, empath and conscious channel. He received his Master’s Degree from Yale and served on the faculty of NYU for over 25 years. A spiritual experience in 1987 left him clairvoyant. His breakthrough works of channeled literature, I Am the Word, The Book of Love and Creation, The Book of Knowing and Worth and The Book of Mastery have quickly become the most important and celebrated expression of channeling since A Course in Miracles rose to prominence in the 1970s. Paul’s workshops have won a growing following around the world for their depth, intimacy, and psychological insight.
